This shift is partly driven by increasing investor interest in actively managed strategies. Despite a recent resurgence for BlackRock's passive lineup, JPMorgan's actively managed funds like JEPI are challenging the traditional duopoly in the US ETF market.

title: Diversify Emerging Markets Exposure Away From Xi’s Control With ROAM
summary: Many emerging markets investors are seeking to diversify away from Chinese companies while maintaining performance. The Hartford Multifactor Emerging Markets ETF (ROAM) offers a solution by underweighting mega-cap tech and China compared to its peers and the MSCI Emerging Markets index. ROAM has notably outperformed competitor ETFs like VWO, SPEM, and SCHE over various periods, providing broad emerging market exposure with a multifactor strategy designed to reduce volatility.

title: HDFC Merger Makes Corporate History
summary: The merger between India's largest mortgage lender, Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC), and its subsidiary HDFC Bank resulted in the creation of the world's fourth-largest bank. This $40 billion all-stock merger also made the combined entity the most valuable Indian company, boasting an approximately $157 billion market capitalization. The integration aims to leverage extensive distribution networks for cross-selling and provide mortgages to HDFC Bank customers.

title: News | Blackstone Reaches $1 Trillion in Assets at a Time When Real Estate Performance Trails
summary: Blackstone Group has achieved a historic milestone, reaching $1 trillion in assets under management, making it the first alternative asset manager to do so. This announcement coincided with its second-quarter earnings report, which saw a nearly 39% drop in distributable earnings, primarily due to underperformance in its real estate segment amid higher interest rates and economic uncertainty. Despite the challenges in real estate, particularly office spaces, Blackstone identifies significant investment opportunities in areas like global logistics, digital infrastructure, energy transition, life sciences, and lending, also noting improving inflation indicators and strong growth in Asia.

title: Dow Theory Letters - First Trust Dynamic Europe Equity Income Fund Declares its Monthly Common Share Distribution of $0.07 Per Share for August
authors: First Trust Dynamic Europe Equity Income Fund
summary: The First Trust Dynamic Europe Equity Income Fund (NYSE: FDEU) has announced a monthly common share distribution of $0.07 per share for August, payable on August 15, 2023. The Fund operates under a managed distribution policy, allowing it to distribute long-term capital gains more frequently. It primarily seeks to provide a high level of current income and capital appreciation by investing in European equity securities and utilizing a dynamic currency hedging process.

title: Blackstone Becomes First $1 Trillion Private Equity Manager (Published 2023)
summary: Blackstone has become the first private equity firm to manage over $1 trillion in assets, a milestone that places it among mutual fund and banking giants. This growth reflects its diversification beyond traditional leveraged buyouts into various financial sectors like real estate, credit trading, and infrastructure investing. Despite this success, the firm faces challenges from economic headwinds, including rising interest rates impacting its private equity division and investor withdrawals from its real estate fund.

title: 5%대 금리 내건 'SOFR ETF', 달러 급락에 수익률 '마이너스'
summary: SOFR ETFS, which garnered hundreds of billions of won by promising over 5% interest and exchange rate gains from a strong dollar, have recorded losses recently due to the sudden depreciation of the dollar. Despite originally targeting a strong dollar, the shift in the US Federal Reserve's monetary policy outlook has caused the dollar's value to drop, leading to 3-4% losses for these ETFs. However, asset management companies suggest the risk is minimal for investors holding dollars, as the SOFR benchmark for dollar-denominated investments has never shown a negative return.

title: Deal Diary: BofA, Smith Anderson Work With First Citizens on SVB
summary: First Citizens BancShares Inc. engaged Smith Anderson and Bank of America Securities Inc. for legal and financial advice, respectively, on its agreement to acquire deposits and loans from Silicon Valley Bridge Bank NA from the FDIC. The FDIC, in turn, received financial advice from Piper Sandler Cos. and Guggenheim Partners LLC for the deal. The transaction involved First Citizens buying approximately $72 billion of the bridge bank’s assets at a discount and assuming $110 billion in assets, $56 billion in deposits, and $72 billion in loans.

title: BofA profit surges on interest income, surprise investment banking gain
summary: Bank of America (BAC.N) reported a second-quarter profit that beat Wall Street estimates, driven by increased interest income from loan payments and better-than-expected investment banking and trading performance. The bank projected an 8% increase in net interest income for the year, and its stock surged 4.2% following the positive results, despite growing pressure on its net interest margin. Investment banking net income surged 76%, and sales and trading revenue also outperformed expectations with a 3% increase.

title: Cintas (CTAS) Stock Price at ATH of $505 Posting Positive Earnings
summary: Cintas (CTAS) reported strong quarterly earnings for the fiscal fourth quarter ending May 2023, surpassing revenue and profit estimates for the fourth consecutive time. This positive performance and increased demand for its products, coupled with lowered expenses, led to its stock price reaching an all-time high of $505. Several major banks, including Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase, have issued "buy" or "overweight" ratings and increased their price targets for CTAS stock.

title: Bank of America tops analysts’ expectations amid higher interest rates
summary: Bank of America (BAC) reported second-quarter earnings that surpassed Wall Street expectations, with 88 cents per share against an anticipated 84 cents, and revenue of $25.33 billion exceeding the expected $25.05 billion. The strong performance was driven by higher interest income and robust Wall Street operations, including an 18% jump in fixed income trading revenue. CEO Brian Moynihan noted a healthy U.S. economy and resilient job market contributing to the bank's organic growth.

title: Citigroup profit drops 36% on trading slump, rising expenses
summary: Citigroup's second-quarter profit fell 36% to $2.92 billion, or $1.33 per share, largely due to a trading slump and rising expenses including layoffs and credit loss provisions. Despite this, the bank beat analyst estimates for adjusted profit per share and saw an 18% increase in net interest income, raising its full-year guidance for NII. CEO Jane Fraser noted a delayed rebound in investment banking and client caution due to the debt ceiling.

title: The Supreme Court's judgment in Philipp v Barclays: key takeaways for financial institutions executing customer payments
summary: The Supreme Court's judgment in Philipp v Barclays Bank UK plc has clarified the scope of the Quincecare duty, particularly regarding "authorised push payment" (APP) fraud. The Court ruled that banks do not owe an alleged duty to prevent customers from making payments they themselves have authorized, even if those customers are victims of fraud, because a bank's primary duty is to execute valid instructions promptly. However, it confirmed the Quincecare duty applies when an agent of the customer provides instructions and there are reasonable grounds to suspect fraud, requiring the bank to make inquiries.

title: BBCA ETF: Structurally Better Than EWC, But Limited Incentive To Go Long Now
summary: The JPMorgan BetaBuilders Canada ETF (BBCA) offers coverage to over 82 stocks from the broad Canadian market and has accumulated nearly twice the assets under management (AUM) of the iShares MSCI Canada ETF (EWC) despite being younger, largely due to its lower expense ratio and superior yield differential. However, the article suggests limited incentive to invest in BBCA currently, citing potential challenges for Canadian banks in H2-23 and valuations that are not considered cheap.

title: J.P. Morgan Asset Management Hires Rachel Betton as Senior Fixed Income Portfolio Manager
summary: J.P. Morgan Asset Management has hired Rachel Betton as a managing director and senior portfolio manager for its Municipal Strategies Team, focusing on municipal high yield within its Global Fixed Income, Currency & Commodities business. Betton joins from PIMCO, where she spent ten years as a portfolio manager for various municipal strategies. Rick Taormina, Head of Tax Aware Strategies, expressed enthusiasm for her extensive experience and its potential to identify opportunities for clients.

title: Blockchain Tech Gains Important Supporters
summary: Major financial institutions and professional investors are showing increased enthusiasm for blockchain technology and its applications, benefiting ETFs like the Invesco Alerian Galaxy Blockchain Users and Decentralized Commerce ETF (BLKC). Companies like JPMorgan Chase and Goldman Sachs are expanding their blockchain-based solutions for payments and asset tokenization, signaling growing adoption. This trend highlights blockchain's potential to create trading efficiencies and new opportunities, as well as enhance payment processes for both fintech and traditional financial firms.

title: Sonida Senior Living Defaults on Fannie Mae Debt
summary: Sonida Senior Living has defaulted on a $427 million loan package from Fannie Mae, leading to a forbearance agreement covering more than half of its properties. The Dallas-based operator will make a $5 million payment and received loan extensions on 18 properties, with Conversant Capital providing an additional $13.5 million equity investment as a guarantee. Sonida is also negotiating to resolve "non-compliance" on $72 million in debt with Protective Life Insurance, following $54 million in losses in 2022.

title: PlainsCapital Bank Data Breach Confirmed, 16M Users At Risk
summary: PlainsCapital Bank, a subsidiary of Hilltop Holdings Inc., confirmed a data breach linked to the MOVEit vulnerability, potentially exposing the personal information of over 16 million individuals. The compromised data includes sensitive customer details such as social security and account numbers, although the bank states there's no evidence of identity theft or fraudulent activity detected so far. The Clop ransomware group exploited the MOVEit vulnerability, leading to a series of data breaches impacting numerous companies.

title: James Crown, Chicago Businessman and Avid Philanthropist, Dies at 70 (Published 2023)
summary: James Crown, a prominent Chicago businessman and philanthropist, died at age 70 in a single-car accident. A scion of the wealthy Crown family, he held significant positions at companies like General Dynamics and JPMorgan Chase, and was an early supporter of Barack Obama's political career. He was also the chief executive of the family's investment firm, Henry Crown & Company.

title: Alexandria's Burke & Herbert Bank to close Crystal City branch
summary: Alexandria's Burke & Herbert Bank, one of the region's oldest banks, plans to close its Crystal City branch. The bank, founded in 1852, intends to replace the 40-year-old branch with a smaller, technology-focused location.

title: India's HDFC Bank completes $40 billion takeover of the country's largest mortgage lender. Here’s what it means
summary: India's largest private lender HDFC Bank has completed its $40 billion merger with Housing Development Finance Corporation, the country's biggest mortgage lender. This merger creates the world's fourth largest bank by market cap and is expected to drive significant growth and client expansion through synergies like lower funding costs and cross-selling opportunities. The deal also positions the new entity for potential inclusion in the MSCI Emerging Market Index, attracting more global investors.

title: GSR II Meteora Acquisition Corp. (GSRM) Shareholders Approve Bitcoin Depot Deal
summary: GSR II Meteora Acquisition Corp. (GSRM) shareholders have approved the combination with Bitcoin Depot, with a final redemption rate of about 89%, leaving approximately $35 million in trust. The deal was bolstered by an additional $50 million in new funding through a PIPE and non-redemption agreements, exceeding the $8 million minimum cash condition. Bitcoin Depot, an Atlanta-based company with 6,440 ATM and retail payment locations, will merge in a $755 million combination initially announced in August 2022.

title: CFO working capital series
summary: This series by CFO and The Hackett Group provides an exclusive deep dive into annual working capital findings, benchmarking the performance of the 1,000 largest U.S. companies. It tracks key metrics like cash conversion cycle, days sales outstanding, days payable outstanding, and days inventory outstanding. The articles within the series analyze the factors influencing these results and the challenges organizations encounter in managing receivables, inventory, and payables to optimize liquidity.

title: Inflation-safe ETFs see record $17 billion exit
summary: Exchange-traded funds designed to protect against inflation have experienced a record $17 billion exodus over 10 consecutive months of outflows, despite persistent price pressures. This significant withdrawal, seen in funds like the iShares TIPS Bond ETF (TIP) and Schwab U.S. TIPS ETF (SCHP), is attributed to a bruising period of underperformance due to soaring real yields. Despite this, there's renewed demand for Treasury Inflation Protected Securities (TIPS) in the primary market, although some asset managers remain wary due to duration risk and the Federal Reserve's stance on interest rates.

title: Agree Realty Announces $350 Million 5.5-Year Term Loan
summary: Agree Realty Corporation announced it has secured commitments for an unsecured $350 million 5.5-year term loan. The company anticipates the interest rate on the loan to be fixed at 4.52% due to forward starting swaps. This financing bolsters Agree Realty's balance sheet and fits well into their debt maturity schedule, with no material debt maturities until 2028.

title: Purell parent Gojo’s sale hits roadblock
summary: The sale of Purell parent company Gojo Industries has hit a roadblock due to inflated price expectations, with potential buyers finding the $2 billion-plus valuation too high. Despite receiving final offers this month, the company's adjusted EBITDA suggests a much lower multiple than what Gojo is seeking. This situation reflects a broader market trend of declining valuations and deal flow returning to pre-COVID-19 levels, impacting companies like Gojo that saw a sales surge during the pandemic.

title: What is Bitcoin ETF?
summary: This article explains what a Bitcoin ETF is, how it works, and its advantages and disadvantages. It highlights that current Bitcoin ETFs track futures contracts, while spot Bitcoin ETFs, which directly track Bitcoin's price, are still awaiting regulatory approval, with BlackRock's proposal being a potential "game changer." The article discusses the implications for investors and the broader crypto market if a spot Bitcoin ETF is approved.

title: News | Bank of America To Expand Into Nine New US Markets by 2026
summary: Bank of America is expanding its financial center network by opening 55 new branches in 2023 and entering nine new U.S. markets over the next four years, including Nebraska, Wisconsin, Alabama, and Louisiana. This expansion includes optimizing its network, renovating existing centers, and increasing its community banking centers, aiming to serve clients with both digital and in-person banking needs. The move positions Bank of America to compete with JPMorgan Chase in branch presence across the country.

title: Frost Bank plans hiring spree, new branches in Austin
summary: Frost Bank plans to significantly expand its presence in the Austin area by roughly doubling its 17 financial centers and hiring over a hundred new employees by 2026. The bank, which last year was a top deposit holder in the region, aims to be the "best" bank rather than the biggest, emphasizing its strategy amidst recent banking challenges.

title: Financial service hub to open in Stamford CT office complex
summary: Three financial services firms—Altrinsic Global Advisors, Cramer Rosenthal McGlynn, and Valitana—have signed leases at First Stamford Place, one of Connecticut's largest office complexes, relocating from Greenwich. The move is attributed to Stamford's compelling proposition, including high-quality office space, convenient location, access to transit, and amenities, with some firms citing excessive Greenwich cost premiums. This relocation highlights Stamford's efforts to attract businesses, despite its higher office vacancy rates compared to Greenwich.

title: Tampa hotel gets $20 million in financing
summary: Linchris Hotel Corp., owner of the Sheraton Tampa Brandon Hotel, has secured $20.07 million in financing through Ready Capital, with JLL Capital Markets representing Linchris. The 266-unit hotel, purchased by Linchris in 2016 for $15.84 million, features extensive meeting space and is the company's only Florida property. The terms and purpose of the financing were not disclosed.

title: Customers Bank Buys $631M Venture Loan Portfolio from FDIC
summary: Customers Bank has acquired a $631 million venture loan portfolio from the FDIC, along with 30 staff members who previously managed these loans for Signature Bank. This acquisition expands Customers Bank's venture banking services into new regions and is expected to improve its liquidity profile through the addition of low-cost, core deposits. The deal is part of the FDIC's larger sale of assets from the collapsed Signature Bank and Silicon Valley Bank.

title: JPMorganChase launches global pledge to improve security across sectors and borders
summary: JPMorganChase has signed the Cyber Risk Management Pledge by the Coalition to Reduce Cyber Risk (CR2) along with 37 other organizations. This commitment aims to improve cybersecurity practices across various industries and borders by advancing common frameworks and international standards. The initiative seeks to address the growing complexity of cyber threats and the fragmented regulatory landscape that makes global cybersecurity management challenging.

title: Issuer League: VanEck, Capital Group Hit ETF AUM Milestones
summary: VanEck and Capital Group achieved significant ETF AUM milestones, collectively adding over $1.5 billion in inflows. VanEck's Morningstar Wide Moat ETF (MOAT) saw substantial inflows, boosting the firm's AUM past $60 billion, while Capital Group surpassed $10 billion in AUM, largely due to its Capital Group Dividend Value ETF (CGDV). This growth highlights strong performance in specific ETFs for both firms.

title: What Is Racial Justice Investing & Why Should You Consider It?
summary: Racial justice investing is a method of socially responsible investing (SRI) that focuses on companies actively supporting racial justice for Black, Indigenous, and People of Colour (BIPOC) communities. This approach allows investors to make a positive social impact while diversifying their portfolios, addressing issues such as racial equality in management, gun control, prison reform, and police reform. Investors can participate by directly investing in BIPOC-owned businesses, selecting companies with strong racial justice policies, or utilizing specialized ETFs and robo-advisors.

title: Enhancing Returns and Flexibility: The Case for Switching to Active Fixed Income ETFs
summary: This article argues that active management in fixed income, particularly through active Fixed Income ETFs, outperforms passive strategies due to flaws in traditional bond indexes and the benefits of ETFs like lower costs and increased liquidity. A J.P. Morgan report is cited as evidence, showing active intermediate core and core plus funds providing excess annualized returns over the Bloomberg US Aggregate Bond Index. The author recommends that investors consider switching to active fixed income ETFs for a portion of their portfolios, listing several top-performing options.

title: Inside The Global 2000: JPMorgan Is Again The World’s Largest Company As Berkshire Hathaway Falls
summary: JPMorgan Chase has reclaimed its position as the world's largest company on the Forbes Global 2000 list, driven by widening net interest margins and its role in stabilizing the banking sector. Meanwhile, Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway fell significantly in rank due to investment portfolio declines, despite strong operating profits. The article highlights the increased presence of U.S. companies on the list, contrasting with China's thinning ranks, and notes the significant market value growth of top U.S. stocks over the last decade.

title: Can Goldman Sachs and Citigroup catch up on hiring advisors?
summary: Goldman Sachs and Citigroup, having largely missed the post-2008 boom in financial advisor hiring, are now attempting to bolster their wealth management operations. This endeavor faces significant challenges as the market for financial advisors is highly competitive, with established players already having a substantial head start. Both banks will likely need to make strategic acquisitions, potentially overpaying, to effectively compete for top talent and market share.

title: Capital One buys Velocity Black
summary: Capital One has acquired Velocity Black, a digital concierge service specializing in travel, entertainment, shopping, and dining, to enhance its consumer offerings. This acquisition is part of Capital One's broader strategy to encourage credit card point usage and follows other moves like launching Capital One Landing and acquiring Wikibuy. The deal aligns with a trend of banks expanding into services that help customers utilize credit card rewards and improve overall customer experience.

title: Financials In Focus Ahead Of CPI And The Fed: VFH A Buy (NYSEARCA:VFH)
summary: The World Bank has updated its global real GDP growth forecast, increasing 2023's outlook to 2.1% but lowering 2024 expectations slightly. The Vanguard Financials Index Fund ETF (VFH) is recommended as a "Buy" due to its low valuation and high yield, despite potential risks. Its upcoming performance will likely be influenced by the CPI report and Fed meeting, with a historically positive period anticipated in late June.

title: Capital One Buys Concierge App Offering Dolomite Skiing, Sperm Whale Swimming
summary: Capital One Financial Corp. has agreed to acquire the digital concierge service Velocity Black. This acquisition aims to enhance Capital One's offerings in premium credit cards and luxury markets, directly competing with American Express Co. and JPMorgan Chase & Co. Velocity Black specializes in luxury travel, entertainment, shopping, and dining, having previously raised $28 million in venture capital.

title: As New Services Roil P2P, Fiserv Gets Set to Shut Down Its Popmoney Network
summary: Fiserv Inc. is discontinuing its Popmoney peer-to-peer payments service on June 30, prioritizing the bank-owned Zelle network due to its success and growing demand for faster payments. The move comes amidst an increasingly competitive P2P market, with pressure from services like Zelle, PayPal, Venmo, and the upcoming real-time payments service from the Federal Reserve, as well as Visa's new interoperability network. Fiserv acquired Popmoney's originator, CashEdge, in 2011 and integrated it into its services.

title: Franklin to Add Retirement AUM With Putnam Acquisition
summary: Franklin Templeton announced its agreement to acquire Putnam Investments for $925 million from Power Corp. of Canada. This acquisition aims to boost Franklin Templeton's asset management scale and capabilities in the retirement plan sector, increasing its defined contribution assets under management to approximately $90 billion. The deal also includes Great-West committing $25 billion to Franklin Templeton's specialist investment managers and taking a 6.2% stake in Franklin.

title: Cummins Spinoff Atmus Raises $275 Million in IPO
summary: Cummins Inc. spinoff Atmus Filtration Technologies Inc. raised $275 million in its initial public offering, with shares rising 11% in their trading debut. The company, which manufactures filters for commercial vehicles and other equipment, has a market value of $1.8 billion and its IPO marks the seventh-biggest on a U.S. exchange this year. Cummins retains an 83% ownership stake in Atmus.

title: Culture Wars Hit Capital One
summary: Capital One has had its New York City deposits frozen due to its failure to submit required anti-discrimination plans, a move by the NYC Comptroller amidst larger "culture wars" affecting banks nationwide. This action by NYC contrasts with states like Texas and Florida, which have taken steps to ban financial institutions that they perceive as not aligning with conservative values regarding ESG practices. The situation highlights divergent approaches by different states and municipalities in holding financial institutions accountable for their policies.

title: Latham & Watkins Advises the Underwriters in EVgo’s Public Equity Offering
summary: Latham & Watkins LLP advised the underwriters in EVgo Inc.'s public offering of 29,411,765 shares of Class A common stock priced at US$4.25 per share. J.P. Morgan, Evercore ISI, and Goldman Sachs & Co. LLC were lead book-running managers. The offering, which included a 30-day option for underwriters to purchase additional shares, closed on May 22, 2023.

title: James Gorman steps down as Morgan Stanley CEO
summary: Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman announced his intention to retire within the next 12 months, having led the firm since 2010 through the aftermath of the 2008 recession. He will remain as executive chairman of the board, and the company is considering three internal candidates for his successor. Gorman's tenure was marked by significant acquisitions and a strategic focus on wealth management, which now accounts for a substantial portion of the firm's revenue.

title: Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman to step down
summary: Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman announced he will step down within a year and transition to executive chairman. Having led the bank since 2009, Gorman's departure comes as the sector faces higher interest rates, though Morgan Stanley has diversified its business lines under his leadership. The bank is preparing for succession with three internal candidates identified, and its stock dipped slightly following the announcement.

title: Bridging traditional and synthetic finance
summary: Wematch, co-founded by David Raccat, aims to be the global leader in synthetic trading and traditional lending with its cross-asset platform. The company is expanding its reach beyond dealer-to-dealer to dealer-to-client activities, focusing on total return swaps (TRS) and addressing hard-to-borrow securities and ETF synthetics. Wematch also emphasizes the blurring lines between synthetic and traditional lending, positioning itself to support the industry's shift towards more efficient financing strategies.

title: Land O'Lakes says US carbon farming payouts top $5 million in 2022
summary: Land O'Lakes' Truterra unit paid U.S. farmers $5.1 million in 2022 for sequestering 262,000 metric tons of carbon, an increase from $4 million in 2021. This program is part of a growing trend among agricultural companies like Corteva and Bayer to capitalize on demand for environmental credits by promoting sustainable farming practices. Microsoft Corp is a major buyer of Truterra's carbon removal credits.

title: Hungary and the EU: A deepening divide
summary: Hungary's relationship with the European Union is increasingly strained due to rule-of-law disputes and differing views on issues like migration and the Ukraine war. While most Hungarians still favor EU membership, declining support and intensifying sanctions from Brussels are putting pressure on the Orban government. The article explores the economic ties, historical context, and current challenges that define this deepening divide, with scenarios suggesting potential future developments.

title: Deal Diary: TPG Turns to Weil on Angelo Gordon Deal
summary: TPG Inc. is acquiring Angelo, Gordon & Co. LP for $2.7 billion in cash and stock, with Weil, Gotshal & Manges LLP acting as lead counsel for TPG. Angelo Gordon is advised by Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison LLP. The transaction involved numerous legal and financial advisors for both parties and is expected to close in Q4 2023.

title: Eve Holding Tests Electric Flying Vehicle in Wind Tunnel, Ready for Production in 2026
summary: Eve Holding Inc., a Brazilian electric aircraft company controlled by Embraer, has successfully completed wind tunnel testing for its electric vertical take-off and landing vehicle (eVTOL), also known as a flying taxi. This crucial step moves them closer to commercial operations by 2026, with plans to select key equipment suppliers and begin building their first full-size prototype this year. The company boasts a backlog of nearly 2,800 orders and is supported by investors like United Airlines and Rolls-Royce.

title: BankUnited seizes recruiting opportunity in wake of failure
summary: BankUnited has capitalized on recent regional bank failures by hiring a new corporate banking team from the defunct First Republic Bank. This move expands BankUnited's presence in the New York metropolitan area and aligns with its strategy to grow its commercial-and-industrial loan portfolio and attract deposits. The company's executives view the current market "chaos" as an opportunity for expansion and talent acquisition.

title: Institutional investors in Ameriprise Financial, Inc. (NYSE:AMP) lost 3.8% last week but have reaped the benefits of longer-term growth
summary: Institutional investors holding Ameriprise Financial, Inc. (NYSE:AMP) experienced a 3.8% loss last week, despite having benefited from longer-term growth. Institutions collectively own 86% of the company, indicating significant influence over its share price. The Vanguard Group, Inc., BlackRock, Inc., and State Street Global Advisors, Inc. are the largest shareholders, with the top 15 shareholders owning 50% of the company.

title: Bank failures make construction loans even more challenging
summary: The recent bank failures have exacerbated the difficulty for developers to secure construction loans, particularly impacting the multifamily sector. This tightening of lending standards by regional banks, coupled with higher interest rates from the Federal Reserve, is expected to significantly reduce new apartment construction starts. While private lenders are attempting to fill the void, their capacity is insufficient to fully offset the reduced lending from traditional banks.

title: President holds meeting with world's largest investment company on creation of fund for rebuilding Ukraine
summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy met with BlackRock, the world's largest asset management company, to discuss establishing an investment fund for Ukraine's economic recovery. This fund aims to attract substantial public and private capital for large-scale business projects in various sectors, including energy, agriculture, and IT. Both parties emphasized the historic opportunity this presents for strengthening Ukraine's investment climate and initiating active reconstruction immediately after the cessation of hostilities.

title: U.S. banking system ‘is the envy of the world,’ Apollo Global Management CEO says
summary: Apollo Global Management CEO Marc Rowan discusses the state of the U.S. banking system, the acquisition of First Republic Bank by JPMorgan, and the future of regional banking. He highlights the strength of the U.S. capital system and the opportunities for alternative investments like private credit in the current economic environment. Rowan suggests that while the asset world might feel a recession, the wider economy shows strong employment and wage gains.

title: Even More Reasons to Allocate to EM Debt
summary: This article highlights compelling reasons to invest in emerging market (EM) debt, pointing out that many investment-grade and high-yield EMs exhibit a lower perceived risk of default than the U.S. This is evidenced by the U.S.'s 1-year credit default swap (CDS) spread being wider than a significant number of these EM countries. The author argues that concerns over the U.S. debt ceiling debate further underscore the relative safety and attractiveness of EM debt.

title: IVOL Continues to Outperform During Peak Bank Stress
summary: The article discusses how the Quadratic Interest Rate Volatility and Inflation Hedge ETF (IVOL) continues to outperform during periods of banking sector stress, such as the recent issues with First Republic Bank. IVOL, which invests in TIPS and uses OTC fixed income options to capture interest rate volatility, has shown strong returns amidst these market conditions. The fund's strategy and performance make it a notable consideration for investors looking to position themselves against bank stress.

title: Circle turns to Customers Bank for USDC payment settlement, looks to recover market position
summary: Following the collapse of Signature Bank, Circle has partnered with Customers Bank and its CBIT platform for USDC payment settlement to ensure 24/7 liquidity. Circle's market cap decreased significantly after holding reserves at Silicon Valley Bank, and the company is now seeking global banking partners and hopes for legislative progress in the U.S. regarding stablecoins.

title: Global finance 'giant' Win Bischoff lauded by industry as dies aged 81
summary: Win Bischoff, a highly influential Anglo-German banker who worked for major financial institutions like Lloyds Banking Group, Citigroup, and JP Morgan Securities, has passed away at 81. Industry leaders remember him as a "giant" for his astute leadership, particularly during the 2007 financial crisis, and for his integrity and transformative work in banking. He was instrumental in steering banks through crises and was awarded a knighthood for his services to banking.

title: JPMorgan Overthrows JPMorgan for Crown of Largest Actively Managed ETF
summary: JPMorgan's Equity Premium Income ETF (JEPI) has become the largest actively managed exchange-traded fund, surpassing the JPMorgan Ultra-Short Income ETF (JPST). JEPI's assets reached $24.7 billion after a $101 million inflow, narrowly overtaking JPST's $24.6 billion. This shift highlights a cross-asset hunt for income, benefiting both stock and bond ETFs.

title: 자산운용사, 달러 파킹 놓고 격돌…이자 쏠쏠한 금리 ETF 다양화
summary: 국내 자산운용사들이 미국 기준금리 인상 전망에 따라 미국 무위험지표금리(SOFR)에 투자하는 상장지수펀드(ETF) 상품을 잇달아 출시하고 있다. 한국투자신탁운용과 삼성자산운용이 이미 상품을 내놓았으며, 미래에셋, 한화, KB자산운용도 SOFR ETF 출시를 앞두고 있다. 이 상품들은 달러 변동성을 줄이고 연 4.8% 수준의 무위험 금리를 수취할 수 있어 개인 및 기관 투자자들에게 매력적인 '달러 파킹' 수단으로 주목받고 있다.

title: Check out Jpmorgan Betabuilders U.S. Treasury Bond 1-3 Year ETF's stock price (BBSB) in real time
summary: This article provides real-time stock price information for the Jpmorgan Betabuilders U.S. Treasury Bond 1-3 Year ETF (BBSB). It includes key financial metrics such as the current price, 52-week range, dividend yield, and trading volume. The article also lists essential dates like the ex-dividend date and provides a summary of company news and events.

title: Gold price (monthly chart), amid the noise
summary: This article analyzes the gold price from a monthly chart perspective, suggesting a potential breakout despite recent market "noise" and a $22/oz drop. The author highlights the Sprott Physical Gold and Silver Trust (CEF) and positive technical indicators, while downplaying the "banking crisis" as a long-term driver for gold, emphasizing broader macro factors. The piece also touches on managing risk and opportunity for subscribers.

title: 'We've seen this movie before,' says Waterfall Asset co-founder on trouble in commercial real estate
summary: Tom Capasse, co-founder of Waterfall Asset Management and CEO of Ready Capital, believes a wave of distress is imminent in the estimated $21 trillion U.S. commercial real-estate market. He attributes this to higher interest rates, tighter credit, and lingering pandemic effects, despite not predicting a complete market crash. Waterfall Asset recently closed a new $485 million Atlas Fund specifically to invest in commercial real estate, distressed loans, and bonds.

title: Amid banking industry turmoil, JPMorgan Chase profits jump 52 percent
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. reported a 52% increase in first-quarter profits, driven by higher interest rates and a significant influx of deposits following the failures of Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank. This strong performance, along with solid results from Citigroup and Wells Fargo, suggests stability among major financial institutions despite broader banking turmoil. CEO Jamie Dimon noted the generally healthy U.S. economy but cautioned about looming "storm clouds" given the recent industry unrest.

title: Canada’s RBC Tops List of Banks Financing the Climate Crisis
summary: A report titled “Banking on Climate Chaos” reveals that Canada’s Royal Bank of Canada (RBC) was the world's worst funder of fossil fuel projects in 2022, providing $42.5 billion, despite its public climate commitments. Globally, the 60 largest banks have funneled $5.5 trillion to fossil fuel companies since the 2015 Paris Agreement, often using loopholes to finance projects like the Coastal GasLink Pipeline and the Willow project. The article highlights a disconnect between banks' greenwashing efforts and their continued substantial financial support for the fossil fuel industry, calling for systemic change to shift capital towards decarbonization.

title: Royal Bank of Canada becomes top financier for fossil fuel industry
summary: Royal Bank of Canada has surpassed JPMorgan as the largest financier of the fossil fuel industry in 2022, providing $42.1bn in funding. Canadian banks are increasingly taking on the role of "lenders of last resort" for carbon-intensive projects, with Canadian banks having provided $862bn to fossil fuel companies since the signing of the Paris Agreement. Despite a 16% drop in overall fossil fuel financing from the world's 60 largest banks in 2022, the report highlights the continued significant role banks play in funding the industry.

title: Glencore sweetens bid for Teck as April 26 vote looms | Hotter Commodities
summary: Glencore has enhanced its offer for Teck Resources by including a cash component in its bid, as a crucial shareholder vote approaches on April 26. Teck's dual-class share structure gives significant voting power to its A shareholders, primarily the Keevil family and Sumitomo Metal Mining Co, who have already rejected Glencore's proposal. Glencore's strategy now focuses on convincing Teck's B shareholders to vote against Teck's proposed separation, potentially strengthening Glencore's future bargaining position.

title: La presidenta del Banco Santander se reúne con Boric en su fugaz visita a Chile
summary: Ana Botín, president of Banco Santander, made a brief visit to Chile, where she met with President Gabriel Boric and Finance Minister Mario Marcel. Her visit aimed to reaffirm Santander's commitment to Chile and to learn about new initiatives led by Román Blanco, the new CEO in the country since August 2022. Santander's operations in Chile have been highly profitable, with utility reaching $808 million last year, representing about 8% of the holding's global profits.

title: Pavilion Payments plots growth
summary: Pavilion Payments, recently acquired by Parthenon Capital Partners from Global Payments, plans significant growth by investing in technology and expanding its workforce. The company aims to capitalize on the digital transformation within the cash-heavy gaming payments industry and is actively exploring acquisition opportunities. Pavilion Payments processed approximately $10 billion last year and serves around 400 customers in the casino and online gaming sectors.

title: Veris Residential completes $420 million sale of 1.9 million sq. ft. Harborside complex
summary: Veris Residential Inc. has completed the $420 million sale of Harborside buildings 1, 2, and 3 in Jersey City, marking a significant milestone in its transition to a pure-play multifamily company. The deal leaves Veris with virtually no remaining office space, with multifamily assets now accounting for about 98 percent of its net operating income. The buyer was identified as 601W Cos. LLC, and the transaction is considered the largest office sale in the United States in 2023.

title: $10.8 billion First Republic team bolts to Morgan Stanley
summary: A First Republic financial advisor team, the Zipper Duarte team, managing $10.8 billion in client assets and generating $12.5 million in annual revenue, has moved to Morgan Stanley. This move follows recent concerns about First Republic Bank's future after the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank, impacting its wealth management franchise. The hiring by Morgan Stanley was unsolicited, highlighting the volatile environment within the banking and wealth management sector.

title: iShares MSCI USA Momentum Factor ETF (MTUM) Stock Price, Holdings, Dividend Yield
summary: This article provides a detailed overview of the iShares MSCI USA Momentum Factor ETF (MTUM), including its current stock price, holdings, and dividend yield. As of October 31, 2025, MTUM held 125 stocks with a total portfolio value of $19.44 billion, with top holdings like Broadcom, Palantir Technologies, JPMorgan Chase, NVIDIA, and Microsoft. The article also provides key statistics, performance data, and historical breakdowns of its holdings and stock picks.

title: Direxion Daily Financial Bull 3x Shares (FAS) Stock Price, Holdings, Dividend Yield
summary: This article provides a comprehensive overview of Direxion Daily Financial Bull 3x Shares (FAS), including its current stock price, holdings, and dividend yield. It details the ETF's portfolio as of July 31, 2025, highlighting top holdings like Berkshire Hathaway and JPMorgan Chase, and offers historical performance data and key fundamental statistics. The report also lists recent trades and top stock picks for FAS.

title: State Street Financial Select Sector SPDR ETF (XLF) Stock Price, Holdings, Dividend Yield
summary: This article provides a detailed overview of the State Street Financial Select Sector SPDR ETF (XLF), including its current stock price, key statistics, top holdings, and dividend information. As of November 27, 2025, XLF holds 75 stocks with a total value of $53.95 billion, with top holdings like Berkshire Hathaway Inc and JPMorgan Chase & Co. The ETF's PE Ratio is 17.01 and its dividend yield is 1.32%.

title: PFXF: Preferreds Without Bank Sector Exposure
summary: The article discusses how investors can gain exposure to preferred securities while avoiding the financial sector volatility through the VanEck Preferred Securities ex Financials ETF (PFXF). It highlights that banks dominate the preferreds market (over 75%), posing a risk during banking crises, and explains how PFXF offers diversification, higher historical yields, and lower call risk compared to broad preferreds. The author suggests PFXF as a solution for investors seeking income potential without significant bank exposure.

title: Bank of America Pares Down Wealth Lending Unit
summary: Bank of America is reassigning approximately 200 employees from its wealth lending unit to other roles due to a slowdown in loan demand caused by higher interest rates. This move aims to realign talent with areas of greatest need, with fewer than 10 employees being let go, and salaries remain unchanged for those affected. The redeployment reflects broader industry trends where rising interest rates have cooled lending markets, prompting banks to adjust staffing and lending strategies.

title: Todd Rosenbluth Talks Ultra-Short ETFs, Active Management, and ESG on Bloomberg’s “ETF IQ”
summary: Todd Rosenbluth of VettaFi and Stephanie Pierce of BNY Mellon Investment Management discussed ultra-short ETFs, active management, and ESG funds on Bloomberg’s “ETF IQ.” They highlighted the significant increase in flows into ultra-short bond ETFs and money market funds following the banking crisis, attributing it to advisors seeking alternatives and actively managed solutions amidst market uncertainty. While concerns about the luster of ESG funds were raised, Rosenbluth argued that institutional investor moves were not necessarily a rejection of ESG but rather a shift towards quality investments.

title: Deutsche Bank tumbles as jittery investors seek safer shores
summary: Shares of Deutsche Bank plunged as investors continue to fret over the stability of the banking sector following recent collapses. Despite assurances from policymakers and analysts highlighting Deutsche Bank's strong fundamentals and profitability, concerns persist, leading to a rise in the cost of insuring its bonds and a significant drop in its share value. The turmoil also saw the wiping out of Credit Suisse's AT1 bonds, causing unease in global credit markets.

title: Veteran financials PM: There's 'amazing value' in small banks
summary: Anton Schutz, manager of the $173.6m RMB Mendon Financial Services (RMBLX) fund, sees "amazing value" in small banks despite the recent regional bank selloff. He believes community banks are generally in good shape and should not be equated with larger, more troubled institutions, and attributes some blame for recent bank collapses to regulators. Schutz's fund largely avoids larger regional names and focuses on smaller banks, which he argues have not experienced deposit runs and are seeing inflows.

title: Russian bank claims top traders complicit in US$3.2bn trade finance fraud
summary: A Russian bank, National Bank Trust (Trust Bank), has accused major commodity traders like Cargill, Louis Dreyfus Company, and Bunge of complicity in a US$3.2bn trade finance fraud. The alleged scheme involved using letters of credit for fictitious trades to circumvent Russian capital requirements and funnel unsecured loans to companies linked to Russian businessman Mikail Shishkhanov. Trust Bank is seeking records and plans to file a lawsuit in the British Virgin Islands to recover losses, while some accused traders dispute the claims and jurisdiction.

title: 10 bank stocks that look cheap based on this valuation method — First Republic heads the list
summary: The article identifies ten bank stocks that appear undervalued based on the price-to-tangible book value method, following the recent banking crisis. First Republic Bank is highlighted as having the lowest ratio among large U.S. banks amidst efforts to shore it up after deposit outflows. Other banks mentioned as trading below tangible book value include Capital One and Citigroup, suggesting potential opportunities for investors who believe these institutions will recover.

title: Core Dividend ETF DIVI Sees 9,900% Engagement Jump
summary: The Franklin International Core Dividend Tilt Index ETF (DIVI) has experienced a 9,900% year-over-year increase in advisor engagement, according to VettaFi data. This surge is likely driven by the demand for current income amidst inflation and rising interest rates, leading to significant net inflows for the ETF. DIVI, an active strategy focused on foreign equities, offers a 5.7% annual dividend yield and has shown solid outperformance.

title: How one MBS investor thinks supply and demand will get back in sync
summary: Byron Boston, CEO of Dynex Capital Inc., believes the housing market will eventually find balance despite current volatility and rising rates. He discusses the impact of rate hikes on the mortgage industry, the challenges for first-time homebuyers, and the potential for a housing correction. Boston emphasizes the need for preparedness and adaptability in the current extreme market environment.

title: J.P. Morgan Asset Management rolls out new China-focused active ETF
summary: J.P. Morgan Asset Management has launched a new active exchange-traded fund (ETF) called JPMorgan Active China ETF (JCHI) to invest in the Chinese equities market. The fund, managed by Li Tan and Rebecca Jiang, employs a bottom-up stock selection approach considering macro and policy factors, and aims to identify highly valued industry leaders with sustainable earnings and controlled capital management. This new offering expands J.P. Morgan Asset Management's ETF solutions, which already include JPMorgan Active Growth ETF (JGRO) and JPMorgan Active Value ETF (JAVA).

title: Investment Product and Service Launches
summary: This article details several new investment product and service launches from various financial firms. JPMorgan Asset Management launched an Active China ETF, First Trust introduced an Inflation Sensitive Equity ETF, Modern Capital announced its Tactical Opportunities Fund, Mirae Asset Mutual Fund released a Smart Beta ETF, and Brown Advisory launched a Sustainable Value Mutual Fund. These new offerings cover diverse investment strategies from Chinese equities and inflation hedging to tactical opportunities and sustainable value.

title: J.P. Morgan Asset Management Launches JPMorgan Active China ETF (JCHI)
summary: J.P. Morgan Asset Management has launched a new active ETF, the JPMorgan Active China ETF (JCHI), which aims to provide investors with a "best ideas" portfolio of Chinese equities. The fund uses a bottom-up stock selection process, considering macro and policy factors, and is managed by Li Tan and Rebecca Jiang. JCHI integrates with J.P. Morgan Asset Management's existing ETF offerings, bringing their total assets under management to over $100 billion.

title: Small banks vs. big banks: Where should you put your money?
summary: Following the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank, this article examines the debate between depositing money in big banks versus small banks. It discusses the pros and cons of each, including product offerings, fees, interest rates, technology, and personalized service, while emphasizing that federal insurance (FDIC or NCUA) makes both equally safe for deposits up to the insured limits. The article also suggests considering credit unions as an alternative.

title: Fiserv, Jack Henry CEOs react to bank crisis
summary: The CEOs of payment processors Fiserv and Jack Henry & Associates discussed the recent bank industry turmoil, downplaying its impact on their companies. Fiserv CEO Frank Bisignano addressed the Silicon Valley Bank failure and its limited effect on his company's revenue, while Jack Henry CEO David Foss noted that his bank clients remained largely unruffled. Both executives expressed confidence in their businesses despite the broader market concerns.

title: BofA Gets More Than $15 Billion in Deposits After SVB Fails
summary: Bank of America Corp. gained over $15 billion in new deposits within days following the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank (SVB), as customers sought refuge in larger financial institutions perceived as "too big to fail." This influx suggests a temporary tempering of investor concerns regarding slowed net interest income growth due to rising interest rates and deposit outflows from smaller banks. Other major banks like JPMorgan Chase & Co., Citigroup Inc., and Wells Fargo & Co. also reportedly experienced significant deposit increases.

title: DocuSign makes surprise CFO transition announcement
summary: DocuSign's CFO, Cynthia Gaylor, who started in September 2022, unexpectedly announced her departure. This transition comes amidst DocuSign's exposure to the Silicon Valley Bank collapse and recent layoffs, causing concern among Wall Street analysts and a drop in the company's stock. DocuSign asserts Gaylor's departure is unrelated to the SVB situation and has initiated a search for her replacement.

title: Ax the ‘woke’ American Express philosophy
summary: This article criticizes American Express for adopting "woke" corporate philosophies and diversity training, particularly since 2020. The author, a self-proclaimed happy AmEx customer, argues that these initiatives, which he describes as advancing Critical Race Theory and creating division, are baffling for a company named "American Express." While some companies have reportedly scaled back similar training, the article questions if AmEx has truly done so, despite the company's significant market value growth under CEO Stephen Squeri.

title: Reininga Says Leading Lake Shore A ‘Privilege’
summary: Daniel P. Reininga, the retiring president and CEO of Lake Shore Bancorp, Inc., conducted a farewell tour as he concludes his tenure. Reininga led the bank through significant growth, increasing assets from $488 million to nearly $700 million, and oversaw its expansion into more communities. He emphasized the privilege of leading the organization and its focus on "Putting People First."

title: US Benchmark Series Announces Launch of the US Treasury 6 Month Bill ETF
summary: F/m Investments has launched the US Treasury 6 Month Bill ETF (XBIL), expanding its US Benchmark Series to offer simplified access to the US Treasury market. XBIL provides investors with a tax-efficient way to access the highest-yielding US Treasury security, aiming to respond to demand for competitive yields. The ETF offers monthly dividends, automatic rolls for constant benchmark exposure, and the ability to transact in smaller fractions of traditional bond sizing.

title: Golden Entertainment divests its slot-route operations
summary: Golden Entertainment announced the divestment of its distributed-gaming operations in Nevada and Montana to J&J Gaming for $322.5 million plus $39 million in cash. This strategic move allows Golden to focus on its wholly-owned casinos and taverns, and is expected to de-lever its balance sheet, potentially positioning it for further acquisitions or as an acquisition target itself. J.P. Morgan analysts anticipate significant benefits for investors due to the sale premium and business simplification.

title: TD completes $1.3 billion Cowen acquisition to advance US investment banking growth strategy
summary: TD Bank Group has finalized its all-cash $1.3 billion acquisition of Cowen, merging to form TD Cowen and significantly boosting TD's US investment banking capabilities. This acquisition adds Cowen's US equities sales trading, execution, and research expertise, expecting to increase pro-forma global revenues by over a third to approximately $6.8 billion. Jeffrey Solomon, Cowen's current CEO, will join TD Securities' senior leadership.

title: First Trust Invests in Emerging Market Democracies With EMDM
summary: First Trust Advisors has launched the First Trust Bloomberg Emerging Market Democracies ETF (EMDM), focusing on companies in emerging market countries known for political rights and civil liberties. EMDM aims to address investor concerns about governance in emerging markets while providing exposure to their robust growth potential. This ETF screens countries designated as Electoral Democracies by Freedom House, ensuring a focus on rule of law and civil liberties.

title: Chase Bank plans Shorewood branch
summary: Chase Bank plans to open a new branch office in Shorewood, having leased space for the location. This new branch will take over a site previously occupied by PNC Bank. The expansion continues Chase Bank's presence in the Milwaukee area.

title: Blackstone and Sixth Street Complete Sale of Kensington Mortgages to Barclays Bank UK PLC
summary: Blackstone and Sixth Street announced the completion of the sale of Kensington Mortgages to Barclays Bank UK PLC. The specialist mortgage lender, which was jointly owned by Blackstone and Sixth Street since 2015, had originated approximately £1.9 billion of mortgages in the year ended March 31, 2022. The sale, initially announced in June 2022, marks the culmination of Kensington's accelerated growth under their ownership.

title: TD Bank Completes Cowen Acquisition to Deepen Investment Banking Footprint
summary: TD Bank Group has completed the acquisition of New York-based Cowen Inc. for $1.3 billion, a move first announced in August 2022. This acquisition aims to significantly deepen TD Bank's investment banking capabilities and expand its presence in the U.S. market, integrating Cowen's expertise and talent into TD Securities. Jeffrey Solomon, Cowen's chairman and CEO, will join TD Securities' senior leadership.

title: Schwab U.S. Large-Cap Value ETF Holdings List (NYSEARCA:SCHV)
summary: This article provides a list of the top 25 holdings of the Schwab U.S. Large-Cap Value ETF (NYSEARCA: SCHV). The ETF's holdings include major companies like Berkshire Hathaway, JPMorgan Chase & Co., and Exxon Mobil, detailing their current price, weight within the ETF, and shares held. The data reflects the closing prices as of January 2, 2026.

title: Houston’s Unity National Bank to benefit from $50 million investment by Baker Hughes
summary: Unity National Bank, Texas's only Black-owned bank, is set to receive a $50 million investment from Baker Hughes through J.P. Morgan Asset Management's Empower share class program. This investment aims to boost Unity's offerings in underserved communities, fostering economic development and advancing racial equality. Baker Hughes' CFO Nancy Buese emphasized the company's commitment to supplier diversity and creating sustainable change through this initiative.

title: 'Bond ladders are cool again,' says advisor. Here's how to capture higher Treasury bill yields
summary: Financial experts suggest Treasury bill ladders as a strategy to capture higher yields amidst rising interest rates. This strategy involves staggered T-bill maturities, allowing investors to reinvest at higher rates or reallocate funds. T-bills are considered a relatively safe asset, backed by the U.S. government, offering an attractive alternative to traditional savings options in the current inverted yield curve environment.

title: Chae Initiative Visits New York Private Sector Leaders
summary: The Chae Initiative in Private Sector Leadership at Yale Law School organized its inaugural student trip to New York City, allowing students to explore finance careers and connect with prominent leaders and alumni. The 21 students visited major financial firms, learned from key executives like Michael Chae and Stephen Schwarzman of Blackstone, and met with other industry figures such as Greg Fleming of Rockefeller Capital Management and Joe Tsai of Alibaba Group. The trip aimed to provide an immersive experience, foster a sense of community among students and alumni, and highlight diverse career paths in the finance sector.

title: Baker Hughes Invests $50 Million to Support Unity Bank of Houston, Texas’ Sole Black-owned Banking Institution
summary: Baker Hughes announced a $50 million investment in Unity Bank of Houston, Texas' sole Black-owned banking institution, through J.P. Morgan Asset Management's Empower share class. This investment aims to support supplier diversification, advance racial equity by promoting growth for minority-owned businesses, and enhance economic development in underserved communities. The move reinforces Baker Hughes' commitment to community support and follows previous grants to Historically Black Colleges and Universities.

title: Small Deposits: Vanguard liquidating mutual fund; Hamilton Lane heads to China
summary: Vanguard Group announced plans to liquidate one mutual fund and merge two others. This news comes as part of a roundup of recent banking and finance news from the Philadelphia area, also highlighting Hamilton Lane's expansion into China. The article is a brief overview of these key financial developments.

title: 'We should be able to do the same': Stop getting frustrated with politicians who make millions by investing in stocks — consider copying their trades instead. Here are 2 new ways to do it
summary: Two new ETFs, NANC and KRUZ, allow investors to mimic the stock trades of members of Congress, bringing transparency to political insider trading. These funds aim to level the playing field for ordinary investors, as members of Congress often outperform the market. The article highlights ongoing efforts and bills, like the TRUST and PELOSI Acts, to ban or restrict stock trading by politicians and their families due to ethical concerns and perceived advantages from insider information.

title: Cummins Announces Filing of IPO Registration Statement for Filtration Business
summary: Cummins Inc. announced that its Filtration business, Atmus Filtration Technologies, has filed an S-1 registration statement with the U.S. SEC for a proposed initial public offering (IPO) of newly issued common stock. Atmus Filtration Technologies, founded by Cummins in 1958, plans to list its common stock on the NYSE under the symbol ATMU. The IPO is expected to proceed after SEC review and market conditions are met, with Steph Disher continuing as CEO.

title: ImmunityBio Lines Up Another $50M Equity Investment
summary: ImmunityBio Inc. announced another financing package, expected to net $50 million for clinical trials, with potential additional funds from warrants. This follows a previous $157 million package, including a significant investment from founder Patrick Soon-Shiong. Despite the new funding, the company's shares fell and Soon-Shiong's stake has seen a substantial decline since the company went public.

title: John Goff's Legacy Project Like the Man Himself: Ambitious, Bold
summary: John Goff, a prominent Fort Worth investor and real estate developer, is spearheading the development of The Crescent Fort Worth and a Texas A&M Tier 1 research campus in Fort Worth. These projects are seen as a significant part of his legacy, reflecting his ambitious and bold approach to business and civic engagement. The article traces his journey from humble beginnings and highlights key partnerships and his strategic shift from engineering to finance, ultimately emphasizing his profound impact on the city.

title: Orrick Advises on Ally Financial’s $500 Million Debt Offering
summary: Orrick represented the underwriters in Ally Financial Inc.'s $500 million debt offering, specifically its 6.7% Subordinated Notes due in 2033. This continues Orrick's role as designated underwriters' counsel for Ally's unsecured notes program since May 2019, during which time Ally has offered and sold $6.25 billion in notes. Key individuals from Orrick, including Brett Cooper, Ken Marx, Angela Chen, and Valerie Guillard, advised on the transaction.

title: CLOs: A Rising Rate Alternative
summary: This article argues that Collateralized Loan Obligations (CLOs) are an attractive investment, particularly in a rising interest rate environment, due to their higher relative yields, strong risk-adjusted returns, and built-in protection against interest rate hikes. It highlights CLO historical outperformance during crises and rising rate periods, emphasizing the importance of selecting an experienced CLO manager for successful investment. The piece suggests that CLOs offer compelling benefits compared to other fixed-income instruments.

title: Morgan Stanley wins nod to fully own Chinese fund venture
summary: Morgan Stanley's asset management unit has received Chinese regulatory approval to take full ownership of its China mutual fund venture, Morgan Stanley Huaxin Funds. This move allows the firm to broaden its footprint in China's asset and wealth management market, following a similar approval for JPMorgan. The development is part of Beijing's efforts to speed up approvals for foreign financial institutions in the country.

title: BlackRock Increases Position in Air Products & Chemicals (APD)
summary: BlackRock has increased its ownership in Air Products & Chemicals (APD) to 6.5%, now holding 14.49 million shares. Analysts project a 4.05% upside for APD shares, with an average price target of $333.50. The company also declared a quarterly dividend of $1.75 per share, representing an annualized yield of 2.18%.

title: Los Angeles Daily News - Pacer ETFs Announces Exposure Index Change to the Pacer Trendpilot US Bond ETF
summary: Pacer ETFs has announced an exposure index change for its Pacer Trendpilot US Bond ETF, effective January 31, 2023. The ETF will now track indices related to the iBoxx USD Liquid High Yield Index and the iBoxx USD Treasuries 7-10 Year Index, replacing previous S&P indices. The fund's investment objective and ticker symbol will remain unchanged, with more information available through the prospectus.

title: Alerus pulls three bankers from American National Bank to grow commercial team
summary: Alerus Financial is expanding its commercial banking team by hiring three bankers from American National Bank, bringing a combined 70 years of experience. Leroy Benson will lead the commercial banking teams in Minnesota and Fargo, N.D. This move aims to grow Alerus' commercial banking presence.

title: BlackRock Inc. Ups Stake in Dynex Capital Inc (DX)
summary: BlackRock Inc. has increased its stake in Dynex Capital Inc (DX) to 9.4%, owning 4,347,769 shares, a 37.73% increase from its previous filing. Analyst price forecasts suggest a 1.44% upside, with an average target of $14.69. The company also declared a quarterly dividend of $0.13 per share.

title: BlackRock Inc. Ups Stake in Jones Lang LaSalle Inc (JLL)
summary: BlackRock Inc. has increased its stake in Jones Lang LaSalle Inc (JLL) to 9.7%, owning 4,616,539 shares, representing a 3.63% increase in shares and a 0.90% increase in total ownership since its previous filing. The article also provides analyst price forecasts, projecting a 24.43% upside, and details fund sentiment and other large shareholder activities, alongside information on JLL's dividend.

title: Barclays CIB appoints new co-heads of Investment Banking
summary: Barclays has announced the appointment of Taylor Wright and Cathal Deasy as Co-Heads of Investment Banking, effective March 27, 2023. They will be responsible for managing the business across coverage and product groups, deepening client relationships, and driving dealmaking efforts globally. This move aims to further strengthen Barclays' Corporate and Investment Banking franchise.

title: Capital One cuts 1,100 tech jobs
summary: Capital One has eliminated 1,100 "agile" technology roles, stating that the responsibilities will be integrated into existing engineering and product manager positions as the organization's tech transformation matures. This move follows similar workforce reductions by other major financial institutions like Morgan Stanley, Goldman Sachs, and BNY Mellon. Capital One is offering severance packages and retraining assistance to affected employees while actively hiring for other tech roles.

title: CHESAPEAKE ENERGY CORPORATION ANNOUNCES SALE OF INITIAL EAGLE FORD PACKAGE FOR $1.425 BILLION
summary: Chesapeake Energy Corporation announced the sale of the Brazos Valley region of its Eagle Ford asset to WildFire Energy I LLC for $1.425 billion. This sale marks an initial step in Chesapeake's pivot to focus capital on its Marcellus and Haynesville positions. The transaction, expected to close in Q1 2023, involves approximately 377,000 net acres and 1,350 wells, with proceeds intended for debt repayment and share repurchases.

title: Pershing adds State Farm, BNY Mellon stays bullish on crypto tech
summary: BNY Mellon's CEO Robin Vince reiterated the company's bullish stance on cryptocurrency technology, despite recent market collapses, emphasizing its long-term growth initiatives in real-time payments and digital assets. Vince also highlighted new custodial relationships for Pershing with State Farm and fintech startup Arta Finance, contrasting with reports of job cuts at BNY Mellon. The article details Pershing's financial performance, including increased revenue due to rising interest rates and a decrease in assets under custody due to market slumps.

title: Howard Hughes Lands $117M for Maryland Community
summary: The Howard Hughes Corp. has secured $117 million in financing for its 382-unit Juniper community in Columbia, Md., which is part of its larger Downtown Columbia Plan master-planned development. JLL arranged the five-year fixed-rate loan to refinance existing construction financing for the residential and retail property. The firm is also developing a Class A office building nearby and secured a $76 million loan for that project.

title: ETF of the Week: JPMorgan Equity Premium Income ETF (JEPI)
summary: The JPMorgan Equity Premium Income ETF (JEPI) was featured as "ETF of the Week" again due to its compelling proposition as an income-generating fund. VettaFi's Tom Lydon highlighted JEPI's options overlay strategy resulting in a nearly 12% yield and downside protection, while also allowing for upside participation. The article noted JEPI's significant inflows, attributing some to tax-loss harvesting and its unique positioning compared to similar funds.

title: BlackRock, Citigroup among firms named as fossil-fuel boycotters by Kentucky
summary: Kentucky has named 11 financial institutions, including BlackRock, Citigroup, and JPMorgan Chase & Co., as fossil-fuel boycotters, requiring state entities to divest from them. This action stems from a state law aimed at combating what Kentucky Treasurer Allison Ball calls "energy company boycotts" and reflects a broader GOP pushback against ESG investing. The listed firms have an opportunity to clarify their positions to avoid divestment, though some, like BlackRock and JPMorgan, assert their significant investments in the energy sector.

title: 'Banking while Black': Woman wins casino jackpot, but Livonia bank won't cash check
summary: Lizzie Pugh, a 71-year-old Black woman, is suing Fifth Third Bank in Livonia, Michigan, after employees allegedly refused to cash her five-figure casino jackpot check, claiming it was fraudulent. Pugh, a Detroit public schools retiree, eventually deposited the check at a Chase bank, where it cleared the next day. Her lawsuit alleges blatant racism, and her attorney describes the incident as "Banking while Black."

title: Hedging Against Currency Swings Separates Winners From Losers This Year
summary: This article discusses how hedging against currency swings, particularly with the strengthening dollar, has become crucial for investors in overseas stocks. The rising dollar can significantly impact returns for US-based investors holding international equities, as it erodes gains when foreign currencies are converted back to fewer dollars. The article highlights that investors can use stock funds that hedge currency exposure to mitigate this effect.

title: More Subprime Borrowers Are Missing Loan Payments - WSJ
summary: Subprime borrowers in the U.S. are increasingly missing payments on credit cards, car loans, and personal loans, indicating a potential downturn in the previously healthy consumer lending environment. Delinquencies for subprime credit cards and personal loans have been rising for eight consecutive months and are approaching pre-pandemic levels, according to Equifax Inc. This trend suggests that borrowers with limited or troubled credit histories are struggling to keep up with their financial obligations.

title: Fake Caller ID in utility shut-off scam cost Troy woman $700 via Zelle
summary: A Troy woman lost $700 in a utility shut-off scam after scammers spoofed DTE Energy's caller ID and demanded Zelle payment. This incident highlights a growing trend of utility imposter scams where fraudsters pressure victims into immediate payments via money transfer apps like Zelle, which offer no protection for authorized payments. Authorities and utility companies urge consumers to be vigilant, verify calls, and never provide banking information unless they initiate the contact to a known legitimate number.

title: Goldman junior bankers are publicly threatening to leave Wall Street for tech as CEO demands full-time return to office
summary: Junior bankers at Goldman Sachs are expressing significant discontent over CEO David Solomon's mandate for a full-time return to the office, publicly threatening to leave for tech companies offering more flexibility. This comes despite increased bonuses and new benefits aimed at retaining talent, as the bank emphasizes an apprenticeship culture and the benefits of in-person collaboration. The move highlights a growing clash between traditional financial institutions' return-to-office policies and employees' desire for hybrid work arrangements.

title: Billionaire George Kaiser’s Bank Drills Deeper Into the Oil Patch
summary: While many lenders are pulling back from oil-and-gas financing, George Kaiser's BOK Financial is aggressively expanding its market share. The bank was a bookrunner on $2 billion in loans to U.S. oil-and-gas companies in the first quarter, ranking fifth overall, by capitalizing on the improved outlook for energy companies and other banks retreating from the sector. This strategy comes as high oil prices boost energy companies' cash flows, reducing their overall borrowing needs but creating opportunities for lenders willing to engage.

title: Asesoramos en la reestructuración de pasivos financieros de San Antonio Internacional S.A. y Servicios Especiales San Antonio S.A.
summary: Bruchou & Funes de Rioja advised a consortium of banks on the financial debt restructuring of San Antonio Internacional S.A. and Servicios Especiales San Antonio S.A., totaling approximately $7 billion. The restructuring involved three distinct transactions, including debt cancellation with a write-off, a syndicated refinancing agreement, and a separate refinancing deal. The firm also provided tax advice, and other legal and financial advisors were involved in the process.

title: U.S.V.I. Sues JPMorgan Chase for Facilitating Epstein Trafficking
summary: The U.S. Virgin Islands has filed a lawsuit against JPMorgan Chase, alleging the bank facilitated Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking enterprise. The lawsuit claims JPMorgan Chase knowingly, negligently, and unlawfully provided financial services crucial to Epstein's operation, despite numerous red flags regarding his activities. The government seeks damages, punitive damages, restitution, and injunctive relief for the bank's alleged violations of federal and Virgin Islands laws, including the Trafficking Victims Protection Act and the Bank Secrecy Act.

title: GFP, Metro Loft Close on $536M Loan at 25 Water Street
summary: GFP Real Estate, Metro Loft, and Rockwood Capital secured a $536 million loan from Michael Dell’s MSD Partners and Apollo Commercial Real Estate Finance for the acquisition and conversion of 25 Water Street in the Financial District. This loan is noted as the largest for an office-to-residential project in U.S. history, aiming to transform the former JPMorgan back offices into 1,300 residential units. The project is part of a growing trend of office-to-residential conversions in New York City.

title: J.P. Morgan and Lincoln Financial Merge Insurance Trust Funds, Joining Forces to Enhance Offerings in the Variable Insurance Trust Space
summary: J.P. Morgan Asset Management and Lincoln Financial Group announced a strengthened partnership to merge four JPMorgan Insurance Trust Portfolios into newly formed series of Lincoln Financial Variable Insurance Products Trust. This initiative aims to enhance Lincoln's variable insurance, retirement, and annuity solutions platform by incorporating J.P. Morgan's investment capabilities. J.P. Morgan will serve as the subadvisor for the acquiring funds, continuing to manage them with their existing portfolio management teams.

title: BlackRock Plans More ETF Fee Cuts as War of Tiny Trims Rolls On
summary: BlackRock Inc., the world's largest ETF issuer, is implementing further fee reductions across eight of its exchange-traded funds amidst the ongoing industry trend of competitive fee cuts. This move impacts several bond and equity ETFs, including the iShares 1-5 Year Investment Grade Corporate Bond ETF, which will see its expense ratio reduced from 0.06% to 0.04%. This strategic decision continues the "war of tiny trims" seen across major financial players like Schwab, Vanguard, and State Street.

title: What Will Happen to the Dollar in 2023?
summary: The U.S. dollar, after a strong performance in 2022, is showing signs of weakening as 2023 approaches, which could introduce new inflation risks, particularly through rising commodity prices. This potential decline is influenced by changing Federal Reserve policies, expecting a slower pace of rate hikes, and improving growth expectations outside the U.S., especially in China. A weaker dollar could benefit exporters and international investments but poses challenges for the Fed by potentially reigniting inflation and increasing import costs.

title: Sea Change
summary: The author, with 53 years in investment, identifies three "sea changes" in the investment world: the shift to risk/return thinking in the 70s, the four-decade decline in interest rates starting in the early 80s, and the current reversal of these trends. The memo details how declining rates fueled investment success and how the current environment of higher inflation and interest rates marks a significant departure from the recent past, necessitating new investment strategies.

title: Mutual Fund to ETF Conversions May Accelerate, CFRA Says
summary: The article discusses the accelerating trend of mutual fund to ETF conversions, with CFRA predicting a "tidal wave" in 2023. It highlights the advantages of ETFs, such as tax efficiency and lower costs, and details the historical growth of ETFs compared to mutual funds. Over $40 billion in mutual funds have already converted, led by firms like JPMorgan and Dimensional, driven by changes like the SEC's 2019 "ETF Rule."

title: DFA Lists 2 New ETFs
summary: DFA has launched two new actively managed exchange-traded funds (ETFs) focused on core equity. The DFA U.S. Core Equity ETF and the DFA World ex-U.S. Core Equity ETF aim to provide broad market exposure with a systematic investment approach. These new offerings expand DFA's suite of active ETF products.

title: NYCB to keep HQ on Long Island, unify brands under Flagstar name after $2.6B merger
summary: New York Community Bancorp (NYCB) will maintain its Hicksville headquarters and rebrand all 10 of its banking labels under the Flagstar name following its $2.6 billion merger with Flagstar Bancorp. This merger creates a financial institution with approximately $90 billion in assets, making it the 24th largest U.S. bank. The unification of brands reverses NYCB's previous strategy of retaining local brands post-acquisition.

title: Akros Technologies, an AI-powered asset management platform, raises funding from Z Holdings
summary: Akros Technologies, an AI-powered asset management platform, has secured $2.3 million from Z Venture Capital, a subsidiary of Z Holdings, bringing its total funding to $6.1 million since 2021. The startup plans to use the funds to scale its AI-driven asset management software and PMaaS product, aiming to onboard over five B2B clients in Q1 2023.
