Akros's technology reduces fund development costs by over 80% and applies generative AI and GPT-3 NLP to create investment strategies and analyze market data.

title: First Trust/abrdn Emerging Opportunity Fund Announces Termination and Liquidation
authors: First Trust/abrdn Emerging Opportunity Fund via Business Wire
summary: The First Trust/abrdn Emerging Opportunity Fund (NYSE: FEO) completed its termination and liquidation on December 7, 2022, as consistent with its plan announced on September 20, 2022. Shareholders received a liquidating distribution of $9.635572 per common share. Investors are advised to consult a tax advisor regarding the tax implications of this liquidation.

title: Vietnam's EV maker Vinfast files for U.S. IPO to fuel global expansion
summary: Vietnam's electric-vehicle maker VinFast has filed for an initial public offering (IPO) in the United States to list on the Nasdaq under ticker symbol "VFS", aiming to fund its global expansion including a planned plant in North Carolina. The company will convert to a Singapore public limited company named VinFast Auto Ltd for the IPO, with Citigroup, Morgan Stanley, Credit Suisse, and JP Morgan leading a nine-bank syndicate. This move follows an earlier confidential submission and plans to raise $2 billion with a valuation of around $60 billion, although market conditions have cooled for EV startups.

title: Wells Fargo Archives
summary: This archive of Finovate articles details Wells Fargo's digital transformation efforts, including the launch of its Vantage digital banking platform for commercial clients and the Flex Loan small dollar financing solution. It also covers Wells Fargo's participation in the Akoya Data Access Network for API-based data aggregation and historical analyses of its website design and mobile banking strategies. The collection highlights the bank's initiatives to enhance customer experience, manage short-term cash needs, and improve digital engagement.

title: Morgan Stanley Cuts 2% of Global Work Force as Deal-Making Slows (Published 2022)
summary: Morgan Stanley is laying off approximately 2% of its global workforce, impacting around 1,600 employees across all divisions, due to a significant slowdown in deal-making activity. This move comes after the firm had paused layoffs during the pandemic and reflects broader economic jitters and rising interest rates impacting the investment banking sector. Other major banks like Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase have also seen their stock shares decline over the past year.

title: Entergy New Orleans replenishes storm recovery coffers with $209.3 million issuance
summary: Entergy New Orleans (ENO) is issuing approximately $209.3 million in storm recovery bonds to replenish funds depleted by Hurricanes Zeta and Ida. These bonds, secured by storm recovery property, will be repaid through storm recovery charges on ENO's retail electric customers, with the charges adjusted semiannually. Both Moody's and S&P Global Ratings are assigning high ratings to the single tranche issuance, citing ENO's stability and experience as a servicer.

title: J.P. Morgan looks to offer active ETF focused on China
summary: J.P. Morgan is planning to launch an actively managed Exchange Traded Fund (ETF) that will focus its investments on China. This initiative by J.P. Morgan indicates a strategic move to offer investors specialized exposure to the Chinese market through an ETF structure. The announcement was made by Kathie O'Donnell on December 5, 2022.

title: Delaware District Court: Using Contract Rights to Strategic Advantage Not Grounds for Equitable Subordination in Bankruptcy
summary: The U.S. District Court for the District of Delaware affirmed that using contractual rights to strategic advantage is not grounds for equitable subordination in bankruptcy, a ruling welcomed by lenders. The case, *Tilton v. MBIA Inc. (In re Zohar III, Corp.)*, reinforces that courts require a high bar for misconduct, especially for non-insiders, to justify equitable subordination. This decision provides comfort to lenders looking to enforce their contractual rights without undue exposure to broad lender liability claims.

title: Bank of Hope data breach class action settlement
summary: Bank of Hope agreed to a class action settlement to resolve claims that a 2018 data breach exposed Californians’ sensitive information. The settlement provides reimbursement for out-of-pocket expenses up to $500, two years of free identity-theft protection through Experian, and mandates cybersecurity improvements by Bank of Hope. The deadline for claims and exclusion was February 7, 2023.

title: Kakao Pay seeks to acquire Loca Mobility up for sale by MBK Partners
summary: Kakao Pay is looking to acquire Loca Mobility from MBK Partners, a move that could expand its business scope and create synergy with Kakao Mobility. The acquisition is part of MBK Partners' strategy to divest its investment in Lotte Card. Loca Mobility, the second-largest public transportation card operator in Korea, is set to open a preliminary bid on December 6, with MBK and Lotte Card hoping to fetch around 300 billion won ($231 million) from the sale.
source: The Korea Economic Daily Global Edition
source_domain: The Korea Economic Daily Global Edition

title: Biden signs bill to block U.S. railroad strike
summary: President Biden signed legislation to avert a national railroad strike, which could have severely impacted the U.S. economy. The bill imposes a tentative contract agreement, but without a provision for paid sick leave, drawing criticism from some labor leaders. Despite the controversy, Biden stated the action was necessary to protect jobs, families, and supply chains from economic catastrophe.

title: AFTX IPO News - Gene therapy biotech Affinia Therapeutics withdraws $100 million IPO
summary: Affinia Therapeutics, a preclinical biotech focused on gene therapies for rare diseases and cancer, has withdrawn its plans for a $100 million initial public offering. The company, which originally filed in January 2022, had not updated its prospectus since. It had planned to list on the Nasdaq under the symbol AFTX.

title: Shoals Technologies Group, Inc. Announces Pricing of
summary: Shoals Technologies Group, Inc. announced the pricing of an upsized underwritten public offering of 26,000,000 shares of its Class A common stock at $22.25 per share. The company will offer 2,000,000 shares, and certain selling stockholders will offer 24,000,000 shares. The company plans to use its proceeds to fund a portion of a $58.1 million termination consideration for its Tax Receivable Agreement.

title: Manulife Launches Forest Climate Fund to Raise $500 Million
summary: Manulife Investment Management has launched its Forest Climate Fund (FCF) with the goal of raising $500 million to acquire sustainably managed forests that sequester carbon. This initiative aims to generate high-integrity carbon credits for investors by prioritizing carbon capture over logging, and will also offer financial returns through various strategies. The fund is open to institutional investors globally, including pensions and endowments, and seeks to align with Manulife's broader sustainability and responsible investing goals.

title: New York Community Bancorp Completes Acquisition of Flagstar Bancorp
summary: New York Community Bancorp, Inc. (NYCB) announced the completion of its acquisition of Flagstar Bancorp, Inc., creating a regional banking franchise among the top 25 in the U.S. The combined entity will have $88.4 billion in assets, $66.0 billion in loans, and $58.3 billion in deposits on a proforma basis as of September 30, 2022. This merger aims to diversify revenue, improve funding mix, and enhance the interest-rate risk profile, while also expanding the retail banking network and national lending businesses.

title: State Street pulls plug on $3.5 billion Brown Brothers Harriman acquisition
summary: State Street and Brown Brothers Harriman have mutually agreed to terminate their $3.5 billion acquisition deal after more than a year of regulatory uncertainty and scrutiny from the Biden administration. The deal, intended to make State Street the number one provider of asset services globally, faced increasing delays and complexities, ultimately leading to its cancellation without a breakup fee. Investors reacted positively to the news, with State Street's stock rising 5 percent.

title: The lines between Food & Grocery delivery continue to blur
summary: The article discusses the blurring lines between food and grocery delivery services as major third-party delivery platforms expand their offerings. It highlights DoorDash's significant growth in attracting new digital visitors and its effective use of influencers, as well as the strategic partnerships between credit card issuers like Chase and Mastercard with Instacart and DoorDash to incentivize market growth.

title: RBC to buy HSBC’s Canada unit for $10B
summary: Royal Bank of Canada (RBC) has agreed to acquire HSBC’s Canada unit in an all-cash deal valued at C$13.5 billion ($10 billion). This acquisition, expected to close in late 2023, will add $99.6 billion in assets and 130 branches to RBC, further solidifying its position as Canada's largest bank. The deal may also alleviate pressure on HSBC from its largest shareholder, Ping An, which has been pushing for a split of its Western and Asian operations.

title: M&T Bank Corp. stock outperforms competitors despite losses on the day
summary: M&T Bank Corp. (MTB) stock fell 1.52% to $169.52 on a generally negative trading day for the stock market, breaking a three-day winning streak. Despite its own losses, the stock outperformed several key competitors including JPMorgan Chase & Co. (JPM), Bank of America Corp. (BAC), and Wells Fargo & Co. (WFC), which experienced larger percentage drops. The stock closed $23.90 below its 52-week high, with trading volume significantly below its 50-day average.

title: PIMCO ETF hits NYSE trading floor
summary: PIMCO has listed its PIMCO Active Bond ETF (BOND) on the NYSE trading floor, marking the exchange's first ETF listing in 15 years and the first actively-managed ETF in the open outcry arena. The firm is employing a digital and human hybrid system, including a designated market maker, to enhance liquidity, reduce volatility, and improve price determination. This move follows recent SEC rule changes permitting a wider range of ETFs to list on the NYSE floor, and PIMCO is considering further ETF listings there.

title: Manulife takes control of China unit as foreign ownership barriers fall
summary: Manulife Investment Management has received approval from Beijing to take full control of its mainland Chinese joint venture, Manulife TEDA Fund Management, by acquiring the remaining 51% stake for 1.7 billion yuan (US$237.22 million). This move makes Manulife the first foreign asset manager to convert its joint venture into a wholly-owned fund management company in China, reflecting Beijing's increased willingness to open up its financial markets since foreign ownership restrictions were scrapped in April 2020. The full acquisition will grant Manulife direct access to China's large and rapidly growing retail fund market.

title: New chief investment strategist at PNC Asset Management Group
summary: PNC Asset Management Group has appointed Marc Dizard as its new chief investment strategist. Dizard brings significant experience to the role within PNC Financial Services Group Inc. The Pittsburgh Business Times piece highlights this key personnel change.

title: JPMorgan American - Nov 2022
summary: This article provides an in-depth analysis of JPMorgan American (JAM) as of November 2022, highlighting its distinctive approach to US equity investing by blending growth and value styles. It discusses the fund's historical outperformance against its benchmark and peers since a strategic change in mid-2019, its low ongoing charge, and its resilient share price rating. The analysis also covers management changes, portfolio construction, and key investment characteristics.

title: Leader of Walmart health business leaves for JPMorgan Chase
summary: Dr. Cheryl Pegus, head of Walmart's health and wellness business, is departing her role to join Morgan Health, a business unit of JPMorgan Chase. Morgan Health focuses on employer-sponsored health care.

title: Peek inside JPMorgan's new downtown Seattle tech center
summary: JPMorgan has opened a new tech center in downtown Seattle, located in the 1201 Third tower. This center, which features collaborative work areas, is one of 11 such facilities the company operates across the U.S.

title: Así es Galicia Ventures, el nuevo programa de innovación para escalar startups de América Latina
summary: Grupo Financiero Galicia launched Galicia Ventures, an open innovation and corporate venturing program aimed at accelerating business transformation by investing in and forming alliances with Latin American startups. The program will focus on Fintech, Agtech, and Insurtech industries, both B2C and B2B, leveraging cross-cutting technologies like Web3, DeFi, Big Data, Blockchain, AI, and Cybersecurity. Galicia Ventures plans to contact 350 regional startups in 2023, aiming for 2-3 investments with an average ticket of US$250,000, and five business alliances.

title: JPMorgan Chase bumps up parental leave to 16 weeks
summary: JPMorgan Chase is increasing its parental leave to 16 weeks for either parent, effective January 1, alongside expanded bereavement leave and up to four weeks of paid time off to care for seriously ill family members. The bank is also raising its full-time employee sick days from six to ten. These benefit enhancements aim to make JPMorgan competitive with other major banks in attracting and retaining talent.

title: Bitwise Launches Crypto ETF Despite SEC’s ETF Cold Feet
summary: Bitwise has launched the Crypto Industry Innovators ETF (BITQ), which invests in 30 companies deriving at least 75% of their income or net assets from cryptocurrency. This ETF offers investors exposure to the crypto economy through a familiar format, circumventing some complexities of direct digital asset ownership. While similar to other funds, BITQ is notable for being the first SEC-approved ETF to include "crypto" in its name, addressing investor comfort levels and advisor workflow challenges.

title: Brookfield expands into Saudi Arabia to target kingdom’s riches
summary: Brookfield Asset Management Inc plans to expand into Saudi Arabia, joining BlackRock Inc and global banks to capitalize on investment opportunities in the Gulf economy. The move follows wide-ranging economic reforms in the kingdom and targets areas such as infrastructure, renewables, private equity, and real estate. Other major firms like Blackstone Inc and KKR & Co are also increasing their presence and efforts in the region, aiming for high-net-worth clients and exploring significant projects.

title: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon backs spending on energy infrastructure during stop in San Antonio
summary: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon, during a stop in San Antonio, advocated for increased investment in energy infrastructure, stating that under-investment in oil and gas globally is causing shortages. He also commented on the recent U.S. elections, expressing hope that a divided Congress could lead to progress on issues like immigration and tax reform, and discussed the labor shortage in the San Antonio market. Dimon also reiterated his earlier warning about an impending economic "hurricane" and highlighted the war in Ukraine as the biggest geopolitical risk since World War II.

title: JPMorgan Chase chief Jamie Dimon bullish on Austin despite economic uncertainty
summary: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon visited Austin, reasserting the bank's commitment to expansion in the city and Texas despite economic uncertainties and a projected recession. JPMorgan Chase is growing its Austin workforce by 10% and leasing additional office space, contrasting with other tech firms that are retrenching. Dimon expressed concern about global geopolitical factors but indicated he is not worried about a housing market crash similar to 2008.

title: Crypto, unicorns and housing bubbles: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon talks economy in Austin
summary: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon visited Austin to discuss the economy, the implosion of FTX, and the future of banking. Dimon expressed optimism for Austin's future due to its pro-business environment and growth potential. He emphasized Texas's attractiveness for business and job creation.

title: PIMCO's ETF Transfer to NYSE Floor Trading Is a Key Milestone
summary: PIMCO's Active Bond ETF (BOND) has become the first active ETF to be traded from a booth on the NYSE floor, marking a significant milestone for the industry. This move is expected to enhance liquidity, improve price discovery, and reduce transaction costs for investors by adding human oversight from a Designated Market Maker. PIMCO launched its first active fixed income ETF in 2009 and continues to expand its lineup, with actively managed ETFs seeing accelerated adoption due to market volatility.

title: Wex readies for acquisitions
summary: Wex, a payment software services provider, is actively seeking acquisitions, leveraging the current economic downturn to acquire targets at more favorable prices. CEO Melissa Smith aims for consistent annual revenue growth, with a portion expected from strategic acquisitions in energy, health benefits, and corporate payments. Despite strong revenue and transaction volume growth in Q3, the company reported a net loss and is focused on cost savings to strengthen its financial position for future purchases.

title: Meet the ETFs with the lowest tracking error
summary: This article identifies ETFs with the lowest tracking error across various categories as of October 2022, based on Cafemutual ETF Research. It highlights 10 large-cap ETFs with a tracking error of 0.03, including those from ICICI Prudential, Invesco India, Kotak, Mirae Asset, Nippon India, SBI, and UTI. The research also details top-performing ETFs in mid-cap, debt, factor, gold, international, sector, and thematic categories, providing a comprehensive overview of ETFs with minimal deviation from their underlying indices.

title: Growing Dividends Yield Stability
summary: This Morgan Stanley article discusses how investing in dividend-paying stocks, particularly those with consistent growth, can provide stability and outsized returns during turbulent market conditions. It highlights specific sectors poised for dividend growth, such as Energy, Packaged Food, Beverages and Household Products, Utilities, and Banks, while also cautioning investors to consider factors beyond just high yields, like debt load and earnings stability. The article emphasizes that while dividends offer income and a sign of earnings stability, investors should balance these benefits against the company's need to reinvest in its business.

title: OceanFirst and Partners Bancorp call off merger, blaming regulatory delays
summary: OceanFirst Financial and Partners Bancorp have terminated their $186 million merger agreement, citing prolonged regulatory approval processes. Both companies stated that the decision was in their best interest due to the uncertainty surrounding the deal's conclusion, with no termination fees exchanged. This event reflects a broader trend of slowed bank M&A activity attributed to increased regulatory scrutiny and staffing shortages at agencies.

title: How XEMD Can Help With Emerging Markets Tax Loss Harvesting
summary: Emerging markets investing has seen negative headlines, with broad emerging market bond indexes performing poorly due to rising interest rates. However, intermediate-term emerging markets have shown outperformance. This article suggests that investors with taxable accounts could consider tax-loss harvesting using ETFs like the BondBloxx JP Morgan USD Emerging Markets 1-10 Year Bond ETF (XEMD), which tracks short- to intermediate-term U.S. dollar-denominated emerging market bonds and has shown relative performance advantages in a rising rate environment.

title: Pending merger involving Tacoma-based bank leads to sell-off of branches across West
summary: Tacoma-based Columbia Banking System announced the sale of 10 bank branches across Washington, Oregon, and California as a condition for its pending merger with Portland-based Umpqua Holdings Corp. These divestitures, mandated by the U.S. Department of Justice, involve the sale of seven branches to 1st Security Bank of Washington and three to First Northern Bank, with all employees expected to be retained. The merger, which will keep the holding company in Tacoma and trade under Columbia's symbol (COLB), aims for closure in the first quarter of next year.

title: Goldman launches digital asset classification system
summary: Goldman Sachs has launched Datonomy, a new digital asset classification system developed with MSCI and Coin Metrics, to provide institutional investors with a standardized way to analyze the crypto ecosystem. This subscription-based tool aims to bring transparency to the market by classifying digital assets based on investor usage and helping with portfolio performance review and risk management. This move signifies Goldman's continued strategic re-engagement with digital assets after previously halting and then relaunching its crypto trading desk.

title: Atlanticus Launches Aspire® Banking Platform, New Debit
summary: Atlanticus Holdings Corporation launched the Aspire® Banking platform, a new debit product designed to provide a clear path to credit for the financially underserved. This program offers a bank account and debit card with no minimums or nuisance fees, and upon completing specific activities in as little as 90 days, customers are presented with an Aspire® Credit Card offer. The initiative aims to help the nearly 44 million unbanked or underbanked Americans establish positive financial habits and access credit.

title: Voya Financial acquires benefits administration company
summary: Voya Financial Inc. announced its acquisition of Benefitfocus Inc., a cloud-based benefits administration company, for approximately $570 million. This acquisition will expand Voya's services to roughly 38 million individuals and accelerate its workplace-centered strategy, enhancing its ability to provide comprehensive benefits and savings solutions. Benefitfocus is expected to continue as a distinct business with its existing management team.

title: LPL buying one of its own giant branches
summary: LPL Financial Holdings Inc. is acquiring Financial Resources Group Investment Services, one of its largest branch offices, for a base price of $140 million. This acquisition brings new management capabilities to banks and credit unions, according to LPL, and addresses Financial Resources Group's needs for capital and a succession plan. The deal highlights a trend of large broker-dealers actively participating in the mergers and acquisitions market for wealth management firms.

title: Goldman Sachs seeks to impose order on expanding crypto universe with classification system
summary: Goldman Sachs, in partnership with MSCI and Coin Metrics, is launching "Datonomy," a data service to classify hundreds of digital coins and tokens for institutional investors. This system aims to standardize how the financial industry understands and invests in digital assets, providing a framework for performance tracking, risk management, and product creation in the crypto space. Datonomy will allow for more granular analysis of digital assets, similar to sector analysis in traditional equities.

title: CLIENT FIRST TAX & WEALTH ADVISORS ANNOUNCES NEW ADAPTIV™ SELECT ETF (TICKER: ADPV); A PROPRIETARY ACTIVELY MANAGED, LARGE CAP STOCK SELECTION ETF
summary: Client First Tax & Wealth Advisors has announced the Adaptiv™ Select ETF (ADPV), an actively managed, large-cap stock selection exchange-traded fund. This ETF aims to identify and own the top 25 U.S. Large Cap stocks in an uptrend, shifting to cash and short-term Treasury Bills during downtrends. The fund leverages proprietary rules-based calculations and weekly reconstitutions to manage risk and pursue returns.

title: Women of Influence honoree: Thelma Ferguson, JPMorgan Chase & Co.
summary: Thelma Ferguson, vice chair of commercial banking at JPMorgan Chase & Co., has been honored as a Woman of Influence. This article previews an interview with Ferguson, where she discusses offering advice to women in corporate leadership and the importance of supporting small businesses.

title: Why bonds may beat stocks in coming months, after ‘safe’ and ‘risky’ assets broadly moved in same direction in 2022, says Capital Economics
summary: Capital Economics predicts that bonds may outperform stocks in the coming months, diverging from their similar performance in 2022. This shift is attributed to increasing recession concerns and the belief that long-dated government bond yields have peaked and will decline further as inflation eases. John Higgins, chief markets economist at Capital Economics, suggests that while bond yields have peaked, risky assets may face more challenges until mid-next year.

title: Amtrak and First National Bank of Omaha Launch Two New Amtrak Guest Rewards Mastercards
summary: Amtrak and First National Bank of Omaha (FNBO) have launched two new Amtrak Guest Rewards Mastercard Credit Cards. These co-branded cards offer enhanced benefits and rewards for Amtrak loyalty program members, allowing them to earn points for travel, upgrades, dining, and more. The new offerings include a Preferred Mastercard with an annual fee and a standard Mastercard with no annual fee, both designed to improve the customer travel experience.

title: JPMorgan Chase launches Story
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. has launched Story, a new multifamily rental management platform for property owners. The platform is currently being piloted with Chase customers and offered free for 12 months, allowing users to create leases and invoices, and collect rent payments online. Landlords not currently Chase customers will be able to sign up when it's released more broadly next year.

title: Leaders in Trading 2022: Meet the nominees for… Outstanding Alternative Liquidity Provider
summary: The article announces the shortlisted nominees for the 2022 Editors’ Choice Outstanding Alternative Liquidity Provider Award: Citadel Securities, Flow Traders, Hudson River Trading, Jane Street, and XTX Markets. It then provides detailed overviews of each firm's activities, market presence, strategic investments, and contributions to liquidity provision across various asset classes, including their engagement in digital assets and DeFi.

title: Follow the Money: ParkHub Acquires Parking Software Startup, UpSmith Raises $3.3M, Maverick Bancshares Seeks $17M for new Fort Worth Bank, and More
summary: This article details various financial activities and developments in North Texas, including ParkHub's acquisition of Smarking, UpSmith's $3.3 million pre-seed funding round to address the skilled worker shortage, and Maverick Bancshares' bid to raise $17 million for a new bank in Fort Worth. It also covers significant investments, acquisitions, and funding rounds for companies like Taysha Gene Therapies, RumbleOn, MAX, Zirtue, 4 Impact Data, NaturalShrimp, Crescent Real Estate, Dallas Venture Capital, Acqueon, Tyler Technologies, Integrity Marketing Group, and Centurion American Development Group.

title: How SMBC Group became a leader in transformation and digital perseverance
summary: SMBC Group, one of Japan's largest banks, is undergoing a significant digital transformation by partnering with Microsoft as its strategic cloud provider. This collaboration aims to modernize IT infrastructure, develop innovative products like Embedded Finance and digital supply chain solutions, and support customers in achieving their sustainability goals. The article highlights how SMBC's approach to digital transformation also involves a cultural shift, emphasizing talent empowerment and a customer-first mindset, positioning them for "digital perseverance" in a changing industry.

title: JPMorgan Chase merchants can now receive payments through Meta Pay
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co's merchants can now accept payments via Meta Pay, offering customers a new secure online payment option. This integration allows users to utilize Meta Pay across Meta's platforms, like WhatsApp and Instagram, for online purchases. Meta Pay, formerly Facebook Pay, was launched in 2019 to unify payment services within Meta's ecosystem.

title: J.P. Morgan San Diego Grows, Overcomes Economic Pressures
summary: J.P. Morgan San Diego has consolidated its multiple business lines into a single corporate office at One Paseo, leading to significant growth in headcount and revenue despite economic headwinds. The firm attributes its success to specialized teams focusing on key San Diego industries, strong client communication, and the region's appeal for talent. They emphasize personalized advice and collaboration to help clients navigate economic challenges and seize opportunities.

title: JPMorgan Chase teams with Vera Whole Health to open primary care clinics for employees
summary: JPMorgan Chase is launching primary care clinics for its employees in the Columbus, Ohio area, partnering with Vera Whole Health and Central Ohio Primary Care. This initiative will offer comprehensive in-person and virtual health services to over 20,000 employees and their families, with Morgan Health, JPMorgan Chase's healthcare arm, playing a key role. The move aims to provide high-quality and integrated healthcare, building on Morgan Health's prior investment in Vera Whole Health.

title: Banking in 2022: Digital-first or dead last
summary: This article describes a webinar from Comscore discussing the rapid changes in the banking industry, emphasizing the need for banks to adapt to digital and social platforms to reach evolving consumer audiences. The webinar highlights the growth of online banking and neobanks, and provides insights into consumer engagement, market competition, and strategies for success in the digital banking landscape.

title: Apple Moves iPhone 14 Production to India
summary: Apple announced it will begin manufacturing its latest iPhone 14 models in India, marking a significant step in the company's efforts to diversify production away from China. This move aligns with India's push for local manufacturing and is expected to boost India's smartphone market. Investors can capitalize on India's digital growth through ETFs like the EMQQ Global’s India Internet and Ecommerce ETF (INQQ).

title: JPMorgan doubles down on gaming firm tie
summary: JPMorgan Chase has invested in Sightline Payments, a company providing payment services for the regulated gaming industry, through its payments unit. This investment aims to develop an integrated omnichannel solution for resort and online gaming companies and is part of JPMorgan Payments' broader multi-channel strategy in the gaming sector. Sightline, which previously tapped JPMorgan as its primary merchant acquirer, focuses on converting the cash-based gaming industry into a digitally-enabled one, projecting significant market expansion.

title: Employers are getting more selective and taking longer to hire, headhunter Robert Half says
summary: Robert Half International Inc.'s stock fell to a 20-month low after the company missed third-quarter profit and revenue expectations and issued a bleak outlook. The headhunter noted that clients are becoming more selective and taking longer to hire, leading J.P. Morgan analyst Andrew Steinerman to downgrade his stance due to rising recessionary risks. The CEO also highlighted a structural shift towards remote/hybrid working models among job seekers.

title: Bank of Hawaii Corporation (NYSE:BOH) is largely controlled by institutional shareholders who own 75% of the company
summary: Institutional shareholders control 75% of Bank of Hawaii Corporation (NYSE:BOH), signifying their significant influence due to their substantial ownership and research capabilities. The Vanguard Group, Inc. and BlackRock, Inc. are among the largest institutional holders, while the general public holds a 23% stake. Insiders, including CEO Peter Ho, also have a meaningful stake, aligning their interests with other shareholders.

title: Jack Henry and Mastercard Expand Collaboration to Address Financial Fragmentation
summary: Jack Henry and Mastercard have expanded their collaboration to help community and regional financial institutions provide accountholders with a consolidated view of their financial experiences. This partnership utilizes Mastercard's open banking platform with Finicity services to address financial fragmentation and empower consumers and businesses with more informed financial decisions. The initiative aims to place financial institutions at the center of accountholders' financial lives, particularly as financial fragmentation increasingly complicates personal finance.

title: Former Celsius exec joins JPMorgan as director of crypto regulatory policy
summary: Former Celsius executive Aaron Iovine has joined JPMorgan Chase & Co as executive director of digital assets regulatory policy, despite CEO Jamie Dimon's previous criticisms of cryptocurrencies. Iovine previously served as head of policy and regulatory affairs at the now-bankrupt crypto lender Celsius. This move highlights JPMorgan's continued involvement in digital assets amidst varied opinions on their value within the financial world.

title: DWS Appoints Dirk Goergen as Americas CEO
summary: DWS Group has appointed Dirk Goergen as its new Americas CEO, effective January 1, 2023. Goergen, who is also an Executive Board member and Global Head of Client Coverage Division, will focus on identifying growth opportunities and strengthening the firm's position in the Americas market. He succeeds Mark Cullen, who will be stepping down at the end of the year.

title: M&T sees record profits 6 months after People's United deal
summary: M&T Bank reported record profits of $647 million in the quarter following its acquisition of People's United, despite customer service issues during the system conversion. The bank also reduced its payroll by $40 million and is now looking to fill new positions through a career fair. While M&T's deposits saw a decline, the bank is actively offering incentives to attract new customers amidst market competition.

title: JPMorgan Chase’s One Paseo ‘Delivers the Firm’ to San Diego
summary: JPMorgan Chase's One Paseo office in San Diego, opened in December 2021, represents a long-term commitment to the region, bringing together Middle Market and Private Bank teams. The office, designed for accessibility and community integration, has seen significant growth in both employees and client base, and emphasizes delivering the full range of JPMorgan Chase services to San Diego businesses and residents. The firm also actively engages in philanthropic efforts through its Market Leadership Team, focusing on supporting underserved small businesses and job training programs.

title: Jamie Dimon Praises Blockchain, Calling the Technology "Real"
summary: JP Morgan CEO Jamie Dimon, despite being a vocal critic of cryptocurrencies, has praised blockchain technology as "real" due to its practical applications in finance. His company, JP Morgan, uses blockchain through its Onyx platform for efficient wholesale payments. The article also suggests the Amplify Transformational Data Sharing ETF (BLOK) as an active management investment option for long-term growth in blockchain technology.

title: JPMorgan investment banking chief Hernandez to retire in 2023
summary: Carlos Hernandez, JPMorgan's executive chair of investment and corporate banking, will retire at the end of the first quarter of next year. Hernandez, a 36-year veteran at the company, has been instrumental in growing several key segments including treasury services, investor services, and global equities business. He will work with Jim Casey and Viswas Raghavan, co-heads of global investment banking, to ensure a smooth transition.

title: Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman: “I'm perfectly happy to see our tech spend go up”
summary: Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman expressed satisfaction with increased tech spending, viewing it as crucial for efficiency and innovation, despite a 22% drop in bank revenues. He highlighted the importance of cloud technology, robo-advisors, and cybersecurity, while also reflecting on market recalibrations due to past "ridiculous" valuations and the return to fundamental economic principles. The bank's wealth management and fixed income sectors performed well, offsetting a decline in investment banking.

title: Spread the love and you could earn up to 125,000 Rapid Rewards bonus points
summary: Southwest Airlines is offering new cardholders of their Rapid Rewards® Credit Cards a chance to earn up to 125,000 bonus points through a tiered spending offer. The promotion encourages spending to unlock points, which can be redeemed for flights, gift cards, and more, providing significant value for travel. This offer is designed to attract new cardmembers and reward them for their initial spending.

title: Citigroup reports $110 mln leveraged-loan loss as other banks avoid sector exposure
summary: Citigroup reported a $110 million writedown on leveraged loans in the third quarter, contrasting with other major Wall Street banks that largely avoided or reduced their exposure to the sector. This loss reflects the broader struggles in the leveraged finance market, exacerbated by rising interest rates and investor caution, which have also impacted mergers and acquisitions.

title: Morgan Stanley rides wealth management as a third-quarter highlight
summary: Morgan Stanley's wealth management business was a key highlight in its third-quarter earnings, attracting $65 billion in net new assets and pushing the yearly total to $260 billion despite difficult market conditions. The company's net interest income also saw a significant boost due to rising interest rates, while investment banking revenues declined. Analysts remain bullish on the stock, citing the strength of its wealth management unit.

title: Surcharging and What It Means For Your Business
summary: This article explains credit card surcharging for businesses, detailing how merchants can add a fee for credit card transactions following a class action lawsuit settlement with Visa and Mastercard. It outlines eligibility criteria for the settlement, how to claim, and provides guidance on how to implement surcharging, including notification and disclosure requirements. The article also addresses frequently asked questions regarding surcharging, such as what it is, how it differs from convenience fees, and regional restrictions like those in Quebec.
source: Canadian Federation of Independent Business | CFIB
source_domain: Canadian Federation of Independent Business | CFIB

title: Morgan Stanley profit misses estimate as deals drought extends
summary: Morgan Stanley reported a 30% slump in third-quarter profit, missing analysts' estimates, as a global dealmaking slowdown significantly impacted its investment banking business. The bank's CEO expects clarity on inflation by mid-2023, while its wealth management division surprisingly showed revenue growth. The results highlight broader challenges faced by major banks due to uncertain economic conditions and rising interest rates.

title: Embedded finance: Who will lead the next payments revolution?
summary: Embedded finance, which integrates financial products into nonfinancial digital experiences, reached $20 billion in US revenues in 2021 and is projected to double within three to five years. The article explores how banks, payments providers, fintechs, and software firms can participate and succeed in this dynamic market by focusing on product breadth, depth, and program management support. Key success factors include choosing a strategic focus, building a modern developer experience, adapting to B2B2C/B2B2B sales, and developing robust support and risk services.

title: Chart of the Week: Advisors Find Safety Attractive
summary: Advisors are prioritizing safety and downside protection in fixed income due to rising interest rates, leading to increased interest in ultra-short bond ETFs. These ETFs offer higher yields than before, with popular options including both index-based Treasury ETFs and actively managed funds that incorporate investment-grade corporates and mortgages for better income generation. The article highlights specific ultra-short bond ETFs and their performance in the current rising rate environment.

title: BlackRock Sees “Generational” Fixed Income Opportunities
summary: Robert Kapito, president of BlackRock, stated there are generational opportunities in the bond market due to rising rates and US stimulus. He highlighted that attractive yields are now available with less duration or credit risk, driving significant inflows into fixed income and bond ETFs. BlackRock also addressed its ESG strategy and Liability-Driven Investing (LDI) in the UK pension industry.

title: PepsiCo Defies Fears of Consumer Slowdown With Strong Earnings and Forecast (Published 2022)
summary: PepsiCo reported strong third-quarter earnings, exceeding analyst expectations and raising its full-year forecasts for revenue and profit. This performance indicates that consumers are continuing to spend on its products despite high inflation and rising prices. The company's ability to raise prices without significantly impacting sales volumes, even as the U.S. dollar's strength affected international earnings, offered a positive signal for the broader earnings season.

title: Coca-Cola FEMSA recompra 299.8 millones de dólares en bonos
summary: Coca-Cola FEMSA conducted a public offer to repurchase $299.8 million of its outstanding senior bonds due in 2043 and 2030. HSBC and J.P. Morgan acted as dealer managers for the offer, which initially had a cap of $250 million but was increased due to high demand. The company was advised by Cleary Gottlieb Steen & Hamilton, while the banks received legal support from Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom and Galicia Abogados.

title: 2022 Diversity & Inclusion award winner: JPMorgan Chase
summary: JPMorgan Chase was recognized as a 2022 Diversity & Inclusion award winner by the San Antonio Business Journal. The financial institution is committed to teaching its leadership and staff how to be more inclusive towards each other and their clients. Managing Director Robert Perales represented JPMorgan Chase & Co. for this award.

title: With a stake in Vale, Cosan raises its bet on mining
summary: Cosan has acquired a minority stake in mining giant Vale, investing R$22 billion to reach 6.5% of the company's capital, signaling a significant bet on the mining sector's future. The move, however, raised concerns among investors and analysts regarding its financing and potential impact on Cosan's financial leverage. Cosan's executives emphasize a friendly approach and strategic alignment, viewing Vale as an "irreplicable" asset with high appreciation potential.

title: Experienced Trust Professional and More Join Pinnacle Financial Partners in the National Capital Region
summary: Pinnacle Financial Partners has announced the addition of experienced trust professional Justin Willis as a trust portfolio manager in the National Capital Region, alongside Marilyn Carrera as a financial advisor assistant and Anita Carter as a treasury management analyst. These new hires bring significant experience to the firm, strengthening its wealth management and client services in the region. The move underscores Pinnacle's commitment to building a full-service bank capable of meeting diverse client needs, leveraging the expertise and community recognition of its new team members.

title: Hunt Companies Leverages Real-Time Payments
summary: Hunt Companies partnered with J.P. Morgan and Kyriba to implement Real-Time Payment and Account Balance APIs, aiming to replace expensive and time-consuming wire payments. This integration significantly increased payment efficiencies and resulted in substantial cost savings for the company. The shift to real-time payments has saved Hunt Companies an estimated 10 hours per week and reduced wire costs by 83%, offering instant confirmation and 24/7 availability for transactions.

title: Chase Bank launches first local virtual call center in Detroit
summary: JPMorgan Chase has announced the launch of its first virtual call center in Detroit, aiming to create dozens of jobs for local residents and support financial inclusion. The initiative builds on the firm's $200 million investment in the city since 2014, offering roles with competitive pay, tuition assistance, and "second-chance" opportunities for individuals with criminal backgrounds. This move highlights Chase's commitment to inclusive growth and racial equity, with plans for potential expansion if successful.

title: CD&R Appoints Former JPMorgan Chase & Co. Executive Gordon Smith as Operating Advisor
summary: Clayton, Dubilier & Rice (CD&R) announced the appointment of Gordon Smith, former Co-President and Chief Operating Officer of JPMorgan Chase & Co., as an Operating Advisor to CD&R funds. Smith will collaborate with CD&R's financial services team to identify new investments and provide guidance to portfolio companies, leveraging his nearly 40 years of financial services experience. This strategic move aims to broaden opportunities for CD&R funds and enhance the expertise available to their portfolio companies.

title: The 3 Most Popular Equity Income ETFs
summary: Amidst market volatility, bear markets, and high inflation, many investors are turning to dividend stocks and related ETFs for income and less volatility. This article highlights three of the most popular equity income ETFs, detailing their inflows, investment strategies, and expense ratios. The ETFs discussed are SCHD, JEPI, and VYM, each offering distinct approaches to generating income and outperforming the broader market.

title: JPMorgan Chase pilots 'virtual call center' with Detroit remote workers
summary: JPMorgan Chase is piloting its first virtual call center in the nation, hiring approximately 50 remote workers from Detroit. The new full-time roles offer a starting wage of $22.50 an hour plus benefits, and the company views this as a potential model to replicate elsewhere. This initiative stems from lessons learned during the COVID-19 pandemic regarding remote work viability and is supported by collaboration with Detroit at Work.

title: CFPB fines Regions $191M on overdraft practices
summary: The CFPB has fined Regions Bank $191 million for charging "illegal surprise" overdraft fees between 2018 and 2021. The penalty includes a $50 million fine and $141 million in restitution to customers affected by "authorized-positive" fees, which the bank states it eliminated over a year ago. This action highlights ongoing regulatory scrutiny of overdraft practices, with other banks also modifying or eliminating such fees.

title: Regions Bank to repay customers $141 million in illegal overdraft fees
summary: Regions Bank has been ordered to repay $141 million to customers for illegally charging overdraft fees between 2018 and 2021, even after telling customers they had sufficient funds. This marks the second time in a decade the bank has been penalized for such practices, highlighting an ongoing issue with "surprise overdraft fees" across the financial industry. The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau also fined Regions an additional $50 million.

title: CEO Says He’s Been “Praying for Inflation” Because It’s an Excuse to Jack Up Prices
summary: Iron Mountain CEO William Meaney candidly admitted at an investor event that he has been "praying for inflation" because it allows the company to significantly increase prices and expand profit margins. This admission highlights how corporations use inflation as a pretext to raise prices beyond increased costs, leading to record-high corporate profits. The article contrasts this corporate strategy with the Federal Reserve's approach to curb inflation by aiming to reduce wages and increase unemployment.

title: JPMorgan doubles down on UK retail bank Chase
summary: JPMorgan plans to double the workforce at its UK retail bank Chase to at least 2,000 within two years, despite initial losses and investor skepticism. The bank has attracted one million customers and over 10 billion pounds in deposits since its launch and aims to expand its offerings with lending products and integrate its investments business Nutmeg. This move signals JPMorgan's commitment to building a full-service international digital bank, despite a challenging market and competition.

title: Why Japanese Equities Are “The Lone TINA Trade”
summary: The article argues that Japanese equities represent the "lone TINA trade" (There Is No Alternative) as bond yields rise in most other countries, but remain negative in Japan. With a weakening yen and attractive valuations, Japanese stocks offer significant investment potential, particularly for those hedging against currency fluctuations. WisdomTree Japan Hedged Equity Fund (DXJ) is highlighted as a vehicle to capture these opportunities.

title: Questioning CEOs of America’s Largest Banks on Efforts to Block Gun Purchases, Legal Commerce
summary: Senator Kevin Cramer questioned the CEOs of major U.S. banks during a Senate Banking Committee hearing regarding their commitment to processing transactions for legal goods and services, particularly in light of pressures to block gun purchases. Senator Cramer specifically challenged the banks on a new Merchant Category Code for gun and ammunition stores and sought assurances that legal transactions would not be discriminated against. All seven bank CEOs present committed to processing transactions for legal goods and services, including guns and ammunition.

title: Bank CEOs questioned on consumer protections, social issues
summary: Bank CEOs faced a second day of questioning on Capitol Hill regarding consumer protections and social issues. Senate Democrats pressed for more consumer safeguards amidst high inflation, while Republicans questioned banks' involvement in social issues. Topics included overdraft fees, Zelle fraud, and banks' stances on abortion costs, gun rights, and environmental policies.

title: US bank CEOs say they would stop working with China in event of Taiwan attack
summary: Top US bank CEOs stated they would cease operations in China if the US government instructed them to do so following a Taiwan invasion by mainland forces. This commitment was made during a House of Representatives Financial Services Committee hearing where lawmakers questioned their institutions' business ties to both Russia and China. The CEOs of JPMorgan Chase, Wells Fargo, Bank of America, Citigroup, US Bancorp, PNC Financial, and Truist were present.

title: Shorting Bonds? The Case for a Seldom-Used Tactic
summary: A new research paper argues that rising interest rates present an ideal opportunity for investors to consider shorting bonds, a seldom-used tactic. Despite historical investor hesitancy, with rates turning around and bond prices falling, 2022 has shown profitability for shorting government bonds. The paper by Kathryn Kaminski of AlphaSimplex suggests that when rates are increasing, shorting bonds can often be profitable and even boasts a generally positive Sharpe ratio.

title: Bank CEOs push back on capital requirements in Capitol Hill hearings
summary: CEOs from seven of the largest U.S. banks, including JPMorgan Chase, Citigroup, Wells Fargo, and Bank of America, engaged in two days of public hearings on Capitol Hill. They addressed various topics such as inflation, racial equality in home lending, regulatory burdens, and their perspectives on an impending economic slowdown. A key point of discussion was their pushback on capital requirements.

title: Houston-based space tech company to go public via SPAC merger
summary: Houston-based space exploration company Intuitive Machines plans to go public through a SPAC merger with Inflection Point Acquisition Corp., valuing the combined company at $815 million. Anticipated to close in Q1 2023, the deal will list Intuitive Machines on Nasdaq under the ticker LUNR. The company, which has a $262 million backlog in NASA contracts and a history of significant revenue growth, is also expanding its facilities and has secured $105 million in capital commitments to fuel future growth in the expanding space exploration market.

title: United Community Bank’s CEO Lynn Harton Sees Two Dimensions to Leadership
summary: Lynn Harton, CEO of United Community Bank, defines leadership as having a positive vision and followers, emphasizing continuous personal growth. United Community Bank, known for its customer service and having $24.2 billion in assets, fosters employee development through programs like Career Pathing and Leadership Academy. Harton aims for United to be a "legendary bank" recognized by employees, customers, and shareholders.

title: Horizon Kinetics Inflation Beneficiaries ETF (NYSEARCA:INFL) Holdings Boosted by Lowe Wealth Advisors LLC
summary: Lowe Wealth Advisors LLC increased its stake in Horizon Kinetics Inflation Beneficiaries ETF (INFL) by 7.3% in the second quarter, making it their 8th biggest position. Other institutional investors like Flow Traders U.S. LLC, Newman Dignan & Sheerar Inc., Wedbush Securities Inc., and JPMorgan Chase & Co. also modified their holdings, with JPMorgan Chase & Co. significantly raising its stake. The ETF's shares traded down recently, with a 1-year low of $27.26 and a 1-year high of $34.84.

title: Hashdex Launches ’33 Act Bitcoin ETF With DEFI
summary: Hashdex, a cryptocurrency asset manager, has launched the Hashdex Bitcoin Futures ETF (DEFI), the world's first bitcoin futures ETF registered under the Securities Act of 1933. Developed with Teucrium Trading and Victory Capital Management, DEFI will be available on NYSE Arca from September 16, offering investors regulated exposure to the digital asset class with a different tax treatment than ’40 Act Bitcoin futures ETFs. This launch signifies Hashdex's commitment to providing innovative and regulated products globally, building on its work with the Nasdaq Crypto Index and other crypto offerings.

title: Nikko unveils metaverse ETF in Hong Kong
summary: Nikko Asset Management has launched a new actively managed metaverse thematic equity ETF in Hong Kong, the NikkoAM Metaverse Theme Active ETF, listed in HKD (3091 HK) and USD (9091 HK). The ETF offers exposure to companies globally involved in developing and enabling the metaverse, with estimated ongoing charges of 1.25%. This new offering joins the CSOP Metaverse Concept ETF (3034 HK) and the Samsung Asia Pacific ex NZ Metaverse Theme ETF (3172 HK) in the Hong Kong market.

title: AIG’s Corebridge Is Year’s Largest IPO at $1.7B
summary: AIG's life insurance and retirement division, Corebridge Financial Inc., successfully raised $1.68 billion in its initial public offering, marking the largest IPO of the year despite significant market volatility. AIG sold 80 million shares at $21 each, valuing Corebridge at $13.6 billion, with all proceeds going to AIG as the company seeks to focus on its property and casualty business. This listing also represents the biggest U.S. IPO of 2022, surpassing TPG Inc.'s $1.1 billion listing in January.

title: AIG unit Corebridge Financial's IPO prices at low end of range to raise $1.6 billion and mark biggest IPO of the year so far
summary: AIG's life insurance unit, Corebridge Financial Inc., priced its initial public offering at $21 per share, the low end of its price range, raising $1.68 billion. This makes it the biggest IPO of the year to date, despite falling short of an initial target of $1.8 billion due to market conditions. The shares are set to begin trading on the NYSE under the ticker "CRBG" and the IPO surpasses the $1 billion raised by TPG Inc. earlier in what has been a subdued year for IPOs.

title: AIG unit Corebridge Financial's IPO prices at low end of range to raise $1.6 billion and mark biggest IPO of the year so far
summary: AIG's life insurance unit, Corebridge Financial Inc., priced its initial public offering at $21 a share, the low end of its anticipated range, successfully raising $1.68 billion. This makes it the largest IPO of the year despite a challenging market environment and a recent selloff in the Dow Jones Industrial Average. The shares are set to begin trading on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker "CRBG."

title: AIG unit Corebridge Financial's IPO prices at low end of range to raise $1.6 billion and mark biggest IPO of the year so far
summary: AIG's life insurance unit, Corebridge Financial Inc., priced its initial public offering at $21 a share, the low end of its target range, raising $1.68 billion. This makes it the biggest IPO of the year to date, despite facing investor pushback after a market selloff. The shares are set to begin trading on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker "CRBG."

title: Comerica Bank Is Building a New Business and Innovation Hub at The Star in Frisco
summary: Comerica Bank is constructing a new Business & Innovation Hub at The Star in Frisco, slated to open in late 2023 or early 2024, which will house approximately 300 employees and feature an innovation center and "tech genius bar." This expansion aims to enhance cross-functional collaboration and meet evolving needs, complementing its downtown Dallas headquarters. The facility will be located in a new Class A+ tower at 17 Cowboys Way and is designed by HKS Architects.

title: AIG Announces Pricing of Corebridge Financial, Inc. Initial Public Offering
summary: American International Group, Inc. (AIG) announced the pricing of the initial public offering (IPO) of Corebridge Financial, Inc. at $21 per share. The offering involves AIG selling 80 million shares of Corebridge common stock, expecting to generate approximately $1.7 billion in gross proceeds. Corebridge shares are set to begin trading on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol "CRBG" on September 15, 2022.

title: Powell Says Money Not Important for Inflation
summary: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell contends that high inflation is due to the pandemic and that monetary aggregates are no longer important for inflation. Former Bank of England Governor Mervyn King rebutted this view, asserting that "money matters" and that central bankers have been wrong to ignore the link between money supply and inflation. The article also includes Adrian Day's comments on Osisko Gold Royalties Ltd.'s recent copper royalty acquisition and lists several gold and silver mining companies as "Best Buys."

title: JPMorgan Chase buys payments firm Renovite
summary: JPMorgan Chase has acquired Renovite Technologies, a California-based payments services company, to enhance its merchant card payment processing services and expand globally. The acquisition aims to boost JPMorgan's merchant-acquiring revenue and help it better compete with fintech rivals after a recent leveling off in that segment. This deal continues JPMorgan's strategy of acquiring nonbank entities, particularly those with an overseas or fintech focus, due to regulatory restrictions on acquiring U.S. deposit-taking institutions.

title: JP Morgan Chase’s Rhea Marpu: Helping to boost security and diversity
summary: Rhea Pritham Marpu, Vice President for JPMorgan Chase, plays a critical role in boosting the cybersecurity posture of the largest bank in the U.S., overseeing data protection for over 300,000 internal users within a zero-trust architecture. Beyond her technical contributions, Marpu is dedicated to promoting diversity by leading mentorship programs and representing JPMorgan Chase at women in tech conferences. Her work highlights the blend of technical expertise and human skills essential for robust security and career development in the financial industry.

title: J.P. Morgan Asset Management Expands Sustainable Thematic ETF Suite with Launch of CIRC, UPWD & BLLD
summary: J.P. Morgan Asset Management (JPMAM) has expanded its active sustainable thematic ETF suite with the launch of three new funds: JPMorgan Sustainable Consumption ETF (CIRC), JPMorgan Social Advancement ETF (UPWD), and JPMorgan Sustainable Infrastructure ETF (BLLD). These ETFs aim to provide clients with access to alpha opportunities by investing in companies addressing major global trends related to sustainable consumption, social advancement, and sustainable infrastructure. The funds leverage JPMAM's extensive research capabilities and active management approach to offer tailored stock selection in the growing sustainable investing market.

title: SK Closes Sale of NuCera Solutions to Chase
summary: An affiliate of funds advised by SK Capital Partners has completed the sale of NuCera Solutions to Chase Corp. for $250 million. NuCera, a leading producer of specialty polymers, will be integrated into Chase's Adhesives, Sealants and Additives reporting unit. This acquisition is seen by Chase as transformational for its strategic growth, expanding its presence in high-growth end markets.

title: Longtime Adams Funds CEO Mark Stoeckle to retire; successor named
summary: Mark E. Stoeckle is retiring as CEO of Adams Funds, with James P. Haynie slated to take over. Stoeckle successfully guided Adams Funds through significant market volatility, including the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Emerge to Launch 10 Sustainable ETFs That Are All Run by Women
summary: Emerge is launching 10 new sustainable ETFs, with each fund managed by women. These funds, listed on both the Cboe BZX Exchange in the US and the NEO Exchange in Canada, will invest in equity securities while excluding categories like gambling and chemical weapons. Emerge, Canada's first women-owned investment fund firm, also plans to debut a program called EMPWR to encourage more women to become investment managers for sustainability-focused funds.

title: The US is a core market for UBS and its Financial Advisors | UBS United States of America
summary: This article highlights why UBS considers the US a core market for its wealth management business and financial advisors. It addresses common misconceptions about UBS's US operations, emphasizing its global scale, client-centric approach, and focus on supporting financial advisors with extensive resources and direct access to senior leadership. The piece also underlines UBS's leading position in wealth management and its commitment to continued investment in the US market, citing its high productivity per advisor and comprehensive service offerings.

title: As merger deadline passes, State Street, Brown Brothers Harriman keep talking
summary: State Street Corp. and Brown Brothers Harriman are continuing talks regarding State Street's proposed acquisition of BBH's investor services division, despite missing their Sept. 6 merger deadline. The $3.5 billion deal has faced delays and scrutiny from federal regulators, leading to discussions about modified structures and financial terms. Both companies remain committed to the strategic rationale of the merger, though analysts suggest a price renegotiation might be necessary to reflect the timeline and any required changes for regulatory approval.

title: 5 Ways You Can Get Income From Your Investments Right Now |…
summary: This article outlines five easy ways investors can generate income from their investments, offering yields of up to 9%. It covers dividend-paying stocks and ETFs, bonds, REITs, Master Limited Partnerships (MLPs), and preferred shares. The author emphasizes the importance of diversifying an income portfolio to suit individual risk tolerance.

title: Episode #441: Marlena Lee, DFA – Value, Fama & Weathering Bear Markets
summary: This article features an interview with Marlena Lee, Global Head of Investment Solutions for Dimensional Fund Advisors (DFA), where she discusses her experience as a teaching assistant for Nobel laureate Eugene Fama and her insights on value investing. She also shares DFA's approach to weathering bear markets, applying factors to fixed income, and their recent entry into the ETF space. The discussion highlights the importance of diversification, long-term investing, and the role of financial advisors in managing investment emotions.

title: FreshBooks taps PwC alum as new CFO
summary: FreshBooks, a cloud accounting software company, has appointed Wayne Jackson as its new CFO, effective September 6, 2022. Jackson, formerly CFO at Cantaloupe, Inc. and SecureWorks, brings extensive experience in M&A, international expansion, and financial management. His appointment comes as FreshBooks experiences growth, supported by a $125 million loan to fund strategic acquisitions and global expansion.

title: How does ETF redemption work, and what are economic impacts? – The FinReg Blog
summary: This article explores the mechanics and economic impacts of corporate bond ETF redemptions, particularly addressing discrepancies between ETF share prices and NAVs observed during crises like COVID-19. It investigates the incentives of ETFs and authorized participants (APs) in negotiating redemption baskets and analyzes the consequences for investors and market demand. The research finds that ETFs dispose of high price pressure bonds while APs select components that negatively co-move with the liquidity of their portfolios, reconciling debates between policymakers and practitioners.

title: UBS, Wealthfront Call Off Merger
summary: UBS Group AG and robo-advisor Wealthfront Inc. have terminated their planned $1.4 billion merger, with UBS instead providing nearly $70 million in financing for Wealthfront at the same valuation. Wealthfront's CEO expressed excitement about the company's future as an independent entity, while UBS reaffirmed its commitment to growth in the U.S. and its digital wealth management offerings. This decision comes after UBS's Q2 earnings fell short of expectations and as competitors push further into the self-directed market.

title: TD Ameritrade: Roxanna Islam Talks Generating Income with CEFs
summary: Roxanna Islam of VettaFi discussed closed-end funds (CEFs) on TD Ameritrade Network, highlighting their appeal for income generation despite investor concerns about rising rates due to leverage. She noted that while prices and asset values fell during previous rate hikes, distribution cuts were less severe than expected and that CEFs like Invesco Senior Income Trust CEF VVR and PIMCO Dynamic Income Opportunities Fund PDO offer strong income potential and are less sensitive to rising rates.

title: Citigroup's Russia exit removes one obstacle for CEO, but challenges remain
summary: Citigroup CEO Jane Fraser is working to simplify the bank's structure and focus on core businesses by exiting Russia and paring down consumer operations in other countries. While investors and analysts acknowledge the positive direction, Fraser faces significant challenges, including overhauling risk management systems mandated by U.S. regulators and a potentially deteriorating economic environment. Despite these hurdles, some investors are showing patience with her long-term strategy for a "simpler, sounder bank."

title: CBOE's Weekly Market Recap: August 15 To August 19
summary: The CBOE's weekly market recap for August 15-19 indicates a potential end to the recent market rally, with experts from BlackRock and JPMorgan warning of resistance due to worsening global economic conditions. Major ETFs like SPY and several European ETFs, along with cryptocurrencies Bitcoin and Ethereum, experienced declines. Zoom Video Communications also saw its stock tumble after a revenue miss despite positive EPS.

title: Atlantic Union Bank Names Sherry Williams Chief Risk Officer
summary: Atlantic Union Bank has appointed Sherry Williams as its new Chief Risk Officer, effective by October 2022. Williams will oversee the company's enterprise and regulatory risk management functions. She brings 26 years of experience from previous roles at Amalgamated Bank, PwC, SunTrust Bank, State of Georgia, and Ernst & Young LLP, holding a doctorate in business administration and several professional certifications.

title: MetLife Investment Management to acquire ESG fixed-income manager Affirmative Investment Management
summary: MetLife Investment Management is set to acquire Affirmative Investment Management, an ESG-focused fixed-income manager. The acquisition strengthens MetLife's offerings in the growing ESG investment space. This move will allow MetLife to expand its capabilities in responsible and sustainable investing.

title: Meet the Most Trusted Financial Companies for 2022, according to MarketWatch and IBD survey
summary: A MarketWatch and Investor’s Business Daily survey identified the most trusted financial companies for 2022 amidst market volatility and economic uncertainty. USAA and Vanguard secured the top overall spots. Divisions of JPMorgan Chase, Primerica, and AllianceBernstein also made their debut on the ranking, which highlighted companies excelling in trustworthiness across various financial sectors.

title: JPMorgan Chase Applies to Open Its First Downtown Baltimore Branch
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. is set to open its first downtown Baltimore branch at 100 S. Charles St. in 2023, following an application filed with the federal Office of the Comptroller of the Currency. This move is part of the bank's aggressive expansion strategy in the region, aiming to open 70 new branches across Maryland, Washington, D.C., and Virginia by the end of 2025, doubling its initial goal. The new downtown branch will be Chase's seventh in Baltimore City and contributes to 13 total in Greater Baltimore.

title: Morgan Stanley Advisor Uses Lessons From Growing Up In India To Manage $10 Billion For Clients
summary: Ron Basu, a Managing Director at Morgan Stanley Private Wealth Management, manages $10.4 billion in assets for clients, applying lessons learned from his upbringing in India, such as the importance of diversification due to currency depreciation and instability. Basu's investment philosophy emphasizes cashflow and compounding, and he prioritizes fundamental investing in tangible assets. He is currently navigating market volatility and geopolitical challenges by working with clients on hedging strategies and raising cash, while dealing with the stress of an interconnected global market.

title: While mutual funds suffer losses, active ETFs continue to flourish
summary: Despite significant outflows and market declines impacting mutual funds, active Exchange Traded Funds (ETFs) are experiencing strong growth. Investors worldwide withdrew a net US$640 billion from actively managed mutual funds in H1 2022, while active ETFs drew a net US$51.8 billion, demonstrating their increasing appeal, partly due to regulatory changes and structural advantages.

title: Heartland Express acquires CFI assets for $525 million
summary: Heartland Express acquired Contract Freighters Inc.'s (CFI) truckload and Mexican logistics units from TFI International for $525 million, making it the eighth-largest truckload fleet in the U.S. The deal, funded by cash and debt, is expected to immediately boost Heartland's earnings and increase its annual revenue to approximately $1.3 billion. CFI will continue to operate under its existing brand and management team, with Heartland aiming for an 85% or better adjusted operating ratio within three years.

title: Clayton-based investment manager launches new fund designed to reach the 'masses'
summary: Argent Capital Management, an investment firm based in Clayton, has launched a new mid-cap exchange-traded fund (ETF). This fund is designed to make their investment strategy, previously exclusive to investors with $250,000, accessible to a broader range of smaller-scale investors.

title: First Internet Bank launches small-business account
summary: First Internet Bank has launched a new checking account, "Do More Business Checking," specifically designed for small-business owners. This product allows business owners to earn interest, make unlimited transactions, and link various financial accounts for a comprehensive view of both business and personal finances. The initiative aims to simplify day-to-day operations for small businesses and tap into a significant market opportunity previously dominated by third-party providers and fintechs.

title: JP Morgan AM launches US small cap ETF
summary: J.P. Morgan Asset Management (JPMAM) has launched a new US small-cap equity ETF, the JPM BetaBuilders US Small Cap Equity UCITS ETF (BBSC), expanding its passive BetaBuilders range. The ETF tracks the Morningstar US Small Cap Target Market Exposure index, offering exposure to approximately 1,500 small-cap companies with a total expense ratio (TER) of 0.14%. This launch responds to ongoing demand for US equities and follows JPMAM's earlier expansion of its ETF offerings in 2022.

title: US, European banks could lose over $5bn from risky buyout loans
summary: Top US and European banks face potential losses of over $5 billion from leveraged and bridge loans due to rising interest rates and a slowdown in the leveraged buyout market. Banks like Bank of America are particularly exposed, having committed to financing large buyout deals, while difficulties in offloading debt to investors are forcing underwriters to sell at a discount. The market disruption is primarily attributed to the Federal Reserve's aggressive monetary policy tightening to combat inflation.

title: Anshu Jain, Who Took Deutsche Bank to Wall Street, Dies at 59 (Published 2022)
summary: Anshu Jain, the former co-chief executive of Deutsche Bank, died at 59 from intestinal cancer. He was instrumental in transforming Deutsche Bank from a conservative German lender into a Wall Street investment banking powerhouse. However, his aggressive pursuit of complex financial products ultimately led to his resignation due to regulatory problems and a downturn in the bank's fortunes.

title: Executive Leadership Drives JPMorgan Chase’s Delivery Of Customer And Business Value From Data Investments
summary: JPMorgan Chase, under executive leadership, is aggressively leveraging data and analytics to enhance customer experience and drive business value, as highlighted at its Investor Day. The bank's Chief Data & Analytics Officer, Mark Birkhead, details initiatives across retail banking and wealth management, focusing on real-time personalization, extended intelligence, and a massive data modernization effort, including cloud migration and a "data marketplace." This commitment to data is a long-term strategic priority, aiming for significant value generation from AI and machine learning investments while emphasizing data responsibility and ethical use through programs like the Data for Good Hackathon.

title: Things are getting tricky for State Street’s blockbuster acquisition
summary: State Street's $3.5 billion acquisition of Brown Brothers Harriman's investor services business is facing significant delays and increased federal scrutiny, nearly a year after its announcement. President Biden's administration has made bank mergers a target of closer examination, leading State Street to consider restructuring the deal, including a potential price adjustment, hoping to close by the end of 2022. The extended timeline and regulatory challenges have fueled uncertainty among shareholders, though State Street remains committed to the transaction.

title: Wells Fargo plans retreat from mortgage business
summary: Wells Fargo & Co. is planning to significantly reduce its mortgage business after years of regulatory scrutinized and changes in leadership. The bank, which once held a dominant share of the U.S. home loan market, aims to focus on lending to existing customers and scale back operations like correspondent mortgage lending and third-party servicing. This strategic shift reflects a broader industry trend among large banks to moderate their mortgage exposure following the 2008 financial crisis and ongoing regulatory challenges.

title: J.P. Morgan Asset Management Announces Liquidation of Two Exchange-Traded Funds
summary: J.P. Morgan Asset Management announced the upcoming liquidation and dissolution of two exchange-traded funds, JPMorgan U.S. Minimum Volatility ETF (JMIN) and JPMorgan U.S. Dividend ETF (JDIV). Shareholders can sell their holdings on NYSE Arca until September 6, 2022, with the liquidation date set for September 14, 2022. Those holding shares after this date will receive a cash distribution equal to the net asset value.

title: PNC Drops Another Type of Fee After Overhauling Overdraft Policy
summary: PNC Financial Services Group Inc. has eliminated non-sufficient fund (NSF) fees, joining other large banks in removing charges that have drawn criticism from politicians and consumer advocates. These fees were previously charged when a transaction was returned due to insufficient funds in a customer's account. PNC had already removed NSF fees from its Virtual Wallet Spend feature and is now extending this policy to other personal checking-account options.

title: JPMorgan Chase Avoided Public Punishment From CFPB Under Trump After Discovery of Alleged Fake Accounts
summary: JPMorgan Chase (JPM) allegedly avoided public sanctions from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) during the Trump administration for creating fake accounts, despite the agency identifying serious instances at four banks after the Wells Fargo scandal. The CFPB's enforcement unit investigated Chase for several years but closed the matter in early 2020. This incident highlights a broader trend during the Trump administration where financial institutions like TD Bank (TD) also faced private reprimands instead of public penalties for similar misconduct, drawing criticism from lawmakers like Senator Elizabeth Warren.

title: Has Inflation Peaked? Here's What the Experts Are Saying
summary: Inflation decelerated more than expected in July, leading to a split among economists and market strategists on whether this marks a peak in inflation and how it will impact Federal Reserve policy. While some see the report as positive evidence for a softer landing and less aggressive rate hikes, others emphasize the need for sustained slowdowns before the Fed becomes confident in controlling price pressures.

title: Staten Island’s Best Dressed: 2022 SIEDC Annual Awards Gala at Angelina’s Ristorante
summary: The 2022 SIEDC Annual Awards Gala, themed "Off to the Races," celebrated community and business leaders on Staten Island. Honorees included Diane Arneth, Carol Decina, Joseph Ferrara, Gina Laine, and Dr. Joanne Gerenser, with awards for "Best Dressed" attendees. The event, presented by Northfield Bank, featured entertainment, a silent auction, and horse racing games.

title: Principal Financial’s benefits business jumps while AUM slumps in 2Q
summary: Principal Financial Group saw a strong performance in its employee benefits business in the second quarter, driven by growth in the small- and medium-sized business market, with premium and fees increasing by 11%.
