This growth partially offset a 9% decline in overall earnings to $423 million year-over-year, largely due to volatile markets, high inflation, and a slump in assets under management following the sale of its U.S. retail fixed annuity and universal life businesses. The company also returned $1.3 billion of capital to shareholders.

title: Groupon lays off hundreds of employees
summary: Groupon, the Chicago-based e-commerce marketplace, has laid off more than 500 employees, approximately 15% of its workforce, across various departments. This decision comes as the company restructures to focus on "self-service merchant acquisition capabilities," reduce cloud infrastructure, and rationalize its real estate footprint, citing that its overall business performance is not meeting anticipated levels and its cost structure is not aligned with its performance. Groupon joins a growing list of companies including Fender, Robinhood, Apple, Google, Vox Media, 7-Eleven, Meta, JPMorgan Chase & Co., Coinbase, Netflix, and Tesla that have recently announced layoffs or slowing hiring efforts ahead of an anticipated economic downturn.

title: Watkins Advises on Global Blood Therapeutics’ US$5.4 Billion Sale to Pfizer
summary: Latham & Watkins LLP advised J.P. Morgan Securities LLC and Centerview Partners LLC, financial advisors to Global Blood Therapeutics (GBT), on its US$5.4 billion sale to Pfizer Inc. The acquisition aims to enhance Pfizer's rare hematology offerings and reinforce its commitment to addressing critical needs in the underserved sickle cell disease community with GBT's pipeline.

title: Breaking: Class Action Lawsuits Filed Against Coinbase As It Reaches Supreme Court
summary: Three new class action lawsuits have been filed against Coinbase and its executives, accusing the company of making false and misleading statements, failing to disclose bankruptcy risks, and violating securities law. These lawsuits follow Coinbase's move to the Supreme Court to settle two previous class actions related to scam and Dogecoin sweepstakes. The new litigation alleges Coinbase failed to communicate regulatory scrutiny and that its shares dropped due to these issues, even as CEO Brian Armstrong apologized for late disclosure.

title: 5 Minutes With ... Jamie Dimon, chairman and CEO of JPMorgan Chase & Co.
summary: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon was in Boston to announce plans for Chase Bank to significantly expand its footprint in Massachusetts, aiming to grow from 36 to nearly 90 branches by 2025. This expansion follows Dimon's previous visit to open a new branch in Mattapan and poses a potential long-term threat to current Boston banks.

title: Most Influential Women: Emily Nachlas, Western Alliance Bancorporation
summary: Emily Nachlas, Chief Risk Officer at Western Alliance Bancorporation, has been recognized as one of Arizona's Most Influential Women of 2022 by Az Business and AZRE magazines. The article highlights her extensive experience, her role as a mentor, and her philanthropic efforts in fostering over 50 small dogs. Nachlas also cites Judy Sheindlin (Judge Judy) as a significant source of inspiration.

title: Disney class action alleges Visa, Mastercard charge high transaction fees
summary: The Walt Disney Co. has filed a class action lawsuit against Visa and Mastercard, alleging that the payment companies colluded to force merchants to pay excessively high transaction fees for over a decade, violating antitrust laws. Disney claims these "interchange fees" are supracompetitive and seeks damages, fees, and costs, arguing that more competition between card-issuers would benefit both merchants and consumers. This action follows Disney's decision to opt out of a previous $6 billion multidistrict litigation settlement with Visa and Mastercard regarding similar fee-fixing allegations.

title: Faulty Equifax Credit Score Reporting Prevents Consumers From Getting Auto Loans, Mortgages and Credit Cards
summary: Equifax erroneously reported faulty credit scores to millions of American consumers between mid-March and April, affecting applications for auto loans, mortgages, and credit cards. The errors, some as significant as 20 points, led to some consumers being rejected or receiving incorrect interest rates. Equifax attributed the issue to a coding error, stating it has been fixed, and that only a small number of consumers may have been negatively impacted.

title: Morgan Stanley Advisor Uses Sustainable Investing Expertise To Manage $2.5 Billion For Clients
summary: Katy Zhao, a Senior Vice President at Morgan Stanley Wealth Management, manages $2.5 billion in assets for clients, leveraging her expertise in sustainable investing. She developed Morgan Stanley's first ESG model portfolio and integrates ESG factors into her investment philosophy, an approach popular with her client base. Zhao focuses on direct investments rather than mutual funds or ETFs, positioning client portfolios defensively amidst a deleveraging cycle, and aims to help clients navigate market volatility and avoid social media-driven investment misconceptions.

title: J.P. Morgan hires trio of private bankers in Chicago
summary: J.P. Morgan Private Bank has hired a three-person team of private bankers from Citigroup in Chicago. This team previously managed over $2 billion in client assets. The move is part of J.P. Morgan's broader strategy to expand its wealth management operation, with plans to hire more advisors in the Chicago region and nationally.

title: Ron Kruszewski, Chairman and CEO of Stifel Financial Corp.
summary: This article provides a profile of Ron Kruszewski, the Chairman and CEO of Stifel Financial Corp. It details his extensive career at Stifel since 1997, his leadership roles in prominent financial industry associations like the American Securities Association and SIFMA, and his involvement in various community and philanthropic organizations. The piece also highlights his recognition with the Horatio Alger Award and his membership in The Wall Street Journal’s CEO Council.

title: Charles Schwab's $655B Asset Management Arm to Start Trading Crypto-Related ETF This Week
summary: Charles Schwab's asset management arm, Schwab Asset Management, which manages $655 billion, is set to offer its first crypto-related exchange-traded fund (ETF) this week. The Schwab Crypto Thematic ETF aims to provide investors with global exposure to companies that may benefit from the development or utilization of cryptocurrencies and other digital assets. This move positions Schwab to compete with major asset managers like Blackrock, Fidelity, and Vanguard in the crypto space.

title: Should You Pounce on These 8%-Yielding Preferreds?
summary: This article discusses preferred stocks as a hybrid investment offering high, stable yields, particularly through closed-end funds (CEFs). It highlights three specific CEFs—Cohen & Steers Tax-Advantaged Preferred Securities and Income Fund (PTA), Flaherty & Crumrine Preferred and Income Securities Fund (FFC), and Nuveen Preferred & Income Opportunities (JPC)—that offer over 8% dividends. The author advises caution due to current market conditions but recommends adding these funds to a watchlist for their income-generating potential.

title: Duddell Street Acquisition Corp. and FiscalNote Complete Business Combination
summary: Duddell Street Acquisition Corp. (Nasdaq: DSAC) has completed its business combination with FiscalNote Holdings, Inc., an AI-driven enterprise SaaS company. FiscalNote's Class A common stock and warrants are expected to begin trading on the New York Stock Exchange on August 1, 2022, under the ticker symbols "NOTE" and "NOTE WS." The long-term growth plan is funded by $425 million in capital, and FiscalNote's Co-Founder, Chairman & CEO Tim Hwang will ring the NYSE Opening Bell on August 4, 2022.

title: LendingClub Names Drew LaBenne as New Chief Financial Officer
summary: LendingClub has appointed Drew LaBenne as its new Chief Financial Officer, effective September 1, 2022. LaBenne, previously CFO of Bakkt and Amalgamated Bank, will succeed Tom Casey, who is retiring from both his CFO role and the Board of Directors. This transition aims to leverage LaBenne's extensive banking experience as LendingClub continues its evolution as a digital marketplace bank.

title: My Experience Visiting A Capital One Cafe
summary: The author shares their first experience visiting a Capital One Cafe, highlighting its unique blend of a coffee shop and bank. They found it to be a quiet place to work, offering 50% off beverages for Capital One cardholders, and noted the presence of "Cafe Ambassadors" for banking questions without sales pressure. The article concludes that these cafes present a pleasant alternative to traditional coffee shops like Starbucks, especially for Capital One customers.

title: Finexio Raises $14 Million in Initial Close of Series B, Company Valued at $100 Million
summary: Finexio announced the initial close of its $30 million Series B funding round, raising $14 million at a pre-money valuation of $100 million. This round was co-led by Mendon Venture Partners and National Bank Holdings Corporation (NYSE: NBHC), with additional participation from Discover Financial Services (NYSE: DFS) and other investors. The funding will accelerate the adoption of Finexio's "B2B Payments-as-a-Service platform," foster team growth, and advance product development.

title: MasTec Acquires IEA for Wind, Solar Energy Infrastructure Expertise
summary: MasTec has entered into a definitive agreement to acquire Infrastructure and Energy Alternatives Inc. (IEA) in a cash-and-stock transaction valued at $14 per IEA share, totaling approximately $1.1 billion. This acquisition aims to expand MasTec's service capabilities in renewable energy infrastructure, particularly wind and solar projects, and is expected to close in late Q4 2022. The deal combines IEA's expertise in utility-scale wind and solar projects with MasTec's existing infrastructure services, anticipating increased scale and capacity to meet growing demand for renewable power generation.

title: Bank of Montreal Taps North Texas for its Newest Tech Hub
summary: The Bank of Montreal (BMO) is establishing a new tech hub in North Texas, planning to hire 50 new employees to add to its existing 250-person DFW workforce. This move is part of BMO's strategy to expand its U.S. operations and follows similar investments by other major banks like JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America, and PNC Bank in the Dallas-Fort Worth region. The Irving tech hub will be BMO's first outside of Toronto and Chicago, focusing on areas like cybersecurity and engineering.

title: BNY Mellon Wealth Management Named Rob Zaccardi Senior Client Strategist in Boston
summary: BNY Mellon Wealth Management has appointed Rob Zaccardi as Senior Client Strategist in Boston. He will work with ultra-high-net-worth families, business owners, corporate executives, and foundations/endowments on their comprehensive wealth needs. Zaccardi brings over 12 years of financial services experience, previously serving as executive director at JP Morgan Private Bank.

title: State Street Corp. stock underperforms Wednesday when compared to competitors
summary: State Street Corp. (STT) stock underperformed on Wednesday, July 20, 2022, falling 0.53% to $66.97, despite a generally positive trading session for the broader market. The stock closed significantly below its 52-week high and lagged behind some of its key competitors like JPMorgan Chase & Co., Bank of America Corp., and Citigroup Inc. Trading volume for State Street Corp. was also below its 50-day average.

title: JPMorgan adds former J&J chief Gorsky to board
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co has elected Alex Gorsky, the former chief executive officer of Johnson & Johnson, as a director of the bank. Gorsky, who is currently an executive chairman at J&J, previously led the development of J&J's COVID-19 vaccine and steered the company through significant crises. His appointment to JPMorgan's board is effective immediately.

title: Jefferies to spin off Vitesse Energy, merge companies and sell unit to focus on core banking business
summary: Jefferies Financial Group Inc. announced plans to spin off its Vitesse Energy LLC holdings to shareholders by the end of the year, aiming to list Vitesse Energy on the New York Stock Exchange. This move is part of an effort to reduce its merchant bank holdings and concentrate on its core investment banking and capital markets units. Additionally, Jefferies will book a $140 million gain from the sale of Idaho Timber, merge Jefferies Group LLC into Jefferies Financial Group Inc., and implement changes in its CFO leadership in 2023.

title: Why Invest in CLOs?
summary: The article highlights Collateralized Loan Obligations (CLOs) as a compelling investment due to their historical combination of above-average yield, strong risk profiles, and potential for appreciation. It details how CLOs have demonstrated strong risk-adjusted returns compared to other corporate debt categories, particularly through economic crises, and offer lower sensitivity to interest rate changes. The piece also introduces the VanEck CLO ETF (CLOI) as an efficient way for investors to access the largely institutional CLO market.

title: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon on potential recession, the business climate and more
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. CEO Jamie Dimon stated the company is not planning drastic pullbacks despite economic turbulence. He noted that customers are generally in a better financial position now compared to previous recessions.

title: Morgan Stanley fined $200 million for WhatsApp use
summary: Morgan Stanley has been fined $200 million for inadequately recording communications made on unapproved personal devices like WhatsApp, mirroring a similar fine against JPMorgan. This highlights the ongoing struggle for financial institutions and even governments to ensure compliance and proper record-keeping as employees use convenient messaging apps for work. The article also touches on a UK High Court ruling that found the use of WhatsApp by government ministers to be legal despite concerns over transparency and record-keeping.

title: Mortgages are in free fall at JPMorgan Chase
summary: JPMorgan Chase reported significant declines in mortgage originations, margins, and revenues for the second quarter of 2022, primarily due to higher mortgage rates stemming from the Federal Reserve's tightening monetary policy. The bank's origination volume fell to $21.9 billion, an 11% decline quarter-over-quarter and 45% year-over-year, with the retail channel experiencing the sharpest decrease. Despite a cautious outlook on a potential recession, CEO Jamie Dimon noted that consumers are in a relatively strong financial position compared to previous economic downturns.

title: Equities Ownership: Concentration on the Rise?
summary: The article analyzes the increasing concentration of equities ownership, showing that controlled companies constitute nearly 46% of MSCI ACWI Index constituents, a 44% rise since 2015. It highlights the growing influence of "universal managers" like BlackRock and Vanguard, which hold significant stakes in numerous companies, and discusses the implications for corporate governance and shareholder engagement. While seemingly indicating concentration, the article suggests this could also reflect a new way of managing widely dispersed ownership if these managers enable clients to exercise shareholder rights effectively.

title: FIRST HORIZON LAUNCHES SOUTH FLORIDA PRIVATE WEALTH GROUP WITH OFFICES IN CORAL GABLES AND DOWNTOWN MIAMI
summary: First Horizon Corporation announced the formation of the First Horizon Advisors South Florida Private Wealth Group, catering to high net worth clients. Headquartered in Coral Gables with satellite offices in South Miami and Downtown Miami, the group is led by Damian Pardo, Oui Coulson, and Siby Vizoso, focusing on comprehensive financial planning and community involvement.

title: EM Gutsy Policy Moves Keep Coming
summary: This article discusses the "gutsy" policy moves being made in Emerging Markets (EM), highlighting both positive and negative examples. It details significant interest rate hikes in Hungary and Mexico to combat inflation and currency weakness, contrasting them with Poland's more modest increase. The piece also touches on China's infrastructure-oriented bond sales, questioning its impact on balanced recovery and Europe's potential piggybacking.

title: UBS, Edward Jones And Others Keep Mum About Covering Abortion Travel Costs
summary: Following the Supreme Court's overturning of Roe v. Wade, many large banks announced they would cover employee travel costs for abortions. However, numerous brokerage firms, including Edward Jones, Ameriprise Financial, Raymond James Financial, Stifel, Nicolaus & Co., Charles Schwab, and UBS Wealth Management USA, have either remained silent or declined to comment on their policies. This silence is attributed to the conservative leanings of many brokers, the "lose-lose situation" of taking a public stance, and legal uncertainties surrounding such benefits in restrictive states.

title: Brookfield Lays Out Infra Secondaries Strategy
summary: Brookfield is launching a "sponsor solutions" secondaries strategy focused on GP-originated deals in the middle market, aiming to provide advisory services and capital deployment to smaller deal originators. This approach, which avoids the need to build a large internal mid-market team, allows Brookfield to invest alongside existing sponsors and leverage their access to deal flow and asset management capabilities. The strategy will target OECD member countries, particularly Europe and North America, with equity checks ranging from USD 100m to USD 500m, and has already executed two deals.

title: Investors hoard cash at the highest rate in almost a decade
summary: Investors are rapidly accumulating cash, exceeding pandemic-era levels, as they seek refuge from volatile market conditions and prepare for potential opportunities. This shift towards liquid capital, including cash and cash-like ETFs, indicates poor investor sentiment and a preference for cash preservation despite inflation. While some strategists advise against timing the market, the trend highlights deep-seated recession fears and a desire for lower-volatility exposures.

title: Podcast avec Caroline DELANGLE
summary: This article announces a podcast featuring Caroline DELANGLE, Head of Cross Asset Solutions at Federal Finance Gestion. The podcast will discuss Federal Indiciel US, a fund created in 2002 to track the performance of the S&P 500. The article also provides extensive financial data for numerous funds across various risk profiles.

title: Walker & Dunlop Adds Betsy Blau, Ryan Smith to Affordable Lending Team in Nashville
summary: Walker & Dunlop has expanded its Nashville affordable housing finance team by adding Ryan Smith as senior director and Betsy Blau as associate director. Smith and Blau bring nearly 30 years of combined experience from Colliers Mortgage, having financed over $2.5 billion in commercial real estate assets. Their addition is part of Walker & Dunlop's strategic expansion in affordable housing debt and equity offerings, following their acquisition of Alliant Capital in 2021.

title: PNC Financial Services Group closing branch at PNC Park in Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh Business Times
summary: PNC Financial Services Group is closing its branch located at PNC Park in Pittsburgh as of September 23, 2022. This closure is part of a larger plan by PNC to cut four branches, all of which will cease operations on the same date. The branch closing is notable given that PNC Park shares the bank's name.

title: BP, Shell to cover employee travel for treatment after Roe v. Wade
summary: BP PLC has joined Shell PLC in committing to cover employee travel expenses for healthcare treatment following the Supreme Court's overturning of Roe v. Wade. Both European oil producers updated their healthcare plans to extend benefits for women needing to travel for services, though neither explicitly named abortion. This move comes as other major companies like Amazon, JPMorgan Chase, Tesla, and Walt Disney also updated their policies to cover travel costs for out-of-state abortion services, while U.S. oil majors have largely remained silent.

title: JPMorgan Chase Dedicates Resources to Closing Equity Gaps
summary: JPMorgan Chase is dedicating resources to close racial wealth gaps in underserved communities, starting in Bridgeport, Connecticut. The company has hired Eduardo Cabrera as a local ambassador to engage with the community and offer financial literacy workshops as part of its $30 billion Racial Equity Commitment initiative. This effort includes previous investments in affordable housing.

title: Cleartrace Raises $20 Million Financing Led by ClearSky With Strategic Funding From Brookfield Renewable, EDF Energy North America, Tenaska, and Exelon to Help Companies Reach Decarbonization Goals
summary: Cleartrace, a carbon and energy management software company, has raised $20 million in a financing round led by ClearSky, with strategic investments from Brookfield Renewable, EDF Energy North America, Tenaska, and Exelon. This funding will accelerate the growth of Cleartrace’s advanced carbon and energy management platform, which provides auditable and assurance-ready proof of decarbonization for clients including real estate portfolios, financial institutions, and data centers. The platform offers 100% traceable and actionable hourly energy and carbon records, helping companies achieve and report on their decarbonization goals.

title: JPMorgan Chase Opens First Birmingham Branch, With Help of HBCU Grad
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. has opened its first full-service banking center in Birmingham, with Racquel Oden, Head of Consumer Bank Network Expansion, playing a key role. Oden, who received an MBA from Hampton University, emphasized the bank's commitment to community engagement and financial literacy, reflecting her personal passion and the success of Chase's community-style branches across the country. The new branch aims to be an integral part of the local community, offering banking services while supporting financial health and literacy initiatives.

title: Frosch is thrilled about JPMorgan Chase's acquisition of the agency
summary: Frosch executives express excitement and pride regarding JPMorgan Chase's acquisition of the travel agency, viewing it as a strong validation of the travel advisor industry. JPMorgan Chase stated the acquisition makes them a top-five U.S. consumer travel provider and highlights their strategy to own their travel destiny, especially concerning their card business and customer spending habits. The acquisition is expected to provide Frosch with enhanced resources, including cybersecurity, and open up new client opportunities, particularly in high-net-worth categories.

title: State Street, Wells Fargo to Cover Travel Costs for Employee Abortions
summary: State Street Corp. and Wells Fargo, along with other financial firms, are modifying their employee benefits to include coverage for travel costs associated with abortions. This decision comes in response to the U.S. Supreme Court's overturning of Roe v. Wade, following similar moves by other large corporations like Citigroup and JP Morgan Chase. Many major employers are rethinking benefit plans in states where abortion access is now restricted or unavailable.

title: Abortion assistance: Kroger to offer up to $4,000 of out-of-state travel costs for employees seeking abortion
summary: Kroger announced it will offer up to $4,000 to cover out-of-state travel costs for employees seeking abortion and fertility treatments, following the Supreme Court's decision to overturn Roe v. Wade. The company, headquartered in Cincinnati, operates stores in states like Ohio and Kentucky where abortion is now banned or mostly banned. This move aligns Kroger with nearly two dozen other major U.S. companies providing similar assistance.

title: JPMorgan Chase walks it like they talk it at the Wealth Summit in Dallas
summary: JPMorgan Chase hosted a Black & Hispanic Wealth Summit in Dallas, demonstrating its commitment to empowering these communities through financial literacy and access to capital. The event featured discussions with financial experts and celebrities on wealth building, entrepreneurship, and addressing systemic financial barriers. This summit is part of Chase's broader Advancing Black Pathways and Advancing Hispanics & Latinos initiatives, including a $30 billion commitment to advancing racial equity.

title: Building Wealth and Starting Legacies: Women of Color Shape Their Own Futures
summary: JPMorgan Chase is supporting Zora's House in Columbus, Ohio, a co-working space and leadership incubator for women of color, with two philanthropic investments. These investments launched a financial health program and a 24-month equitable design institute aimed at empowering women of color to build wealth, address systemic inequities, and create sustainable solutions for their communities. The initiative is part of JPMorgan Chase's $30 billion commitment to close the racial wealth gap and advance economic inclusion.

title: Are Bank Stocks Undervalued?
summary: Despite fears of a potential recession driving down bank stock prices, many high-quality banks appear undervalued, trading at a significant discount compared to historical recession lows. Rising net interest margins due to Federal Reserve rate hikes could provide a tailwind, which analysts believe is not being fully priced into current valuations. Long-term investors may find attractive opportunities in these undervalued bank stocks, particularly those with wide economic moats like Wells Fargo, JPMorgan Chase, U.S. Bancorp, and Bank of America.

title: BlackRock joins Wall Street firms in covering employees' abortion travel costs: Internal memo
summary: BlackRock (BLK) is expanding its health care plan to cover travel expenses for U.S. employees seeking abortion services, following an internal memo. This decision aligns BlackRock with other major Wall Street firms like Jefferies Financial Group, Wells Fargo, JPMorgan, Goldman Sachs, and Citigroup, which have made similar commitments in response to the overturning of Roe v. Wade. The firms are covering travel and lodging costs for reproductive services, treating them similarly to other specialized medical care.

title: Katrina Evans
summary: Katrina Evans, Executive Vice President at KeyCorp, is highlighted for her 30-plus years of adventurous leadership and significant contributions to the company. She has spearheaded growth in marketing, communications, and analytics, orchestrated expansion of a multibillion-dollar community benefits plan, and fostered diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives. Her leadership style emphasizes authenticity and empowering others.

title: JPMorgan, Citi, Goldman, Wells Fargo and Bank of America will cover out-of-state abortion costs for employees
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co., Bank of America Corp., Goldman Sachs Group Inc., Wells Fargo & Co. and Citigroup Inc. have all announced that they will cover out-of-state travel expenses for employees seeking abortions. This decision comes in the wake of the U.S. Supreme Court's ruling to overturn Roe v. Wade. These major banks join other large corporations in offering such benefits.

title: JP Morgan, Disney join wave of companies that'll cover employee abortion travel costs
summary: Following the Supreme Court's decision to overturn Roe v. Wade, numerous companies, including JPMorgan Chase and Disney, announced they would cover travel expenses for employees needing to go out-of-state for abortion services. This decision aligns with a prior trend seen among other corporations after a leaked opinion indicated the potential overturning of the federal protection. Companies like Dick's Sporting Goods and Condé Nast also detailed their plans to support employees' access to reproductive healthcare, with some even extending support to include bail for peaceful protestors.

title: JPMorgan Chase Joins Companies Paying Employees Who Travel for Abortions
summary: JPMorgan Chase announced it would cover travel expenses for employees needing to travel out of state for abortions, expanding a benefit that covers services unavailable near an employee's home. This decision follows the Supreme Court's overturning of Roe v. Wade and aligns JPMorgan with other companies like Citigroup, Starbucks, Amazon, Tesla, and Yelp making similar pledges. The move addresses the implications of state-level abortion bans, with many states poised to restrict or ban abortions following the ruling.

title: How JPMorgan Chase, Target, Citi, Bank of America, and PayPal are Reporting on Their Complex, Big-Dollar Racial Equity Commitments
summary: This article examines how major corporations like JPMorgan Chase, Target, Citi, Bank of America, and PayPal are reporting progress on their substantial racial equity commitments, ranging from $535 million to $30 billion. It details the specific actions and investments each company has made to advance racial equity, such as supporting Black-owned businesses, increasing affordable housing, and investing in diverse suppliers. The piece emphasizes the importance of transparent reporting on these complex, multi-year pledges.

title: JPMorgan Chase Reducing Its Mortgage Staff
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. announced layoffs and reassignments in its mortgage business due to slowing housing market conditions caused by inflation and rising mortgage rates. Over 1,000 employees are affected, with about half being moved to other internal divisions. This follows similar job cuts by other real estate companies and comes after the Federal Reserve's significant interest rate hike.

title: $1.5 Trillion Asset Manager Northern Trust Creates Digital Assets Group To Meet Growing Demand
summary: Northern Trust, a $1.5 trillion asset manager, has established a new Digital Assets and Financial Markets Group to help traditional investors gain exposure to digital assets. This move combines digital asset markets with traditional securities services, demonstrating continued institutional interest in the crypto space despite recent market downturns. The firm has a history of blockchain involvement, including supporting Bitcoin and Ethereum investors and co-launching a crypto administration firm.

title: Southern First rolls out new HQ to customers, community
summary: Southern First Bank has unveiled its new five-story, 107,000-square-foot headquarters in Greenville, designed to be warm, welcoming, and progressive, aiming to redefine traditional bank architecture. The new building provides ample space for employees, clients, and community events, reflecting the bank's commitment to its community and its future growth. CEO Art Seaver emphasizes the building as a statement of belief in the future and a tool for recruiting top talent, affirming the bank's long-term vision and client-first mentality.

title: Visa Inc. completes €3.0bn cross-border offering of senior notes | Vietnam | Global law firm
summary: Visa Inc. has completed a €3.0 billion cross-border offering of senior notes, facilitated by Norton Rose Fulbright's Toronto office. The offering included notes due in 2026, 2029, and 2034, with net proceeds intended for general corporate purposes. The issuance involved a syndicate of underwriters including major financial institutions.

title: Prologis to add 9.6 million square feet in New Jersey with Duke Realty acquisition
summary: Prologis Inc. will acquire Duke Realty Corp. in an all-stock, $26 billion transaction, significantly expanding its industrial footprint in New Jersey by 9.6 million square feet. The merger, unanimously approved by both boards, will add nearly 10 million square feet to Prologis's New Jersey portfolio and includes 150 million square feet of combined industrial space across 19 major U.S. markets. Duke Realty shareholders will receive 0.475 of a Prologis share for each share they own.

title: LATAM Airlines Seeks $2.75b Loan to Exit Chap.11 Bankruptcy Status
summary: LATAM Airlines Group SA is seeking approval for $2.75 billion in new loans to finance its exit from Chapter 11 bankruptcy. The airline has secured commitments from several major banks and an additional agreement to refinance existing loans. This financing is crucial for the company to complete its restructuring plan and proceed with a post-bankruptcy equity offering.

title: J.P. Morgan Asset Management Completes Conversion of Four Mutual Funds to ETFs
summary: J.P. Morgan Asset Management has successfully converted four mutual funds into ETFs, including the new JPMorgan International Research Enhanced Equity ETF (JIRE), expanding its active ETF lineup to 22 strategies. This move, which involved approximately $9 billion in combined assets, aims to provide investors with more active investment options offering increased flexibility, transparency, and potentially reduced fees. The firm now manages 44 U.S. ETFs with over $75 billion in assets under management.

title: Bank of New York Mellon Corp. stock outperforms market despite losses on the day
summary: Bank of New York Mellon Corp. (BK) stock experienced a 2.84% drop on Friday, June 10, 2022, closing at $42.79, amidst a general market downturn. Despite its losses and marking its third consecutive day of decline, the stock outperformed major competitors like JPMorgan Chase & Co., Citigroup Inc., and Wells Fargo & Co., which saw larger percentage drops. The company's stock is currently $21.84 short of its 52-week high of $64.63.

title: ¿Cuánto valen las oficinas del Santander en el centro de Santiago?: Banco pondrá a la venta su actual edificio corporativo
authors: Víctor Cofré y María José Tapia
summary: Banco Santander plans to sell its current corporate headquarters in downtown Santiago after deciding to relocate to a new building in Las Condes. The fiscal appraisal for the two addresses of the current building, Bandera 140 and Bandera 150, totals approximately $70 billion Chilean pesos. Real estate agents anticipate a challenging sale due to an oversupply of office space in the city center.

title: Accepting her inner truth and sparking joy, from iconic toy company co-founder Melissa Bernstein
summary: Melissa Bernstein, co-founder of Melissa and Doug Toys, discusses her journey of self-discovery, fueled by a diagnosis of existential angst. She explains how this led her to co-found LifeLines, a company focused on wellbeing and helping others find meaning through self-expression, stemming from her own experiences of channeling her struggles into creative endeavors.

title: Go Active as Investors Dive Back Into Corporate Bonds
summary: The bond market, particularly corporate bonds, is showing signs of recovery after a downturn, leading investors to cautiously re-enter the market for potential bargains. Active management, such as through the American Century Diversified Corporate Bond ETF (KORP), is suggested as a way for wary investors to navigate the changing corporate bond landscape and balance risk. This approach allows for dynamic adjustments to investment-grade and high-yield components, aiming for current income while managing interest rate and credit risk.

title: Talkspace CFO: Cerebral's Controlled Substances Pivot Could Create More Daylight in Virtual Mental Health Market
summary: Talkspace CFO Jennifer Fulk believes that Cerebral's pivot away from prescribing controlled substances could create new opportunities for Talkspace in the virtual mental health market. Talkspace has never prescribed controlled substances and sees Cerebral's recent issues as a potential advantage due to its focus on a full-stack behavioral health care platform. The article also touches on Talkspace's financial turnaround plan and analyst speculation about it being an acquisition target.

title: Will Corporate Credits Crack as Growth Slows?
summary: Despite concerns about slowing global growth and central bank rate hikes, the article argues against a wave of corporate downgrades and defaults. It suggests that corporate balance sheets are healthier, the default cycle has cleaned up weaker companies, M&A risk is muted, and maturity runways have been extended, making corporates resilient to a slowdown. The article concludes that strong fundamentals and attractive valuations present a good opportunity for investors in corporate credit.

title: The SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust Is Still Overvalued
summary: The author argues that the recent surge in the SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY) is premature because the S&P 500 remains overvalued. Utilizing the Fed Valuation Model and considering sector weightings, the article suggests that key metrics are not aligned for sustained index success in the near term, anticipating a plateau rather than a continued recovery. Divergent analyst opinions and a low VIX further support the uncertainty in the market.

title: Jonathan Baliff Named Redwire CFO
summary: Jonathan Baliff, formerly chairman of Redwire’s audit committee, has been appointed as the new Chief Financial Officer of the space infrastructure technology company, succeeding Bill Read. Baliff was previously president of Genesis Park Acquisition, which merged with Redwire in September 2021, and has a background that includes leadership roles at Bristow Group and executive positions at Texas Capital Bancshares and NRG Energy. David Kornblatt will replace Baliff as the head of the board’s audit committee.

title: AUD/USD Forex Technical Analysis – Sustained Move Under .7143 Puts .7029 on Radar
summary: The Australian Dollar is showing a bearish bias against the US Dollar due to inflation fears, slower economic growth, and warnings from JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon about an economic "hurricane." Technical analysis indicates that a sustained move below .7143 could lead the AUD/USD pair to .7029, while upcoming US economic data, particularly ADP Non-Farm Employment Change, will be crucial for market direction.

title: JPMorgan CEO Dimon calls for raising minimum wage, more education to address racial gaps
summary: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon advocates for raising the minimum wage, expanding education, and making mortgages more affordable to address racial gaps that cost the Columbus economy $10 billion annually. He also discusses the current economic outlook, noting a strong economy despite "storm clouds" like inflation, and emphasizes the importance of local initiatives and returning semiconductor production to the U.S.

title: Abdul Kahsai Joins Pinnacle's Growing Restaurant and Franchise Team
summary: Pinnacle Financial Partners has expanded its restaurant and franchise finance team by adding Abdul Kahsai as an experienced banker. Based in Phoenix, Arizona, Kahsai will cover the Western U.S., focusing on franchised restaurant and fitness operators. He brings 15 years of financial services experience, having previously worked at JPMorgan Chase and GE Capital.

title: Lights! Camera! Action! Pier 94 Could Make the Movies —If Developer Vornado Fulfills Promises
summary: Developer Vornado proposes a new 212,000-square-foot film and television studio at Pier 94 in Hell's Kitchen, complete with public amenities. However, Manhattan Community Board 4 is skeptical given Vornado's history of unfulfilled promises regarding the disrepair of adjacent Pier 92 and other community requests. The board insists Vornado address these structural issues and implement promised public amenities before approving the new project.

title: Retirement Industry People Moves
summary: This article details recent personnel changes and appointments within the retirement industry. Key moves include Eric Kristenson joining Cohen & Steers as a DCIO specialist, Eric Lareau expanding abrdn's institutional team, Aimee DeCamillo becoming Manulife Investment Management's new global head of retirement, Arezu Moghadam joining J.P. Morgan Asset Management as global head of data science, and Jessica Austin Barker being appointed TIAA's chief digital and client experience officer. Additionally, Securian Financial was selected as recordkeeper for the WELLthBUILDER Pooled Employer Plan by Strategic Retirement Partners.

title: Mining Billionaire Robert Friedland’s Ivanhoe Electric Seeks Dual Listing In New York, Toronto
summary: Billionaire Robert Friedland's Ivanhoe Electric is seeking a dual listing in New York and Toronto to finance the development of copper mines in the U.S. These mines are intended to supply raw materials for electric vehicle batteries and large-scale energy storage facilities. The company, led by Friedland as CEO, aims to raise $200 million through its initial public offering and emphasizes the strategic importance of developing a domestic U.S. supply of critical minerals for the clean energy transition.

title: How a search for Thai noodles led this Walmart veteran to become CFO of a unicorn
summary: Amanda Whalen, former EVP and CFO at Walmart International, became the new CFO of Klaviyo after a personal experience highlighted the marketing technology unicorn's effectiveness. She discovered Klaviyo through emails from a noodle company she used during the pandemic, which demonstrated how Klaviyo builds digital relationships with customers. Whalen, a veteran in finance, sees similarities between Walmart's customer-first ethos and Klaviyo's approach, and she plans to focus on strengthening the business for future growth, including a potential IPO when the time is right.

title: JPMorgan pledged $30 billion to racial equity. How much progress has it made?
summary: JPMorgan committed $30 billion over five years to racial equity after George Floyd's murder to address the wealth gap for communities of color. By the end of 2021, the bank had deployed or committed over $18 billion. While JPMorgan states substantial progress, some critics argue it hasn't gone far enough and are "baffled" by CEO Jamie Dimon's resistance to a full racial equity audit.

title: Innovator ETFs Filed for 2 Managed Floor ETFs
summary: Innovator ETFs has filed for two new actively managed equity ETFs, the Innovator Equity Managed Floor ETF and the Innovator Technology Managed Floor ETF, aiming to address tail risk in stocks. These ETFs will use a custom laddered options strategy designed by Morgan Stanley Investment Management and Parametric to maintain floors against a maximum loss of 10%. Unlike Innovator's existing Defined Outcome ETFs, these new products will be equity-based, comprised mainly of representative stocks from their target indices, and will pay out dividends.

title: JPMorgan Converts Realty Income Fund Into ETF
summary: JPMorgan Asset Management has converted its JPMorgan Realty Income Fund (JPRE) into an actively managed ETF. This conversion is part of a larger strategy by JPMAM to switch four of its mutual funds into ETFs this year, aiming to broaden the availability of its investment capabilities. The JPMorgan Realty Income ETF (JPRE) invests primarily in real estate investment trusts (REITs), selecting companies based on financial strength, operating revenues, and growth potential.

title: Capital One sets date for hybrid return to office
summary: Capital One announced it will reopen its U.S. offices for all employees on Sept. 6, implementing a hybrid work model. The company encourages employees to work in-office Tuesday through Thursday, though attendance is not mandatory. Capital One has also revised its vaccine policy, permitting unvaccinated staff to return to the office if they comply with regular COVID-19 testing.

title: ETF Leaders Powered by the NYSE: Darek Wojnar
summary: Darek Wojnar of FlexShares, a division of Northern Trust Asset Management, discussed how inflation and ESG are influencing investor allocations. He highlighted FlexShares' diverse ETF lineup, including inflation hedges like the FlexShares Morningstar Global Upstream Natural Resources Index Fund (GUNR A+), and their commitment to ESG investing, leveraging a proprietary scoring mechanism for sustainable portfolio construction.

title: JPMorgan Analysts Behind ‘Uninvestable’ Call Upgrade China Tech
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. analysts have upgraded at least 15 Chinese Internet stocks, including Tencent Holdings Ltd. and Alibaba Group Holding Ltd., just two months after their bearish report labeled the sector "uninvestable." This reversal comes after the previous report triggered a market selloff and internal discussions at the US bank.

title: Transcript: Boaz Weinstein
summary: This transcript features an in-depth conversation between Barry Ritholtz and Boaz Weinstein, founder of Saba Capital. Weinstein discusses his background, including his chess and card-counting days, and how he transitioned into finance. The interview covers Saba Capital's investment strategies, such as closed-end fund arbitrage, SPACs, and tail protection, as well as specific trades like the London Whale and Evergrande.

title: Star Alliance Plans Credit Card For Redeeming Points Across 26 Airlines
summary: Star Alliance, the largest global airline group comprising 26 member airlines, is set to launch a co-branded credit card this year. This new credit card will enable users to earn points through spending and then redeem those points across the frequent-flyer programs of any of its member airlines, including Singapore Airlines, Lufthansa, and United Airlines.

title: Global 2000: Berkshire Hathaway Takes Down JPMorgan As America’s Largest Company
summary: Berkshire Hathaway has surpassed JPMorgan Chase to become America's largest public company in the Forbes Global 2000 list, driven by nearly $90 billion in profits. Despite global volatility, U.S. companies like Amazon and ExxonMobil showed significant growth, with Amazon rising to third in the U.S. and ExxonMobil rebounding strongly due to surging energy prices. The article highlights the resilience of top U.S. companies amid inflation and geopolitical challenges.

title: nCino announces new partnership with Capitec Bank in South Africa
summary: nCino, a provider of cloud banking and digital transformation solutions, has partnered with Capitec Bank, South Africa's largest digital bank. This collaboration aims to build and optimize Capitec Bank's Business Banking loan management system, enhancing efficiency and simplicity for its rapidly growing client base. The partnership will leverage nCino's technology to streamline processes and improve client and employee experiences in business banking operations.

title: Taking Footsteps Toward a Sustainable Future
summary: The article highlights Allbirds as a successful footwear company built on sustainable practices, using natural, renewable resources and openly sharing its carbon calculation methods. It discusses how Allbirds' financial success, including its IPO led by J.P. Morgan, demonstrates investor confidence in sustainability-driven businesses. The piece emphasizes the growing consumer demand for sustainable products and the fashion industry's need for transformative practices to reduce its environmental footprint.

title: Dimensional, JPMorgan Flip Billions From Mutual Funds Into ETFs
summary: Dimensional Fund Advisors and JPMorgan Asset Management are converting billions of dollars from mutual funds into ETFs, with a total of about $55 billion in switched assets expected. This move is part of a broader industry trend towards lower-cost, more tax-efficient ETFs, with over $240 billion exiting mutual funds in 2022 so far. Dimensional's ETF assets are set to exceed $54 billion, making it one of the largest issuers.

title: Exclusive: Carlyle to acquire NSM Insurance from White Mountains in $1.78 billion deal
summary: Private equity firm Carlyle Group Inc. has agreed to acquire U.S. specialty insurance provider NSM Insurance Group from White Mountains Insurance Group Ltd. for $1.78 billion in cash. This deal is expected to close in the second half of the year and will add $280 per share to White Mountains' adjusted book value. Carlyle plans to invest further in the platform and ramp up mergers and acquisitions activity within NSM Insurance.

title: PE giant Brookfield buys Watermark REIT for $3.8B
summary: Brookfield Real Estate Funds has acquired non-traded REIT Watermark Lodging Trust for $3.8 billion in an all-cash transaction. Watermark's portfolio comprises 25 luxury and upper upscale hotels, including Ritz-Carlton properties, located in U.S. drive-to leisure destinations and gateway urban cities. The acquisition reflects confidence in large-scale hotel deals despite recent interest rate increases and debt capital market volatility.

title: These Bond ETFs Are Floating Through Rate Hike Risks
summary: As the Federal Reserve began raising interest rates, investors have shifted towards less rate-sensitive bond ETFs, particularly those focused on floating-rate bonds. Funds like USFR, FLOT, and FLRN have seen significant inflows due to their low duration and ability to adjust coupon rates with rising market rates. These ETFs offer an attractive option for investors looking to trim duration and put cash to work in a rising rate environment, providing downside protection compared to traditional fixed-rate bonds.

title: Dimensional Completing Largest Mutual Fund To ETF Conversion
summary: Dimensional Fund Advisors is completing its largest mutual fund to ETF conversion, bringing $7.8 billion worth of assets into the ETF wrapper, specifically with the Tax-Managed US Marketwide Value Portfolio II becoming the Dimensional US Marketwide Value ETF (DFUV). This conversion contributes to nearly $10 billion in converted assets in 2022, with more expected from JPMorgan Asset Management. The new ETF retains its 0.23% expense ratio and continues to target U.S.-listed value stocks with a focus on tax efficiency.

title: Scoping Out Scope 3 Emissions
summary: A report by Citi Research's Anita McBain highlights the growing importance of Scope 3 emissions as new reporting requirements aim to improve transparency in emission reporting across global value chains. The article discusses the complexities of disclosing Scope 3 emissions compared to Scope 1 and 2, and the significant business benefits companies can achieve by addressing them. It also examines current Scope 3 disclosure trends by country, noting that while the U.S. has the largest volume of disclosed emissions, a smaller proportion of its companies consider Scope 3 relevant compared to Japan.

title: Klarna borrowing to go on credit reports from June: what it means for you
summary: Klarna will begin reporting the use of its 'Pay in 30' and 'Pay in 3' products to major UK credit reference agencies, Experian and TransUnion, starting June 2022. This means on-time, late, and outstanding payments will appear on credit reports, making it crucial for users to meet repayment obligations. While repayment plans will be marked on credit files, Klarna states that credit scores won't be immediately impacted, awaiting updates to credit scoring mechanisms.

title: Cboe Global Markets Completes Acquisition of ErisX, Entering Digital Asset Market
summary: Cboe Global Markets announced it has completed the acquisition of ErisX, a U.S. based digital asset spot market and regulated derivatives exchange and clearinghouse. This acquisition provides Cboe with an entry into the digital asset market, aiming to build a comprehensive digital asset market data offering and develop further derivative products. Cboe plans to operate ErisX as a subsidiary, with Thomas Chippas remaining as head of the digital asset business, focusing on regulatory compliance and transparency to mature the digital asset market globally.

title: Frank Sorrentino III Of ConnectOne Bank On The Future Of Money and Banking
summary: Frank Sorrentino III, Chairman, CEO, and Founder of ConnectOne Bank, discusses the evolving landscape of banking and money, emphasizing the role of digitalization and technology in serving small to mid-market clients. He shares insights on ConnectOne Bank's journey, including its IPO and recent Fintech acquisitions, and offers advice for a successful career in the modern finance industry. Sorrentino highlights the importance of innovation balanced with regulation and envisions significant growth in payments and digital asset custody.

title: FAT Brands Adds Nine Restaurant Chains in $1B Buying Spree
summary: FAT Brands acquired nine restaurant chains over 18 months for $917.5 million, reaching $2.2 billion in system sales from 2,300 restaurants across 17 chains. CEO Andy Wiederhorn plans to "digest" these acquisitions, increase production at their manufacturing business, and refinance debt to lower capital costs, despite concerns raised by a Seeking Alpha analyst about the company's high leverage and ongoing SEC and U.S. Attorney's Office investigations related to Wiederhorn.

title: Petrucci, PGIM sell 511,000 sq. ft. Phillipsburg warehouse for $110 million
summary: A joint venture between J.G. Petrucci Inc. and PGIM Real Estate has sold a newly constructed 511,200-square-foot industrial building in Phillipsburg for $110 million to Cabot Properties. The transaction, which involved brokers from JLL, marked the largest investment sale in New Jersey’s industrial market during the first quarter. The property at 39 Strykers Road was recently leased to national logistics firm Alan Ritchey.

title: First Internet Bank Appoints Genevieve Lua As VP
summary: First Internet Bank announced the appointment of Genevieve Lua as Vice President, Business Development Officer, to its Small Business Administration Lending team. Lua brings extensive lending experience from Bank of America and JPMorgan Chase, and will help entrepreneurs navigate the SBA loan process. First Internet Bank emphasizes providing flexible financial solutions for small businesses.

title: JPMorgan Chase, Microsoft among growing number of companies turning to neurodiverse workers to help meet need for talent
summary: A growing number of companies, including JPMorgan Chase and Microsoft, are actively recruiting neurodiverse individuals to fill talent needs and leverage their unique skills. This trend is driven by an increasing recognition of the neurodiverse population, their problem-solving abilities, and the ongoing demand for talent, with companies implementing structured programs for interviewing, hiring, and onboarding. These initiatives not only provide career opportunities for neurodiverse workers but also positively impact company culture and team dynamics.

title: Teucrium Bitcoin Futures ETF Now Carries Hashdex Brand
summary: The Teucrium Bitcoin Futures Fund, the first bitcoin futures ETF approved under the Securities Act of 1933, is changing its name to include the Hashdex brand. This move, potentially a result of a new partnership, could help Teucrium differentiate its product and allow Hashdex, a Brazil-based asset manager, to enter the US ETF market. The SEC's approval of this ETF was seen by some as a step towards greenlighting a spot bitcoin ETF, despite other bitcoin futures ETFs being filed under a different act with more investor protections.

title: Government contracting trends: Surviving economic challenges
summary: Government contractors are currently grappling with significant economic challenges including inflation, supply chain disruptions, and a tight labor market. These issues are particularly problematic for contractors whose existing agreements may prevent them from passing on increased costs to the government. To mitigate these pressures, the article suggests strategies such as employee incentives and a reevaluation of contract types.

title: Charles Schwab (SCHW) Q1 revenue down 1%; earnings miss estimates
summary: The Charles Schwab Corporation reported lower earnings and revenues for the first quarter of 2022, missing Wall Street's forecasts. Total revenues decreased 1% to $4.67 billion, and adjusted net profit dropped to $0.77 per share. The company's stock experienced a decline following the earnings release.

title: “Whatever It Takes” – Whatever That Means
summary: This article discusses the divergent monetary policy approaches of major economies, particularly China's easing against a global tightening trend. It highlights continued hawkish stances in other emerging markets like Korea and Argentina due to high inflation, while noting Turkey's policy limbo despite soaring inflation. The piece underscores the varying interpretations and applications of the "whatever it takes" philosophy in current global economic conditions.

title: Fidelity Investments Launches Crypto, Metaverse ETFs — Says 'We Continue to See Demand'
summary: Fidelity Investments has launched two new exchange-traded funds (ETFs) focused on the crypto and metaverse sectors. The company stated that it continues to observe strong demand for digital asset exposure and innovative technologies like the metaverse. This move by Fidelity allows investors to gain exposure to these emerging markets through traditional investment vehicles.

title: JPMorgan’s New Manhattan Headquarters to Be All Electric Powered - WSJ
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co.'s new 1,388-foot Manhattan headquarters will be an all-electric skyscraper powered by a hydroelectric source, making it New York's tallest and largest all-electric building. The office tower will operate with net-zero emissions. JPMorgan plans to consolidate its New York offices in this Norman Foster-designed building after its completion around 2025.

title: Thoma Bravo to acquire SailPoint for overall $6.9 Billion
summary: Thoma Bravo has entered into a definitive agreement to acquire SailPoint Technologies Holdings, Inc. in an all-cash transaction valued at approximately $6.9 billion. SailPoint stockholders will receive $65.25 per share, representing a 48% premium to its 90-day volume-weighted average price. The acquisition will take SailPoint private, allowing it to leverage Thoma Bravo's resources and expertise to accelerate growth and innovation in the identity security market.

title: JPMorgan Chase backs $100M Tech Equity Miami initiative
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. has announced its support for the $100 million Tech Equity Miami initiative, aimed at fostering technological equity opportunities in Miami. This move by the financial services giant highlights a significant investment in the city's tech scene.

title: Dave & Buster’s Announces Acquisition of Main Event for $835 Million; Chris Morris to become CEO of Combined Entity Upon Closing
summary: Dave & Buster's Entertainment, Inc. announced its acquisition of Main Event from Ardent Leisure Group Limited and RedBird Capital Partners for $835 million. Chris Morris, the current CEO of Main Event, will become CEO of the combined entity upon closing. This acquisition aims to expand Dave & Buster's demographic reach by targeting families with younger children while also creating significant growth opportunities for both brands.

title: These income strategies can help protect your stock investments from inflation and a recession
summary: This article discusses two income strategies for protecting stock investments from inflation and recession. These strategies include selecting stocks of companies with rapidly increasing dividend payouts and augmenting dividend income with covered call options. The author suggests these methods offer downside protection while retaining upside potential in a changing economic environment.

title: Banking & Finance Roundup: Seacoast to acquire Miami’s Apollo Bank
summary: This article covers the banking and finance news roundup for the week, highlighting Seacoast's acquisition of Apollo Bank in Miami. It also lists other related articles about regional banking news, including Pitcairn hiring a local executive and Amerant Bank joining a blockchain network.

title: HDFC Bank creates Indian lending behemoth in $40 billion deal
summary: HDFC Bank is acquiring its largest shareholder, HDFC Ltd, in a $40 billion deal to create India's biggest financial services entity. This merger will expand HDFC Bank's customer base and home loan portfolio, aiming to better compete with rivals and tap into rising credit demand. The combined company will boast a balance sheet of $237 billion and a market value of approximately $160 billion.

title: Arkansas Eyes Upon Texas Lending
summary: Arkansas banks are increasingly expanding their operations into Texas, drawn by its larger banking market and growth opportunities. Major players like Home BancShares (Centennial Bank), Simmons First National Corp., and Bank OZK have made significant acquisitions and branch expansions. Other banks like Farmers Bank & Trust, Encore Bank, Bodcaw Bank, and Diamond Bank are also establishing a presence, utilizing both acquisitions and new branch development.

title: China Growth – Withering Greenshoots?
summary: The article discusses the weakening economic activity gauges in China, primarily due to the Omicron outbreak and mobility restrictions, leading to calls for more proactive policy support. It questions the downside risks to China's 2022 growth outlook, the global impact of China's lockdowns on supply chains and inflation, and the extent of additional policy support expected from the central bank. The author suggests that "blanket" measures, like cuts in reserve requirements and policy rates, remain a possibility if growth forecasts drop below 5%.

title: Growth Headwinds - List Gets Longer
summary: This article discusses the growing list of growth headwinds facing emerging markets, including the resurgence of COVID-19 in China, the Russia/Ukraine war's impact on commodity prices and supply chains, and aggressive policy tightening leading to interest rate hikes. It highlights how these factors are leading to growth downgrades in various regions, and how some commodity exporters might benefit from the current market disruptions.

title: The Fed Is on the March. Can Your Bond Fund Keep Up?
summary: This article discusses the impact of the Federal Reserve's aggressive interest rate hikes on bond investors and how they can protect their portfolios. It highlights that while rising rates can lead to bond price declines, they also result in significantly higher future yields for investors. The piece notes the bond market's recent poor performance and the shift in investor flows from bond funds as yields become more attractive.

title: Dakota Gold Corp. Announces Merger Closing as Part of a Specific Focus on Revitalizing the Homestake District in Lead, South Dakota
summary: Dakota Gold Corp. announced the completion of its merger between Dakota Territory Resource Corp. and JR Resources Corp., focusing on revitalizing the Homestake District in Lead, South Dakota. The company's common stock is expected to begin trading on the NYSE American under the symbol "DC" on or about April 5, 2022, following a significant expansion of its land package and establishment of an ESG fund. This strategic move aims to leverage the Homestake District's 145-year gold mining legacy for new discoveries and opportunities.

title: Barclays ETN snafu could cost it £450 million
summary: Barclays is facing a £450 million after-tax loss due to a blunder in its exchange-traded notes (ETN) business, where it exceeded its US shelf registration for securities issuance. This error has led to the temporary suspension of new ETN issuances, causing significant market disruption and a potential reputational hit for the bank and its CEO, CS "Venkat" Venkatakrishnan. Regulators are now investigating the incident.

title: Techstars and J.P. Morgan Partner to Invest in Diverse Entrepreneurs
summary: Techstars and J.P. Morgan have partnered to invest over $80 million in diverse entrepreneurs through a new accelerator program, aiming to address disparities in venture capital funding. This multi-year initiative will support more than 400 companies through 37 programs in 9 U.S. cities, focusing on Black, Hispanic and Latino, Indigenous American, and Pacific Islander founders. The program seeks to provide equitable access to capital, mentorship, and customized programming to foster wealth creation and economic opportunity in underserved communities.

title: 2022 Best & Brightest Business Major: Jack Budde, Michigan State (Broad)
summary: This article features Jack Budde, a Finance major from Michigan State University (Broad), as one of the 2022 Best & Brightest Business Majors. It details his academic achievements, extracurricular involvement, internships, and future career plans at Barclays Investment Banking. The piece also includes his reflections on business education, advice for students, and acknowledgements of mentors.

title: SoftBank preps Arm IPO, seeking a $60B valuation
summary: SoftBank is preparing for an Initial Public Offering (IPO) of Arm Ltd., aiming for a $60 billion valuation, following the collapse of its proposed sale to Nvidia Corp. The valuation is considered ambitious but potentially realistic due to Nvidia's appreciating stock price since the original acquisition agreement. Analysts suggest the success of the IPO at this valuation could indicate investor confidence in Arm's own growth potential beyond a merger.

title: Deal Diary: Wachtell Takes Tegna From Spin to Sale
summary: Tegna Inc.'s $8.6 billion sale to Standard General LP and Apollo Global Management Inc. marks another deal where Wachtell, Lipton, Rosen & Katz served as regular counsel to the former Gannett Co. unit. Wachtell Lipton, along with JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Greenhill & Co., advised Tegna on the recent sale, building on their prior work with Tegna, including its 2015 spin-off from Gannett. Standard General was advised by Fried Frank Harris Shriver & Jacobson LLP, Moelis & Co. LLC, and RBC Capital Markets.

title: Book Qatar Airways with Avios: Why Its Great
summary: Qatar Airways' adoption of Avios as its mileage currency significantly enhances redemption options for travelers. This change allows greater flexibility in earning and transferring Avios between multiple airlines, including British Airways, Iberia, and Aer Lingus, and opens up more transfer point options from major transferable points programs like American Express and Chase. Travelers can now optimize redemptions between different Avios programs, potentially securing better rates for flights.

title: Lanvin Group, a Global Luxury Fashion Group, to Become Publicly Traded on the NYSE via Business Combination with Primavera Capital Acquisition Corporation
summary: Lanvin Group, a global luxury fashion group, announced its plan to become publicly traded on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) through a business combination with Primavera Capital Acquisition Corporation (PCAC). The transaction values Lanvin Group at a pro forma enterprise value of US$1.5 billion, with up to US$544 million in proceeds expected to accelerate organic growth and fund future acquisitions. This move aims to leverage Primavera's networks and financial strength to expand Lanvin Group's brand portfolio across Europe, North America, and Asia, focusing on key luxury markets.

title: Does Your Portfolio Need Private Equity?
summary: This article explores whether private equity is a suitable investment for individual investors, highlighting its potential for higher returns but also its complexities and high barriers to entry. It discusses various aspects of private equity, including how its returns are measured, the wide dispersion of returns, and alternative options for gaining exposure to this asset class for different investor profiles. Ultimately, it concludes that while private equity offers potential benefits, its risks and high costs make it generally unsuitable for most individual investors.

title: Metals Acquisition clinches $1.1 bln deal for Glencore's CSA copper mine
summary: Metals Acquisition Corp has acquired Glencore's CSA copper mine in Australia for $1.1 billion, winning a years-long race for the asset. The deal allows Glencore to continue streamlining its portfolio and provides Metals Acquisition access to a high-grade copper mine, a critical commodity for electric vehicle production and the global energy transition. Metals Acquisition will fund the deal through IPO proceeds and debt, with Glencore receiving both cash and shares.

title: BNY Mellon expects $100-mln revenue hit in first quarter from Russia pullback
summary: BNY Mellon anticipates a $100 million revenue impact in the first quarter and an annual reduction of $80 million to $100 million due to pausing new banking business in Russia. This move follows Russia's invasion of Ukraine and aligns with other companies pulling out of the country. The bank has also halted buying Russian securities under its investment management business.

title: Metals Acquisition clinches $1.1 billion deal for Glencore’s CSA copper mine
summary: Metals Acquisition Corp has secured a $1.1 billion deal to acquire Glencore's CSA copper mine in Australia, outbidding competitors like IGO Ltd. The acquisition provides access to a high-grade copper mine expected to produce 41,000 to 49,000 tonnes of copper annually, capitalizing on strong demand fueled by electric vehicle production. For Glencore, this sale contributes to its business streamlining efforts, with analysts noting the attractive price received for the asset.

title: Webroot sues CrowdStrike, Sophos, others over alleged patent infringement
summary: Webroot and its parent company OpenText are suing Trend Micro, Sophos, Kaspersky, and CrowdStrike for alleged infringement of several malware detection patents, some dating back to 2005. The lawsuits, filed in the Western District of Texas, claim these defendants infringe upon Webroot's intellectual property related to endpoint security products and platforms. Competitors and observers criticized the move, with CrowdStrike calling it typical of a "patent troll" and others viewing it as "patent bullying."

title: J.P. Morgan agrees to acquire Global Shares, a leading provider of share plan management software
summary: J.P. Morgan announced an agreement to acquire Global Shares, a cloud-based provider of share plan management software, to bolster its services for corporate clients and expand wealth management client acquisition. The acquisition, which is subject to regulatory approvals and expected to close in the second half of 2022, will integrate Global Shares into J.P. Morgan's Asset & Wealth Management business. Global Shares will retain its headquarters in Cork, Ireland, and continue its growth trajectory with J.P. Morgan's support.

title: Inside Volatility Trading: Sometimes, Smaller is Better
summary: This article discusses the Cboe's introduction of "Nanos," a smaller, more affordable index option product designed to make options trading more accessible to a wider range of investors. It highlights the historical trend towards shorter-dated maturities and smaller contract sizes in options trading, emphasizing how Nanos can cater to individual traders with smaller portfolios and lower risk tolerances. The author also touches on the concept of "VIX Backwardation" and how starting small is beneficial for learning and adapting in volatile markets.

title: Wells Fargo CEO Scharf's 2021 compensation up by 20% at $24.5 mln
summary: Wells Fargo & Co CEO Charles Scharf's total compensation for 2021 increased by nearly 20% to $24.5 million, as disclosed in a regulatory filing. This rise follows a recovery year for the bank, with its shares jumping almost 59% in 2021, and compares to compensation packages of other major Wall Street bank CEOs like JPMorgan Chase & Co's Jamie Dimon and Citigroup Inc's Jane Fraser.

title: KWEB Aims to Fully Transition to Hong Kong Shares In Coming Months
summary: The KraneShares CSI China Internet ETF (KWEB) is transitioning its holdings to Hong Kong-listed counterparts to address delisting risks for Chinese American Depository Receipts (ADRs) under the Holding Foreign Companies Accountable Act (HFCAA). KraneShares expects KWEB's portfolio to be solely comprised of Hong Kong listings by the end of the year, providing daily updates on its conversion progress. This strategy aims to protect client interests amidst unresolved regulatory issues between US and Chinese authorities regarding audit paper access.

title: Stanley Black & Decker shutting down Russian business
summary: Stanley Black & Decker announced it is shutting down its business operations in Russia. The toolmaker, with a significant presence in Greater Baltimore, stated it stands in solidarity with the people of Ukraine. This decision follows similar actions by other major companies in response to the conflict.

title: Commodity ETFs Could Be Overbought After 'Extreme Herding'
summary: Retail investors "herding" into commodity ETFs, as seen by significant inflows, could indicate an overbought market and potential short-term underperformance, according to JPMorgan strategists. This behavior aligns with historical academic data suggesting heightened volatility and subsequent reversals after extreme investor rushes. An ETF analyst also notes that retail investors often enter these markets after much of the performance has already occurred.

title: JPMorgan joins Goldman Sachs in pulling back from Russia
authors: Hannah Levitt and Sridhar Natarajan and Bloomberg
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Goldman Sachs Group Inc. are pulling back from Russia in response to the country’s invasion of Ukraine, joining other major companies in halting business operations. JPMorgan specifies its activities are limited to helping clients and managing risk, while Goldman Sachs plans to close operations and has minimal exposure to Russia. This move further isolates Russia economically as other financial and consumer companies also restrict their presence.

title: JP Morgan AM to merge global emerging market index fund with ESG ETF
summary: JP Morgan Asset Management (JPMAM) is merging its $47m Global Emerging Markets Research Enhanced Index Equity fund with the $686m JP Morgan Global Emerging Markets Research Enhanced Index Equity ESG UCITS ETF (JREM), effective May 20. This merger aims to benefit shareholders by combining into a larger ETF with lower total expenses, reducing ongoing charges from 0.40% to 0.30% for investors. JREM is an actively managed ESG ETF that seeks to outperform the MSCI Emerging Market index and is classified as Article 8 under SFDR.

title: JPMorgan is winding down its Russia operations amid widening business exodus over Ukraine war
summary: JPMorgan Chase is winding down its operations in Russia, following directives from governments globally and amid a broader business exodus due to the Ukraine war. The bank's remaining dealings in Russia are limited to helping global clients manage existing obligations, risks, and taking care of employees, with fewer than 200 staff primarily in the corporate and investment bank. This move by JPMorgan comes shortly after Goldman Sachs also announced its exit from the country.

title: Goldman Sachs becomes first Wall St. firm to exit Russia
summary: Goldman Sachs has become the first Wall Street firm to suspend its operations in Russia following the country's invasion of Ukraine, winding down its business in compliance with regulatory requirements. JPMorgan Chase is also actively unwinding its Russian business, while other financial giants like Citigroup, Credit Suisse, and BlackRock have disclosed their exposure and are taking steps to limit their involvement. Several financial service companies, including Visa, Mastercard, American Express, and PayPal, have also suspended operations in Russia.

title: Tetra Tech Appoints Prashant Gandhi as New Board Member
summary: Tetra Tech Inc., a Pasadena-based consulting and engineering company, has appointed Prashant Gandhi to its Board of Directors, effective May 1. Mr. Gandhi brings over 20 years of experience in digital systems, data analytics, and digital transformation from his roles at McKinsey and Co., JP Morgan Chase, and Melio Payments. He will serve on the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee and the Compensation Committee, contributing his expertise to Tetra Tech's strategic focus on expanding its Delta technologies.

title: Russia risks "imminent" default on its debt, Wall Street analysts say
summary: Russia is facing an "imminent" default on its debt due to groaning under Western sanctions, according to credit ratings agencies and Wall Street firms. Fitch downgraded Russia's debt for the second time in a week, citing the high likelihood of default and the impact of sanctions on its ability and willingness to repay. With $700 million in payments due in March and a 30-day grace period, a default could occur as early as mid-April, further isolating Russia from international financial flows.

title: JPMorgan Chase Appoints Michael Woodfield as Market Executive for Middle Market Banking in Southern Nevada
summary: JPMorgan Chase Commercial Banking announced the appointment of Michael Woodfield as Market Executive of Middle Market Banking & Specialized Industries in southern Nevada. With 17 years of experience, Woodfield will focus on serving the financial needs of middle market companies in the region, leveraging JPMorgan Chase's global capabilities. This appointment aims to strengthen the bank's commitment to businesses in southern Nevada.

title: Rivian is sued for allegedly misleading investors about electric vehicle prices
summary: Rivian Automotive Inc is facing a class-action lawsuit from a shareholder who claims the company misled investors by initially underpricing its electric vehicles, leading to unpopular price hikes that were later rolled back. The lawsuit alleges Rivian concealed that its R1S SUV and R1T pickup trucks were so underpriced they would require rapid price increases after its November IPO, damaging the company's reputation and risking pre-order cancellations. The plaintiff, Charles Larry Crews, cites the swift rollback of price increases and an apology from CEO R.J. Scaringe as "futile attempts at damage control."

title: News | Blackstone Is Still Driving Hotel Portfolio Deals as Investors Mull Inflation, War
summary: Blackstone recently completed $3 billion in hotel portfolio transactions, selling its stake in CorePoint Lodging for $1.5 billion and buying an extended-stay hotel portfolio for $1.5 billion with Starwood Capital. These deals highlight a swift recovery in the hotel sector, driven by abundant capital and the inflation-hedging nature of hotel assets. Investors are closely monitoring inflation and geopolitical events, but the market shows signs of continued robust activity.

title: McEwen Mining closes flow-through financing
summary: McEwen Mining Inc. successfully closed a marketed brokered private placement offering on March 2, 2022, raising C$19,212,500 through the sale of 14,500,000 flow-through common shares. Cantor Fitzgerald Canada Corporation acted as the sole bookrunner and agent for the offering. The proceeds are designated for Canadian Exploration Expenditures on McEwen's properties in the Timmins region.

title: Who Owns Progressive Insurance, the Third-Largest Insurance Carrier in the U.S.?
summary: This article details the ownership of Progressive Insurance, identifying its largest shareholders as The Vanguard Group and BlackRock Inc. It also covers the company's history, starting with its founding in 1937, and highlights the career and compensation of current CEO Tricia Griffith.
