title: Healthcare Realty Trust, Healthcare Trust of America Agree to Merge, Forming $11.6B Medical Office Building REIT
summary: Healthcare Realty Trust and Healthcare Trust of America have agreed to merge, creating an $11.6 billion medical office building REIT. The combined company will operate under the Healthcare Realty name and will be the largest "pure-play" MOB REIT in the country, with 727 properties totaling 44 million square feet. The deal, valued at $7.75 billion for HTA, is expected to close in the third quarter of 2022 and aims to generate significant synergies and strengthen the combined entity's market position.

title: Wide Moat Stocks Can Get Their Grooves Back
summary: The VanEck Vectors Morningstar Wide Moat ETF (MOAT) has shown durability amid market turbulence in early 2022 and is outperforming the S&P 500. Analysts believe wide moat equities have the ingredients for continued success, with the ETF's valuation methodology identifying stocks trading at attractive multiples despite their inherent quality. MOAT's sector-agnostic approach and diversified holdings, including non-tech stocks, are helping to buffer against current tech sector weaknesses.

title: Kennedy Wilson Gets $300M in Preferred Equity
summary: Toronto-based Fairfax Financial Holdings Ltd. has made a $300 million preferred equity investment in Beverly Hills-based Kennedy-Wilson Holdings Inc. This new investment will be used by Kennedy Wilson for its development pipeline, real estate investments, and to pay off unsecured bank borrowings, further expanding their existing partnership which dates back to 2010. Fairfax has also increased its first mortgage target within Kennedy Wilson’s debt investment platform from $2 billion to $5 billion.

title: SunTrust Bank Permanently Closed
summary: The SunTrust bank branch at 8700 Georgia Ave. in downtown Silver Spring has permanently closed following the consolidation of operations into Truist after BB&T Bank acquired SunTrust in 2019. This closure is part of Truist's "core conversion" process, which has led to some customer issues, including temporary loss of access to debit cards and bank accounts. These conversions are affecting all former BB&T and SunTrust customers as they transition to Truist products and digital platforms.

title: Healthcare Realty and Healthcare Trust of America Enter Into $18 Billion Strategic Combination
summary: Healthcare Realty and Healthcare Trust of America announced an $18 billion strategic business combination, creating a preeminent pure-play medical office building REIT. The merger will result in a company with an $11.6 billion equity market capitalization and $17.6 billion total enterprise value, led by Healthcare Realty's management team. HTA shareholders will receive an implied value of $35.08 per share, including a $4.82 special cash dividend, and the combined entity expects significant cost synergies and operational upside.

title: Announcing JPMorgan Chase & Co.'s Strategic Investment in TRM Labs | TRM Blog
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. has announced a strategic investment in TRM Labs, a company specializing in crypto compliance and risk management technology. This investment highlights the growing significance of the crypto economy and the importance of trust and safety within this ecosystem. TRM Labs provides solutions for financial institutions, cryptocurrency businesses, regulators, and law enforcement agencies to monitor suspicious cryptocurrency transactions and trace illicit funds.

title: How DBMS is Used by Hulu, JPMorgan Chase, and The Weather Company
summary: This article examines how Database Management Systems (DBMS) are crucial for organizations to efficiently store, retrieve, and manage data. It provides case studies of how major companies like Hulu, JPMorgan Chase, and The Weather Company leverage DBMS to address challenges, optimize operations, and maintain data integrity and security, highlighting the benefits over traditional file systems. The article demonstrates the real-world applications and positive outcomes of integrating DBMS in various industries.

title: List of Banks and Lenders with SBA Loan Guarantee Agreements
summary: This article provides a comprehensive list of banks and lenders in New Hampshire that offer small business loans under SBA loan guarantee agreements. It details contact information including addresses, phone numbers, and websites for each institution. The list serves as a valuable resource for small businesses seeking financing options in the region.

title: Blackstone Launches April Housing
summary: Blackstone Real Estate Income Trust (BREIT) has formed April Housing, a new portfolio company dedicated to acquiring and preserving affordable housing across the U.S. The new entity will oversee more than 90,000 units and plans to invest over $500 million in property improvements. Alice Carr, formerly of JPMorgan Chase, will lead April Housing as CEO, overseeing Blackstone's commitment to expanding affordable housing solutions.

title: Blackstone Real Estate Launches Affordable Housing Company
summary: Blackstone Real Estate has launched April Housing, a new portfolio company aimed at being a solutions and capital provider for the creation and preservation of high-quality affordable housing across the U.S. This initiative follows Blackstone Real Estate Income Trust's acquisition of a portfolio of over 90,000 affordable housing units. Industry veteran Alice Carr has been appointed CEO of April Housing, and the company plans to invest over $500 million in community improvements while maintaining affordability.

title: Waterstone Mortgage Review: Home Purchase Loan Experts Who Strive to Close On Time
summary: This article reviews Waterstone Mortgage, highlighting its unique position as a subsidiary of a large bank with a local feel, offering an expansive range of loan products. It emphasizes their expertise in home purchase loans, especially in competitive markets, and their commitment to timely closings while noting the absence of online rate disclosures as a potential drawback.

title: Pakistani-American woman appointed CIO of top US firm
summary: Saira Malik, a Pakistani-American, has been appointed as Chief Investment Officer (CIO) of Nuveen, a global asset management firm with $1.2 trillion under management. In her new role, she will lead weekly market and investment insights, client asset allocation views, and chair the Global Investment Committee. Malik has a distinguished career in finance, previously holding senior positions at Nuveen and JP Morgan Asset Management, and is recognized as a top influential woman in US finance.

title: Morningstar: Active ETFs See Surge in Flows, AUM
summary: Active ETFs experienced a significant surge in investor interest and inflows in 2021, reversing previous trends of outflows for active funds. A Morningstar report highlighted that active ETFs attracted $87 billion in inflows, growing their total assets under management by 44% to $295 billion, despite representing only a small fraction of all active funds and ETFs. Key factors driving this growth included inflation concerns, anticipated Federal Reserve rate hikes, and successful new product launches, with Grayscale Bitcoin Trust (GBTC), JPMorgan Ultra-Short Income ETF (JPST), and ARK Innovation ETF (ARKK) being among the largest active ETFs.

title: JPMorgan, Toshiba, Ciena find new way to protect blockchain with quantum network
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co, Toshiba Corp, and Ciena Corp have successfully demonstrated a new encryption network using quantum key distribution (QKD) to protect blockchain communications from potential quantum computing attacks. This marks the first time that such a super-secure, quantum physics-powered network has been tested for safeguarding blockchain technology, addressing future threats posed by advanced quantum computers. JPMorgan views this as a critical step in preparing banking systems for changes to the security landscape that production-quality quantum computers will bring.

title: Carver Federal Savings, unique in New York, survives by investing in underserved communities
summary: Carver Federal Savings, the last Black-operated bank in New York City, is thriving by focusing on underserved communities and small businesses often overlooked by larger banks. Despite facing financial precarity in the past, Carver has seen significant asset growth and capital increases, especially during the pandemic, by prioritizing relationship banking and community reinvestment. The bank's commitment to hyper-local lending and partnerships has helped small businesses flourish in neighborhoods like Harlem.

title: JPMorgan Chase, Toshiba and Ciena Build the First Quantum Key Distribution Network Used to Secure Mission-Critical Blockchain Application
summary: JPMorgan Chase, Toshiba, and Ciena have successfully built and demonstrated the first quantum key distribution (QKD) network for metropolitan areas, securing a mission-critical blockchain application. This groundbreaking research proves the viability of QKD to detect and defend against potential quantum computing attacks, supporting 800 Gbps data rates under real-world conditions. The network secured Liink by J.P. Morgan, the world's first bank-led, production-grade, peer-to-peer blockchain network, showcasing the technology's effectiveness against future quantum threats.

title: How to restart your career after taking time off
summary: Keita Young, who restarted her career at JPMorgan Chase after an 11-year break to raise her children, shares six tips for others looking to re-enter the workforce. Her advice includes getting involved in outside activities, having a compelling career story, directing one's own path, leveraging a support system, finding a mentor, and not stressing over minor issues.

title: Buyout firm Madison Dearborn to take MoneyGram private in $1.8 billion deal
summary: Private equity firm Madison Dearborn Partners announced it would acquire MoneyGram International Inc for $1.8 billion, taking the debt-laden money transfer platform private. The deal, valued at $11 per share, represents a significant premium to MoneyGram's recent stock prices and aims to revitalize the company amidst stiff competition. Madison Dearborn will also refinance MoneyGram's outstanding debt, with the acquisition expected to close in the fourth quarter of this year.

title: MoneyGram Enters into Agreement to be Acquired by Madison Dearborn Partners
summary: MoneyGram International, Inc. announced a definitive agreement to be acquired by funds affiliated with Madison Dearborn Partners, LLC for $11.00 per share in an all-cash transaction valued at approximately $1.8 billion. This acquisition aims to accelerate MoneyGram's digital growth strategy and strengthen its market-leading cross-border capabilities. The transaction is expected to close in the fourth quarter of 2022, after which MoneyGram will become a private company.

title: Black Knight Acquires Remaining Interest in Optimal Blue from Thomas H. Lee Partners, L.P. and Cannae Holdings, Inc.
summary: Black Knight, Inc. announced the acquisition of the remaining interests in Optimal Blue Holdco, LLC from co-investors Cannae Holdings, Inc. and Thomas H. Lee Partners, L.P. for a total of $1.156 billion, paid in a combination of Dun & Bradstreet stock and cash. This transaction simplifies Black Knight's organizational structure by making Optimal Blue a wholly-owned subsidiary and is expected to increase 2022 Adjusted EPS by $0.11. Black Knight Chairman and CEO Anthony Jabbour highlighted the strong performance of Optimal Blue and the outstanding returns generated from their initial investment in Dun & Bradstreet.

title: WSJ News Exclusive | Regulators Probe Block Trading at Morgan Stanley, Goldman, Other Wall Street Firms
summary: Federal investigators, including the SEC and Justice Department, are probing block trading practices at Wall Street firms like Morgan Stanley and Goldman Sachs. The investigation focuses on whether bankers improperly tipped off hedge-fund clients about large share sales before public disclosure. Regulators are examining communication records and trading activities to determine if funds benefited from such insider information.

title: Axis Bank set to buy Citigroup’s India retail unit
summary: Axis Bank is nearing a deal to acquire Citigroup’s India retail banking business for an estimated $2.5 billion. The agreement, expected to be announced in the coming weeks, is contingent on approval from the Reserve Bank of India and would include a cash component of less than $2 billion after accounting for liabilities. This move is part of Citigroup CEO Jane Fraser's restructuring efforts to exit retail banking in 13 countries and focus on high-growth businesses.

title: Axis Bank set to buy Citigroup’s $2.5 billion India retail unit
summary: Axis Bank is close to acquiring Citigroup's India retail banking business for approximately $2.5 billion, a deal expected to be announced within weeks, pending Reserve Bank of India approval. The transaction includes a cash component of less than $2 billion, accounting for liabilities, and Axis Bank anticipates a six-month integration period. This acquisition aligns with Citigroup CEO Jane Fraser's strategy to divest retail banking operations in 13 countries and focus on high-growth areas like wealth management, while Axis Bank aims to boost retail loans in India.

title: Australia drops landmark cartel case against Citi, Deutsche Bank
summary: Australian prosecutors have dropped a landmark cartel case against Citigroup and Deutsche Bank, along with several former executives, concluding there were no longer reasonable prospects of conviction. The case, which centered on a 2015 share issue worth $1.8bn, would have been the country's biggest white-collar criminal trial and challenged the practices of investment banks in capital raisings. The banks and individuals involved maintained their innocence, stating they acted responsibly and in the interest of clients.

title: Korean bank profits at record-high as borrowers struggle under debt
summary: South Korea's major banks reported record earnings in 2021 due to higher interest income, even as borrowers face increasing debt burdens. Analysts warn that this strong performance could deteriorate if rising interest rates lead to a surge in bad debt from financially vulnerable households and smaller companies. The central bank's interest rate hikes, aimed at taming inflation and soaring household debt, are making debt repayment harder for retail borrowers.

title: Your Daily Asia Gaming eBrief: Macau CNY visitation registers first growth since pandemic
summary: Macau's Lunar New Year visitation registered its first year-on-year growth since the pandemic, with over 113,000 visitors. While these numbers are below pre-pandemic levels and government forecasts, they represent an improvement compared to 2021 in terms of visitation, hotel occupancy, and spending. The article also provides updates on various gaming companies including Studio City, Nagacorp, Star Entertainment, and GGR forecasts for Macau.

title: JPMorgan Chase: The Gold Standard in Diverse Spend
summary: This article highlights JPMorgan Chase as a leader in diverse spend practices within the sustainability sector. It mentions key executives involved in their supplier assurance services, indicating the company's commitment to diverse and sustainable supply chains. The article positions JPMorgan Chase as a benchmark for other organizations in this domain.

title: Pinnacle Expands to North Fulton County in Atlanta
summary: Pinnacle Financial Partners is expanding its operations to North Fulton County in Atlanta, establishing a temporary presence and planning a full-service location for summer. The firm has hired a team of banking veterans, led by Scott Jordan as area manager, to serve clients in North Fulton, Gwinnett, and Forsyth Counties. This expansion is part of Pinnacle's broader growth strategy in Atlanta, building on its entry into the market two years prior.

title: Building a New Sustainability Model for the Food Industry
summary: Maple Leaf Foods, a major protein company, is striving to become the most sustainable in the world by setting science-based targets like reducing greenhouse gas emissions by 30% by 2030 and achieving carbon neutrality. The company is investing in environmentally conscious production facilities, sustainable meat practices, and plant-based proteins, including using an ESG-linked credit facility from J.P. Morgan to support its growth initiatives. Maple Leaf Foods emphasizes a "shared value" framework where business and social decisions are intertwined, aiming to prove that carbon neutrality can be both possible and profitable in the food industry.

title: Income Is The Outcome
summary: The article discusses the JPMorgan Equity Premium Income Fund, an income-oriented fund that uses equity-linked notes (ELNs) and options premiums to generate substantial income for investors. Despite underperforming market benchmarks in total return, its strategy prioritizes income generation and aims to reduce volatility, allowing investors to stay invested in equities in a more defensive manner. The fund's co-portfolio manager, Hamilton Reiner, explains how the use of ELNs converts options premiums into bona fide income and how market volatility influences the income generated.

title: Crypto Lending and the Search for Yield
summary: This article explores the landscape of crypto lending, detailing how investors can earn yield by lending digital assets like Bitcoin and stablecoins to various entities. It discusses the primary sources of this yield, including futures-based "cash and carry" trades and arbitrage opportunities, while also analyzing the macro and micro risks involved, such as market volatility and counterparty risk. The author emphasizes the importance of traditional credit analysis in navigating this evolving financial market.

title: Future Returns: How Goldman Sachs Approaches Direct Indexing
summary: The article discusses the growing trend of direct indexing in asset management, highlighted by Fidelity's new low-minimum product and previous acquisitions by major firms. It explains how Goldman Sachs, a long-time provider of direct indexing, personalizes portfolios for tax efficiency and individual values, managing $118 billion in this strategy. The piece also delves into the differences between direct indexing and traditional active management, emphasizing its tailored approach to client goals rather than purely seeking market outperformance.

title: Digital Wallets and Financial Services Disruption
summary: Digital wallets are significantly disrupting traditional financial services, including banking, brokerage, and lending, due to superior user experiences and lower customer acquisition costs. ARK Investment Management predicts substantial growth for digital wallets, projecting their market capitalization to reach $5.7 trillion in the U.S. and $20 trillion globally within five years. Companies like Block (Square) and PayPal, which are major holdings in the ARK Fintech Innovation ETF (ARKF), are leading this disruption by acquiring customers at a fraction of the cost of traditional banks.

title: Citigroup is hiring across Gulf, awaits another record IPO year
summary: Citigroup is expanding its presence in the Gulf region, anticipating that 2022 will surpass 2021 as a record year for activity, including initial public offerings. The bank is adding resources in Saudi Arabia and Dubai to capitalize on the region's booming IPO market and diversifying economies. Amid a wider war for talent in the banking industry, Citigroup believes it can continue to attract skilled professionals due to its strong institution and management.

title: loanDepot Announces Closing Of $597M Securitization
summary: loanDepot announced the closing of Mello Mortgage Capital Acceptance 2022-INV1, a $597 million securitization of agency-eligible mortgages originated through its retail and partner channels. This transaction marks over $3 billion in private label residential mortgage-backed securities sponsored by loanDepot entities over the past twelve months. The securitization consists of 1,442 prime mortgage loans made to borrowers with strong credit profiles, demonstrating the company's resilient business model and capital-raising strategy.

title: CAF grants A/B loan for USD 300 million to YPF S.A. to support its climate change adaptation and mitigation strategy
summary: CAF has granted an A/B loan of USD 300 million to YPF S.A. to support its climate change adaptation and mitigation strategy. This financing marks YPF's return to the international financial market and aligns with its emissions reduction goals. The loan structure mobilized private capital from Santander, Itau Unibanco, Industrial and Commercial Bank of China Limited, and Cargill Financial Services International.

title: Fidelity Plots Crypto Industry, Metaverse ETFs
summary: Fidelity Investments has filed proposals with the SEC for two new ETFs: the Fidelity Crypto Industry and Digital Payments ETF, and the Fidelity Metaverse ETF. These filings come shortly after the SEC denied Fidelity's application for a spot bitcoin trust, highlighting the company's continued efforts to expand its offerings in the digital asset space without directly investing in cryptocurrencies for these new ETFs. The proposed ETFs will track indices of companies involved in the crypto industry and those developing metaverse-related products or services.

title: WOTM :sam-sapertein
summary: Sam Saperstein, Head of Women on the Move at JPMorgan Chase, discusses the theme of resilience at the 2021 Women on the Move Leadership Day. She highlights inspiring stories of women who have reinvented themselves in the face of adversity, including a Paralympian and a small business owner who pivoted during the pandemic. The article also showcases JPMorgan Chase's achievements in supporting women, such as exceeding its $10 billion lending goal to women-owned small businesses and implementing programs to support female employees and underserved segments.

title: JPMorgan Chase: Driving Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
summary: JPMorgan Chase is leveraging its supply chain to drive diversity, equity, and inclusion, particularly focusing on supporting Black, Hispanic, and Latino suppliers through a US$30bn commitment to close the racial wealth gap. The firm aims to increase diverse supplier spend by US$6bn, with US$1.2bn dedicated to Black, Hispanic, and Latino-owned businesses, and is developing initiatives like a cyber-readiness program with TruSight and a grant program to help diverse businesses meet industry requirements. These efforts demonstrate JPMorgan Chase's commitment to making diversity an integral part of its procurement strategy and fostering inclusive growth within the business community.

title: Inviu, la fintech de inversiones del Galicia, nombró nuevo CFO y ya piensa en regionalizarse
summary: Inviu, the investment fintech of Grupo Financiero Galicia, has appointed Ignacio Clancy as its new CFO. Clancy, with a strong background in financial services and capital markets, will be responsible for regionalizing the company and mitigating project risks. Inviu aims to expand its operations beyond Argentina, building on Clancy's extensive experience, including his tenure at JP Morgan.

title: JPMorgan Chase: Driving Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
summary: JPMorgan Chase is leveraging its supply chain and a US$30 billion commitment to enhance diversity, equity, and inclusion, particularly for Black, Hispanic, and Latino suppliers. The firm aims to increase spending with diverse businesses, requiring its top suppliers to do the same, and is addressing barriers such as cyber-readiness and access to capital through new programs and partnerships. These initiatives are designed to foster economic inclusion and drive cultural shifts across the business community.

title: Nuveen Names Saira Malik As Chief Investment Officer
summary: Nuveen has promoted Saira Malik to Chief Investment Officer, a newly created role, where she will drive strategic market and investment insights for the firm's $1.2 trillion assets. Malik will also lead the global investment committee and maintain leadership for Nuveen’s $450 billion global equity business. With 26 years of experience, she will continue as lead portfolio manager for the CREF Stock strategy and a listed portfolio manager for CREF Growth and CREF Global Equities strategies.

title: JPMorgan buys 49% stake in Greek fintech Viva Wallet
summary: JPMorgan Chase has acquired a 49% stake in the Greek fintech Viva Wallet, continuing its strategy of investing in banking-adjacent businesses, especially internationally. This investment is part of JPMorgan's aggressive acquisition strategy, particularly as regulations limit its ability to acquire more U.S.-based deposit-taking institutions. Viva Wallet, valued at over $2 billion, provides services to small and medium-sized businesses across 23 European countries.

title: JPMorgan buys 49% stake in Greek payments company
summary: JPMorgan Chase has acquired a 49% stake in the Greek fintech Viva Wallets as part of its ongoing acquisition strategy. The Athens-based company provides payment solutions to small and medium-sized businesses across 23 European countries. This investment, valued over $1.15 billion, will help Viva Wallets expand its localized payment services throughout Europe.

title: Throwing up the white flag? Retail investors dumped stocks at Monday's open, JPMorgan analysis finds
summary: A JPMorgan analysis found that retail investors aggressively dumped stocks at Monday's open, leading to a retail order imbalance of $1.36 billion by noon. This suggests a potential surrender by retail investors in the current market. The analysis was conducted by markets strategist Peng Cheng.

title: OCC approves national bank charter applications of fintech company
summary: The Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC) has conditionally approved applications from Social Finance Inc. (SoFi) to establish SoFi Bank, National Association. This move brings SoFi under federal bank regulatory supervision, subjecting it to comprehensive regulations including the Community Reinvestment Act. The approval requires the new bank not to engage in crypto-asset activities, and SoFi Technologies is seeking to become a bank holding company.

title: Silknet Will Issue $300 Million Worth of Eurobonds by the End of January
summary: Silknet, a major Georgian communications company, plans to issue $300 million worth of 5-year eurobonds with an 8.375% interest rate by January 31, 2022. The proceeds will be used to repay existing bonds and fund corporate goals. This issuance is considered competitive regionally, with Moody's upgrading Silknet's rating outlook to stable and Fitch likely assigning a "B" credit rating to the new bonds.

title: Why JPMorgan is spending $12 billion on tech
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. announced a 26% increase in its annual tech budget, pushing technology investments to $12 billion for 2021, up from $9.5 billion in 2020. This spending covers software development, data and analytics, artificial intelligence, and physical infrastructure like data centers, with the goal of securing future growth against competition. CEO Jamie Dimon and CFO Jeremy Barnum emphasized the importance of these investments for maintaining market leadership and delivering strong returns, despite potential impacts on short-term profit expectations.

title: JPMorgan Latest Lender to Call Staff Back to London Offices
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. has joined other major banks like HSBC and Lloyds in calling staff back to their London offices following the U.K. government's decision to drop work-from-home guidance. This move signals a significant return to in-person work for the City of London's financial sector.

title: News | Marriott Resort Owner in Palm Desert, California, Gets $128 Million Loan
summary: Kam Sang Co. secured a $128 million, five-year, interest-only loan from Goldman Sachs Bank USA for its JW Marriott Desert Springs Resort & Spa in Palm Desert, California. This financing, arranged by JLL’s Hotels & Hospitality Group, was used to repay the debt from the 2017 acquisition of the 286-acre property. The resort recently underwent a $40 million renovation and conditions in the Coachella Valley hotel market are improving after pandemic-related declines.

title: Brazil-based Hashdex Expects to Launch First DeFi ETF Next Month
summary: Brazil-based Hashdex has received approval to launch the world's first decentralized finance (DeFi) ETF, which is expected to be listed on the Brazilian stock exchange, B3, on February 17. The ETF will track the CF Benchmarks' DeFi Composite Index, comprising 12 assets including decentralized applications, service protocols, and the Ethereum network. Hashdex aims to provide global investors with a new way to access the growing crypto ecosystem through this innovative product.

title: Pay on Wall Street will surge after a bumper year. (Published 2022)
summary: JPMorgan Chase and Citigroup reported strong annual profits for 2021, leading to increased compensation on Wall Street despite rising costs and a slight dip in quarterly earnings for JPMorgan. The banks are focused on competitive pay to attract and retain talent in a tight labor market. JPMorgan Chase posted a record $48.3 billion in profit for the year, even as its fourth-quarter profit declined due to higher employee compensation and technology investments.

title: Stock Market News For Today, January 14th, 2022
summary: This article provides a stock market update for January 14th, 2022, highlighting that penny stocks and blue chips were expected to start lower. It discusses key economic factors like falling retail sales and upcoming political nominations, and features five trending penny stocks to watch: Guardforce AI (GFAI), Nextplay Technologies (NXTP), China SXT Pharmaceuticals (SXTC), Kaival Brands Innovations Group (KAVL), and Vinco Ventures (BBIG), detailing their recent performance and news.

title: DI People: JCPenney, 7-Eleven, Recode Therapeutics, Hawkeye, PCCI, and Others Make Moves
summary: This article details numerous executive appointments and promotions across various companies in North Texas, including JCPenney, 7-Eleven, Recode Therapeutics, Hawkeye, and PwC. Key moves include new CEOs for Hawkeye, Harver, and Recode Therapeutics, and significant leadership changes in e-commerce, technology, and operations at other notable firms, reflecting a dynamic period of innovation and growth in the region.

title: StubHub Explores Going Public, Valued at $13B
summary: StubHub Holdings is considering a direct listing that could value the company at over $13 billion, following other ticket platforms going public. The parent company of StubHub and Viagogo has filed paperwork with the SEC and is working with Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase. Despite facing scrutiny over its merger and carrying significant debt, StubHub expects to rebound to pre-pandemic revenue levels in 2022, though the Omicron variant poses a potential challenge.

title: The Student Has Become The Master
summary: Wells Fargo, under CEO Charlie Scharf, significantly improved its fourth-quarter profit, suggesting a turnaround for the bank previously mired in scandal. This performance contrasts with dips in fourth-quarter profits reported by JPMorgan Chase and Citigroup, the latter continuing to divest its Asian consumer banking operations. The article highlights Wells Fargo's resurgence and the varying fortunes of major U.S. banks.

title: Lifestance CEO Doesn’t See Digital Mental Health Providers as Competitors
summary: LifeStance Health CEO Michael Lester states that digital mental health providers are not significant competitors, as LifeStance focuses on higher-acuity patients with diagnoses and bills third-party payers. The company differentiates itself by largely providing in-network care through its extensive network of 4,400 clinicians and also sees its staffing model as appealing to a different, larger subset of clinicians. LifeStance also reported that while it saw an uptick in cancellations due to the omicron variant, its hybrid model helped it navigate COVID-related challenges.

title: JANELLE CURTIS NAMED CHIEF ENTERPRISE TRANSFORMATION OFFICER FOR WARNER MUSIC GROUP
summary: Janelle Curtis has been appointed as Chief Enterprise Transformation Officer for Warner Music Group. Her role will focus on driving tech-enabled evolution across the company's global corporate operations, business structures, processes, and digital solutions. Curtis brings extensive experience from Bank of America and Goldman Sachs to her new position.

title: JPM 2022: Morgan Health, Kaiser Permanente partner on health equity
summary: Morgan Health and Kaiser Permanente are partnering to focus on health equity for JPMorgan Chase's California employees, beginning this month. They plan to jointly collect and report health equity metrics and introduce performance guarantees tied to health equity for JPMorgan employees starting in 2023. Morgan Health also aims to expand into new markets and integrate digital capabilities through its investment in Vera Whole Health, which is merging with Castlight Health.

title: These 14 bank stocks are in the best position to benefit from rising interest rates
summary: This article identifies 14 bank stocks poised to benefit from rising interest rates, based on a screen of various banks. It highlights Huntington Bancshares Inc. (HBAN) as a top performer expected to significantly increase its earnings per share through 2023, outpacing the S&P 500 Index. The piece delves into why these select few banks are projected to achieve double-digit earnings growth.

title: AI Startup Speeds Up Derivative Models for Bank of Montreal
summary: Riskfuel, a Toronto-based AI startup, has partnered with Bank of Montreal (BMO) to accelerate its derivative models using NVIDIA DGX systems. This technology significantly improves the performance of complex financial calculations, enabling BMO to make faster and more accurate investment decisions and expand its client base. Riskfuel's solution allows banks to run derivative portfolio models in seconds, offering both speed and accuracy.

title: Owens & Minor to buy home healthcare provider Apria for $1.45 bln
summary: Owens & Minor Inc. announced its acquisition of home healthcare provider Apria Inc. for approximately $1.45 billion in cash. This strategic move aims to strengthen Owens & Minor's position in the growing home healthcare services market, reflecting increased demand due to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. The deal, valued at $37.50 per share for Apria, is expected to close in the first half of 2022.

title: JPM 2022: New Johnson & Johnson CEO Duato points out 5 pipeline meds that can generate $5B-plus
summary: Johnson & Johnson's new CEO, Joaquin Duato, outlined the company's pharmaceutical strategy for the coming decade at the J.P. Morgan Healthcare Conference, aiming for $60 billion in pharma sales by 2025. He highlighted five pipeline drugs—Carvykti, nipocalimab, Rybrevant, milvexian, and the Taris bladder cancer platform—each with the potential to generate $5 billion or more in peak sales. These new therapies, alongside expanded indications for existing blockbusters, are crucial for future growth, especially as the company prepares for a consumer health spinoff and faces patent expiration for Stelara.

title: Rocket Grew Into America’s Biggest Mortgage Lender, but Now Comes the Hard Part - WSJ
summary: Rocket Companies became the largest mortgage lender in the U.S. during the pandemic, significantly increasing its mortgage originations. However, the company now faces the challenge of convincing investors that it can sustain growth even if mortgage refinancings decline. Rocket's past success relied heavily on a favorable interest rate environment, and it needs to adapt to a potentially sleepier mortgage market.

title: WSFS nets $15M in lawsuit settlement tied to acquisition 12 years ago
summary: WSFS Financial Corp. announced it will receive $15 million from a settlement resolving a long-standing legal dispute. This dispute originated from the bank's 2010 acquisition of Christiana Bank & Trust. The settlement covers all legal costs associated with the case.

title: Citigroup prepares to fire unvaccinated employees at the end of January. (Published 2022)
summary: Citigroup announced it will dismiss unvaccinated employees by the end of January, requiring all U.S. staff to submit proof of vaccination by January 14 or face unpaid leave and termination by January 31. This mandate is among the strictest on Wall Street, with over 90% of Citi's U.S. employees already complying, while other major banks have varying policies. The decision comes amidst broader discussions about vaccine mandates for large employers, with some employees resisting the policy.

title: Subsidiarias de peruana Urbanova reciben préstamo de 190 millones de dólares
summary: Subsidiaries of the Peruvian real estate company Urbanova secured a $190 million secured loan from a syndicate of banks to refinance a previous credit. The beneficiaries, Inmuebles Limatambo, Inversiones San Borja, and Urbanizadora Jardín, used the funds to repay an earlier loan and backed the new credit with a mortgage on their properties. Legal counsel for the transaction included Simpson Thacher & Bartlett and Rodrigo, Elías & Medrano Abogados for Urbanova, and Clifford Chance and Garrigues for the syndicate of banks led by Banco Santander.

title: Analyst Coverage | Investor Relations | Workday
summary: This Workday Investor Relations page lists the research analysts who cover the company. It explicitly states that analyst opinions, estimates, and forecasts are their own and do not represent Workday's views or endorsement. The page provides a comprehensive list of firms and their respective analysts covering Workday.

title: Pinnacle Financial Partners Opens Full-Service Office in Huntersville
summary: Pinnacle Financial Partners has opened a new full-service office in Huntersville, NC, expanding its presence in Mecklenburg County with a team of veteran financial services professionals. The new office at 16633 Birkdale Commons offers a full range of banking and financial services, building on Pinnacle's significant growth in the greater Charlotte MSA. The team includes new additions and experienced advisors, solidifying Pinnacle's commitment to community-focused service with comprehensive financial solutions.

title: Jim Connell
summary: Jim Connell, CPO and Head of Global Supplier Services at JPMorgan Chase, discusses the importance of diverse spend and maximizing its impact throughout the supply chain. JPMorgan Chase is committed to supporting diverse suppliers, dedicating approximately US$2bn annually, and made a further commitment in October 2020 to increase spend with Black, Hispanic, and Latino businesses by $750 million. Through their Gold Supplier program, they encourage strategic suppliers to develop growth plans to improve supplier diversity, aiming for a significant increase in diverse spend over the next three years.

title: JPMorgan Chase: The Gold Standard in Diverse Spend
summary: JPMorgan Chase is promoting diverse spend throughout its supply chain by dedicating approximately $2bn annually to diverse-owned and managed companies and committed to increasing spend with Black, Hispanic, and Latino businesses by an additional $750 million. The company's strategy involves mobilizing key suppliers, mentoring those with emerging diversity programs, and enhancing the discoverability of diverse suppliers, aiming for a significant increase in diverse spend over the next three years. This initiative is a core part of its ESG agenda, viewing supplier diversity as both a moral imperative and smart business practice to foster economic growth and strengthen communities.

title: Private equity firm TPG seeks $9.5 bln valuation in U.S. IPO
summary: Private equity firm TPG is targeting a $9.5 billion valuation in its upcoming U.S. initial public offering this month. The firm plans to sell about 28.3 million shares between $28 and $31 apiece, aiming to raise approximately $877.6 million, with 40% going to existing shareholders. TPG, an investor in companies like Airbnb and Uber, has recovered from past poor investments and seen a significant jump in net income and revenue in the nine months leading up to September 2021.

title: 2021's top local financial stock may surprise you
summary: Byline Bancorp significantly outperformed other Chicago financial firms in 2021, with a 77% return for investors, far exceeding larger banks like Wintrust Financial and Northern Trust. Despite its smaller size and the ongoing consolidation in the banking market, Byline's CEO maintains the company is focused on organic growth rather than seeking a sale, challenging investor speculation about a takeover premium. The success is attributed to strong loan growth, avoidance of pricey acquisitions, and a robust SBA lending business.

title: Leveraged Muni Funds Face Losses as Bond Rout Drags On
summary: Leveraged municipal bond funds are experiencing double-digit losses due to the worst bond rout in decades. Rising interest rates are impacting fund-share prices and reducing income payouts to investors. High net worth households had previously invested in these closed-end muni mutual funds, which hold approximately $60 billion, seeking tax-free income.

title: 36% of Americans Took On Holiday Debt, Averaging $1,249
summary: A LendingTree survey found that 36% of Americans accumulated holiday debt in 2021, averaging $1,249, a 10% decrease from the previous year, despite a higher percentage of borrowers. Parents with young children and millennials were the most likely to incur debt, and credit cards remained the most popular method for borrowing, though buy now, pay later options also saw significant use. The article also provides advice on how to pay off holiday debt, suggesting budgeting, balance transfer credit cards, and personal loans.

title: Shed Concentration Risk With Equal-Weight ETFs
summary: This article discusses the increasing concentration risk in cap-weighted indexes like the S&P 500, primarily due to the large market capitalization of a few tech giants like Apple and Microsoft. It advocates for equal-weight exchange-traded funds (ETFs), such as the Invesco S&P 500 Equal Weight ETF (RSP), as a solution to provide comparable returns with superior diversification. The article highlights how equal-weight ETFs mitigate the risks associated with an over-reliance on a few mega-cap stocks.

title: Capital One Is Nation’s No. 1 Bank in Customer Satisfaction, Says JD Power
summary: Capital One has been named the top retail bank in the US for overall customer satisfaction for the second consecutive year by J.D. Power, outscoring eight other national banks. The study highlights convenience, tailored account offerings, and helping customers save time or money as core drivers of satisfaction, with Capital One's elimination of overdraft fees cited as a key personalizing move. The bank achieved a score of 692 out of 1,000, performing highest in digital channels, helping customers save money, and flexible banking options.

title: Bank of America says New York employees may work from home over holidays
summary: Bank of America announced that its New York-based employees can work from home during the holidays due to the spreading Omicron variant. The bank will also provide free COVID-19 test kits and offer booster shots, following similar measures by other financial firms like Citigroup and JPMorgan Chase. This comes as financial institutions adjust plans amid rising coronavirus infections and the World Health Organization warns about the Omicron variant's rapid spread.

title: New middle market banking leader at JPMorgan Chase in Pittsburgh
summary: Lisa Haley Huff has been appointed as JPMorgan Chase & Co.'s market executive for middle market banking in western Pennsylvania, marking her return to Pittsburgh. She will also serve as a local co-chair for a firmwide program of the nation's largest bank. This move follows recent related news including Chase's overdraft protection updates and expansion plans in Pittsburgh.

title: Packaging maker Sonoco to acquire Ball Metalpack for $1.35 bln
summary: Sonoco Products Co announced it will acquire Ball Metalpack for $1.35 billion in cash to expand its sustainable packing portfolio. The acquisition is expected to generate significant tax benefits and strengthen Sonoco's cash flow and earnings. Ball Metalpack's current boss, Jim Peterson, will continue to lead the company within Sonoco's consumer packaging division.

title: Biotech company Senti Bio to go public via $600 mln SPAC deal
summary: Biotechnology company Senti Biosciences Inc. is set to go public through a merger with the blank-check firm Dynamics Special Purpose Corp (DYNS.O) in a deal valued at $601 million. Senti Bio, known for its gene circuit technology platform, specializes in engineering DNA to create cell and gene therapies capable of sensing and responding to ailments within the human body. The deal is expected to generate over $296 million in gross proceeds, including a $66 million PIPE investment from Amgen Inc (AMGN.O) and other funds, with the merger anticipated to close in Q2 2022.

title: Medical City-Plano CEO Appointed to American Hospital Association Board
summary: Medical City-Plano CEO Jyric Sims has been appointed to the American Hospital Association's Regional Policy 7 Board for a two-year term. The article also details several other significant personnel moves across various companies, including new CFOs, COOs, VPs, and partners at firms like Texas Capital Bancshares, Meritize, Jamco Interests, Service King, Sidley Austin, and Whitley Penn.

title: Dividends Will Be Important Inflation Buffers in 2022
summary: As inflation is expected to remain elevated in 2022, dividend growth stocks are highlighted as a key strategy to maintain portfolio purchasing power. The WisdomTree U.S. LargeCap Dividend Fund (DLN) is presented as a prime ETF for this purpose due to its focus on dividend-paying large-cap U.S. stocks and its methodology that accounts for projected cash dividends. This approach to dividend investing, particularly in sectors like semiconductors, consumer staples, and healthcare, is seen as a robust buffer against inflation when compared to fixed-income investments.

title: Wilson Sonsini AdviSes Samsara on $805 Million IPO
summary: Wilson Sonsini represented Samsara in its initial public offering, which raised $805 million by pricing 35,000,000 shares of Class A common stock at $23 per share. The shares began trading on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol "IOT" on December 15, 2021, and the offering closed on December 17. Morgan Stanley, Goldman Sachs & Co. LLC, J.P. Morgan, and Allen & Company LLC served as lead book-running managers.

title: JPMorgan is fined $200 million after staff used personal chats for company business.
summary: JPMorgan Chase was fined $200 million by regulators for failing to track work-related communications made by employees on personal devices, including text messages and WhatsApp, from 2018 to 2020. The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) issued a $125 million fine, while the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) fined the bank $75 million for similar misconduct dating back to 2015. This action serves as a warning to Wall Street and has prompted investigations into other financial firms regarding their record-keeping practices.

title: J.P.Morgan Securities to pay $200 mln to settle U.S. regulatory charges on record-keeping lapses
summary: J.P. Morgan Securities has been fined $200 million by U.S. regulators for widespread failures to preserve staff communications on personal devices and messaging apps. The firm admitted to violating securities laws and agreed to improve compliance policies. This enforcement action is part of a broader crackdown on Wall Street misconduct, with similar investigations now open into other financial institutions.

title: JPMorgan hit with $200 million in fines for letting employees use WhatsApp to evade regulators' reach
summary: JPMorgan Chase has been fined $200 million by two U.S. banking regulators for allowing its employees to use WhatsApp and other unauthorized platforms for business communications, violating federal record-keeping laws. The SEC levied a $125 million fine, and the CFTC an additional $75 million, highlighting a widespread practice across the firm, including among compliance managers. This action signals a ratcheting up of enforcement by regulators against banks using unapproved messaging channels, especially as remote work became prevalent during the pandemic.

title: Ralph Giacobbe Joins Cigna as Head of Investor Relations
summary: Cigna Corporation announced that Ralph Giacobbe will join the company as Senior Vice President and Head of Investor Relations, effective January 2022. Mr. Giacobbe, previously Head of U.S. Health Care at Citigroup, brings over two decades of experience in the healthcare sector. He will report to Cigna CFO Brian Evanko and is expected to be a valuable asset due to his industry expertise and strong relationships in the investment community.

title: Schwab to offer T. Rowe institutional shares commission-free
summary: Schwab announced it will offer commission-free access to T. Rowe Price's institutional share class mutual funds for the more than 9,000 financial advisers who custody client assets at Charles Schwab & Co., starting in February. This move follows Fidelity's similar platform which has been established since 2017, and aims to provide advisers with lower-cost options by eliminating $24 commissions and reducing management fees. The arrangement is expected to benefit both advisers and clients, giving T. Rowe Price a boost in competing with the growing ETF market.

title: Is now the time to consider Chinese government bonds?
summary: Despite ongoing issues in China's property debt market, Chinese government bonds (CGBs) offer global investors higher yields and diversification potential compared to other major markets. The article highlights China's differing economic cycle, monetary easing efforts, and low correlation with other bond markets as key attractions for CGBs. Increasing foreign demand and inclusion in major global bond indices further bolster their appeal.

title: LEO LIEBOWITZ Obituary (2021) - New York, NY - New York Times
summary: Leo Liebowitz, a remarkable entrepreneur, passed away on December 12, 2021, at the age of 94. He built a vast business empire starting from a gas station, eventually acquiring Getty trademark and establishing Getty Petroleum Corp as the largest independent marketer of gasoline on the East Coast. Leo, known for his integrity, kindness, and dedication to family, left a lasting legacy through his business acumen and philanthropic endeavors.

title: Morgan Stanley-backed Bitcoin firm NYDIG raises $1 billion
summary: NYDIG, a Bitcoin servicer backed by Morgan Stanley, raised $1 billion in its latest funding round, valuing the company at over $7 billion. This significant investment highlights increasing Wall Street interest in the crypto space and will be used to develop NYDIG's Bitcoin platform and accelerate client onboarding. The firm offers private wealth clients of major banks access to Bitcoin funds and expects to expand its crypto product offerings through various financial institutions in 2022.

title: Samsara IPO: 5 things about the cloud-based operations company
summary: Samsara Inc. announced its initial public offering priced at $23 a share, aiming to tap into an estimated $55 billion market for digitizing non-tech company operations. The stock will trade on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker "IOT". Morgan Stanley, Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan, and Allen & Co. served as lead underwriters for the deal.

title: Libya launches asset hunt to restore billions of dollars, authorities say it could be largest in history
summary: The Libyan government has sought permission to subpoena records from several major US banks, including JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Citigroup Inc., in an effort to recover billions of dollars allegedly looted by former dictator Mummar Al Qaddafi. The Libyan Asset Recovery and Management Office (LARMO) estimates that tens of billions of dollars remain missing and states this could be the largest international asset recovery in history. LARMO, established in 2017 with UN and EU support, aims to track money stolen through corrupt deals and embezzlement during Qaddafi's era.

title: Fifth Third rapidly recruiting middle market team in DFW
summary: Fifth Third is aggressively building its middle market team in the DFW area after entering the market in March. Ron Harrison was appointed as Fifth Third's North Texas market executive to spearhead these efforts. The bank has provided corporate services in Texas for over a decade but only recently began focusing on the core middle market segment.

title: Metro Phoenix Bank, one of the few banks based in Arizona, to be acquired by North Dakota chain
summary: Metro Phoenix Bank (MPHX), one of the few banks headquartered in Arizona and founded in 2007, is set to be acquired by North Dakota's Alerus Financial Corporation (ALRS). This acquisition by an out-of-state bank continues a long-standing pattern of financial institutions gaining a foothold in the growing Phoenix market through such deals. The transaction is anticipated to conclude in early 2021.

title: Korn Ferry CEO Gary Burnison releases new leadership book
summary: Korn Ferry CEO Gary Burnison has released his eighth book, “The Five Graces of Life and Leadership,” which explores the evolving landscape of leadership, particularly in hybrid work environments. The book highlights five key graces: gratitude, resilience, aspiration, courage, and empathy, emphasizing their importance in fostering community and connection. Burnison, a bestselling author and long-serving CEO of Korn Ferry, outlines how these traits are crucial for leaders to effectively motivate their teams.

title: Innovator Interview: JPMorgan Chase & Co.’s Tracy-Ann Lim
summary: Tracy-Ann Lim, Chief Media Officer at JPMorgan Chase & Co., discusses how her agency experience prepared her for the rapid changes brought by the pandemic, particularly the acceleration of digital engagement. She also details JPMorgan Chase’s brand pillars of Impact and Integrity, the challenges and adaptations for a cookieless future, and the evolving role of media in crisis communication and inclusivity. Lim emphasizes the importance of agility, customer experience, and discoverability in the future of media.

title: What is SPAC vs IPO vs Primary Direct Listing? (And Why Grab Chose SPAC)
summary: This article explains the differences between going public via SPAC, IPO, and Primary Direct Listing, using Grab and Coinbase as recent examples. It details the processes, timelines, costs, and investor implications of each method, highlighting why companies choose one over the other for expansion and capital raising. The piece emphasizes the importance of investor due diligence given the varying rigor of each public listing approach.

title: Volatility Strikes Bank Stocks, but Optimism Remains
summary: Despite recent volatility caused by the Omicron variant, bank stocks are poised for a strong performance in 2022 due to the prospect of rising interest rates and inflation. The MSCI ACWI Banks Industry index is up 23% for the year, with the KBW Nasdaq Bank Index significantly outperforming the S&P 500. Investors can leverage this optimism with ETFs like the Direxion Daily Financial Bull 3X ETF (FAS).

title: CEMEX recibe financiamiento sindicado vinculado a la sostenibilidad por 3.250 millones de dólares
summary: CEMEX secured a $3.25 billion syndicated sustainability-linked financing, comprising a term loan and a revolving credit facility, both with five-year terms. This financing will be used to repay a previous loan and fund general corporate purposes, marking a significant step towards CEMEX's investment-grade objective and its carbon-neutral strategy. The deal involved 21 financial institutions and multiple legal advisors for both CEMEX and the lenders.

title: This big bank is getting rid of overdraft fees, saving customers $150 million a year
summary: Capital One Bank announced it will eliminate overdraft fees and penalties for non-sufficient funds on all its accounts, effective early next year. This move makes Capital One the first major bank to do so, potentially saving customers $150 million annually. The decision comes amidst increased scrutiny by the U.S. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and consumer groups regarding overdraft fee practices, which disproportionately affect low-income customers.

title: DocuSign shares plunge 42% after the company gave weak guidance
summary: Shares of e-signature software maker DocuSign plunged 42.2% after the company issued weaker-than-expected guidance for the fourth quarter. While DocuSign beat third-quarter analyst estimates, its Q4 revenue forecast of $557 million to $563 million fell short of the anticipated $573.8 million. CEO Dan Springer attributed the slowed growth to execution issues rather than macro forces, stating that the company pulled back from demand generation, but expects things to improve quickly.

title: OppFi to pay more than $2M to settle D.C. interest rate cap suit
summary: OppFi has agreed to pay over $2 million to settle a lawsuit brought by Washington, D.C.'s attorney general, who alleged the lender charged interest rates significantly higher than the District's 24% cap. The settlement includes $1.5 million in restitution, waiver of over $640,000 in interest owed by borrowers, and a $250,000 payment to D.C., with OppFi denying any deceptive practices but settling to avoid prolonged litigation. This case highlights ongoing debates about "true lender" issues in fintech-bank partnerships and state interest rate caps.

title: Capital One is the first big bank to get rid of overdraft fees
summary: Capital One became the first major US bank to eliminate all overdraft and non-sufficient funds fees, effective immediately. This move makes Capital One, the sixth-largest retail bank, a pioneer among top-tier financial institutions in ending these charges, which have drawn criticism from consumer advocacy groups and lawmakers for burdening vulnerable customers. The decision is expected to put pressure on other large banks to follow suit or risk regulatory action, as these fees have historically generated billions in revenue for the industry.

title: EXCLUSIVE: Morgan Stanley Leaves 2022 Grid Unchanged, Sharpens Focus on Asset Growth and Lending
summary: Morgan Stanley is keeping its core broker payout grid unchanged for 2022 but will introduce modified incentives to encourage brokers to grow asset and loan balances and promote E*Trade for self-directed accounts. The changes, taking effect in stages from January to September, include adjustments to bonuses for net acquired assets and liabilities, new ways for teams to qualify for bonuses, and revised payouts for lending and mortgages. These tweaks are part of Morgan Stanley's strategy to align with its modern wealth approach and deepen client relationships, mirroring a similar approach by competitor Merrill Lynch.

title: Ally Financial closes acquisition of credit card platform Fair Square Financial
summary: Ally Financial Inc. announced it has completed its acquisition of Fair Square Financial, a digital-first credit card company. This acquisition enhances Ally's consumer product suite with Fair Square's credit card offerings, aligning with Ally's strategy to become a leading full-service digital bank. Fair Square brings 86 employees, approximately 693,000 cardholders, and $816 million in loan balances to Ally.

title: No More Overdraft Fees? Capital One Becomes First Large Bank To Pledge End To Fines
summary: Capital One announced it will eliminate all overdraft fees for retail customers, becoming the largest bank to do so. This move is expected to cost the company $150 million in lost revenue but aligns with pressure from critics and smaller banks to end practices that disproportionately affect vulnerable consumers. Other banks like Ally have also ended overdraft fees, while some, such as PNC and Bank of America, have introduced features to help prevent overdrafts.

title: Tompkins Mahopac Bank Adds Surprise Gift to Banksgiving Donations
summary: Tompkins Mahopac Bank celebrated its annual "Banksgiving" by donating $7,500 to three Hudson Valley nonprofits focused on food insecurity: Dutchess Outreach, Feeding Westchester, and Second Chance Foods. This year, the bank added three surprise $1,000 donations to nonprofits chosen by its employees, namely Sparrow’s Nest of Wappingers Falls, Pawling Resource Center, and Gullotta House of Briarcliff Manor. These additional gifts aim to support causes important to their employees and further help communities during a challenging time.

title: Bank of Marin, after American River Bank acquisition, hires veteran Sacramento commercial lender
summary: Bank of Marin has hired veteran Sacramento banker Deepak Bhakoo as its new commercial banking sales manager. This appointment follows Bank of Marin's acquisition of West Sacramento-based American River Bank. Bhakoo will oversee the bank's commercial lending operations throughout its service area, from the Bay Area to Sacramento.

title: Firms beef up retirement benefits to attract and retain employees
summary: Firms are enhancing retirement benefits to attract and retain employees, as highlighted by KPMG's more generous match being a key differentiator. The article also touches on related topics such as the SEC's delayed work on private credit in 401(k) plans due to government shutdown, investment strategies of university endowments, private equity AUM growth, and CalPERS' voting stance on executive pay packages.

title: Goldman to Offer Asia-Pacific Staff $5,000 for Quarantine Costs
summary: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. is introducing a reimbursement plan to provide a one-time subsidy of up to $5,000 for its Asia-Pacific employees to cover hotel quarantine costs. This initiative, effective December 1, is a response to the "additional burden of multiple lockdowns and some of the strictest quarantine measures in the world" faced by staff in the region, particularly in Hong Kong due to its strict Covid-Zero strategy, and aims to help retain talent. JPMorgan and Morgan Stanley have made similar offers.

title: Closing in on UK Banking: JPMorgan Chase Takes on UK Financial Institutions with its own Digital Bank
summary: JPMorgan Chase has launched its digital bank in the UK, entering into direct competition with established British banks and fintech startups. This strategic move, following months of speculation, is aimed at providing UK customers with a new banking choice and capitalizing on the vibrant UK consumer banking marketplace. Despite intense competition, JPMorgan Chase is optimistic about its prospects, leveraging its strong reputation and a focus on reliability and exceptional customer service.

title: With UAW strike concluded, Deere reports record profits
summary: John Deere announced record profits for the fiscal year ending November 1, totaling $5.96 billion, despite a five-week UAW strike and ongoing supply chain issues. The company surpassed Wall Street expectations and projects another record year in 2022, driven by strong demand in agricultural and construction equipment, precision agriculture, and favorable market conditions. Deere is also passing increased costs from supply challenges and the new UAW contract onto customers and raised prices in 2021.

title: Kosciusko County Court News
summary: This article details court news from Kosciusko County, Indiana, as of November 2021. It lists numerous small claims, civil collections, plenaries, and evictions, including the involved parties and awarded financial amounts. Additionally, it reports on various infractions recorded in Superior Court II, such as speeding, driving while suspended, and other traffic and minor offenses.

title: Dunamu evolves from outlier to qualified investor in Woori
summary: Dunamu Inc., operator of South Korea's Upbit crypto exchange, is buying a 1% stake in Woori Financial Group, signaling its evolution into a qualified financial investor. This strategic investment aims to provide Dunamu with access to inside financial information and foster business cooperation, while also helping Woori draw a picture for digital business and potentially building a future business model for cryptocurrency adoption. Dunamu, which became a decacorn earlier this year, has been diversifying its investments beyond crypto, including stakes in entertainment companies like JYP Entertainment and HYBE, and plans to aggressively invest in areas creating synergy.
source: The Korea Economic Daily Global Edition
source_domain: The Korea Economic Daily Global Edition

title: Cowen buys M&A advisory firm Portico to beef up investment banking
summary: Cowen Inc announced its acquisition of Portico Capital Advisors, an M&A advisory firm specializing in the software industry, to expand its investment banking business. The deal, comprising 75% cash and 25% stock, is expected to boost Cowen's M&A advisory revenue by nearly 20% in fiscal 2022. This move aligns with a broader trend of increased dealmaking activity benefiting major Wall Street banks.

title: Companies are telling unvaccinated workers to pay more for health insurance
summary: Some companies are implementing policies to charge unvaccinated workers more for health insurance, citing the high costs associated with COVID-19 illnesses. This trend involves using "wellness programs" to levy surcharges or fees on employees who decline vaccination, aiming to incentivize vaccination and mitigate financial risks from COVID-related hospitalizations. Companies like Delta Air Lines and Mercyhealth have seen increases in vaccination rates after implementing such surcharges or fees.

title: JPMorgan Revs Up Acquisitions in Dimon’s Quest to Stay Dominant
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. is increasing its acquisition activity as part of CEO Jamie Dimon's strategy to maintain market dominance. This includes seemingly unconventional purchases like The Infatuation, a food-centric platform, which the bank acquired to help its card business attract new customers. The move reflects Dimon's commitment to spending as needed to fend off competitive threats.

title: Is UWM’s plan to shed the “meme stock” label?
summary: United Wholesale Mortgage (UWM) is reducing the Ishbia family's ownership stake to 90.6% by selling 50 million Class A common shares. This move aims to increase public float, attract long-term institutional investors, and shed the "meme stock" label, despite potential short-term stock price decline. The company also announced plans to borrow $500 million and continues its stock buyback program to maintain investor confidence and stability.

title: TD Bank Names Judy Dinn Chief Information Officer
summary: TD Bank has appointed Judy Dinn as its new Chief Information Officer (CIO), where she will lead technology strategy, planning, and delivery. Dinn brings over 20 years of experience as a technology executive in financial services, having previously held roles at JPMorgan Chase, RBC, CIBC, BMO, and D+H, and is recognized for her expertise and leadership in technology transformations. She will report to Greg Braca, President and CEO of TD Bank, and Greg Keeley, CIO of TD Bank Group.

title: Banks that helped GE, others bulk up now profit from break-ups
summary: A Reuters analysis reveals that some Wall Street banks, including Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan, and UBS, are now profiting from the break-ups of conglomerates like GE, Toshiba, and Johnson & Johnson, after previously advising them on acquisitions. Banks have earned over $1 billion from global spin-offs this year, nearly doubling last year's figures. The article highlights how these banks are paid to undo deals they once helped create, prompting questions about independent advice and the incentives within the banking industry.

title: JPMorgan sues Tesla for $162 mln after Musk tweets soured warrant deal
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co is suing Tesla Inc for $162.2 million, alleging breach of contract related to warrants Tesla sold to the bank in 2014. The dispute stems from JPMorgan's re-pricing of these warrants following Elon Musk's 2018 tweets about taking Tesla private, which created significant stock volatility. JPMorgan claims Tesla failed to honor its contractual obligations to pay after the warrants expired and Tesla's stock price surged.

title: Citizens Financial (CFG) Completes Merger Deal With JMP Group
summary: Citizens Financial (CFG) has completed its all-cash acquisition of JMP Group (JMP), a capital market firm specializing in investment banking services. This merger enhances Citizens Financial's capital market capabilities, industry expertise, and product offerings, particularly in key sectors like healthcare, technology, financials, and real estate. The acquisition is part of Citizens Financial's strategy to diversify revenue streams, expand its geographical footprint, and build upon its solid balance sheet through strategic growth initiatives.

title: CASPR Group Announces CEO Derek Blount
summary: CASPR Group has appointed Derek Blount as its new Chief Executive Officer, recognizing his leadership skills and experience in managing significant growth. Blount, who previously served as COO, will guide the environmental health technology company as it addresses increased demand for its proprietary NCC™ technology across various industries. His background includes corporate leadership at Daseke Inc., where he oversaw significant expansion through acquisitions, and extensive experience in corporate banking.

title: Peloton Interactive, Inc. Announces Proposed Public Offering of Class A Common Stock
summary: Peloton Interactive, Inc. announced a proposed underwritten public offering of $1 billion of its Class A common stock. The company also expects to grant underwriters a 30-day option to purchase an additional $150 million in shares. This offering is subject to market and other conditions, with Goldman Sachs & Co. LLC and J.P. Morgan acting as representatives for the underwriters.

title: Six firms connect for KKR, Global Infrastructure Partners' CyrusOne buy
summary: Six law firms, including Cravath, Swaine & Moore and Kirkland & Ellis, have been engaged for KKR & Co Inc and Global Infrastructure Partners' $15 billion acquisition of data center operator CyrusOne Inc. This deal comes amidst a boom in M&A activity within the data center industry, coinciding with American Tower Corp's $10.1 billion acquisition of CoreSite Realty Corp. Various law firms and financial advisors are involved in facilitating these major transactions.

title: JPMorgan files $162 million lawsuit against Tesla over warrants, citing Musk tweet
summary: JPMorgan Chase has filed a $162 million lawsuit against Tesla, alleging breach of contract over stock warrants. The lawsuit stems from Elon Musk's 2018 tweet about taking Tesla private at $420, which JPMorgan claims significantly decreased the value of the warrants. JPMorgan asserts Tesla flagrantly ignored its contractual obligation to pay when the warrants expired.

title: MercadoLibre, Inc. Announces Equity Offering
summary: MercadoLibre, Inc. announced its intention to make a public offering of common stock and expects to grant underwriters a 30-day option to purchase additional shares. The company plans to use the net proceeds for general corporate purposes. Morgan Stanley & Co. LLC, J.P. Morgan Securities LLC, and Goldman Sachs & Co. LLC are serving as lead managing bookrunners for the offering.

title: Expensify Announces Closing of Initial Public Offering and Exercise in Full of the Underwriters’ Option to Purchase Additional Shares
summary: Expensify, Inc. announced the closing of its initial public offering of over 11 million shares of its Class A common stock, including the full exercise of the underwriters' option to purchase additional shares. The shares were offered at $27.00 per share and are listed on The Nasdaq Global Select Market under the ticker symbol "EXFY." J.P. Morgan Securities LLC, Citigroup Global Markets Inc., and BofA Securities acted as joint lead bookrunning managers for the offering.

title: Hedge Fund and Insider Trading News: Kyle Bass, Ken Griffin, Elliott Management, Soros Fund Management, Sachem Head Capital Management, Renaissance Technologies, Regional Management Corp. (RM), Aon PLC (AON), and More
summary: This article covers recent hedge fund activities, including Renaissance Technologies quadrupling its Tesla stake and boosting its AMC bet, Kyle Bass's skepticism about Bitcoin's future due to regulation, and Soros Fund Management's increased investments in real estate and financial stocks. It also details Elliott Management securing board seats at Duke Energy and Sachem Head Capital Management's strong performance.

title: American Tower to buy data center operator CoreSite for $7.5 bln
summary: American Tower (AMT.N) has agreed to acquire U.S. data center operator CoreSite Realty Corp (COR.N) for $7.51 billion in cash, capitalizing on the increased demand in the data center sector. The offer of $170 per share represents a 5.7% premium over CoreSite's closing price on November 9, with the deal expected to close by the end of the year. CoreSite operates over 24 data center facilities across North America, leasing space to companies for computing power.

title: Chase Bank opens first branch in MetroWest
summary: Chase Bank has opened its first branch in the MetroWest area of Massachusetts, located in Framingham. This new branch at 120 Worcester Road is part of a larger redevelopment and offers customized financial solutions, ATM services, and financial health workshops. Although it's the first full-service branch in MetroWest, Chase has had ATMs in Marlborough and Natick and serves over a million customers across Massachusetts.

title: I.CON panel: For spec builders in top logistics markets, it pays to wait to sign a lease
summary: A panel at I.CON East discussed the strategic advantage for speculative industrial developers in top logistics markets to delay signing leases. With rents rapidly increasing and supply at historic lows, waiting allows developers to secure better deals. However, this strategy needs to be balanced with the certainty a credit tenant offers, and it is most effective in supply-constrained, high-barrier locations.

title: Anti-Woke ETFs Are Pitching to Conservatives Mad at Corporate America
summary: 2ndVote Advisers, led by former JPMorgan Chase & Co. banker Dan Grant, is launching exchange-traded funds (ETFs) aimed at conservative investors who are displeased with companies taking liberal stances on social justice issues. Grant believes that the millions of Trump voters are ready to invest in companies that align with politically conservative values or remain neutral, pushing back against the trend of left-leaning socially conscious investing. This initiative attempts to blend politics and investing by catering to those who feel neglected by "woke" corporations.

title: ClearTrace and EDF Partner to Provide 24/7 Renewable Energy to JPMorgan Chase’s UK Operations
summary: ClearTrace and EDF have partnered to provide 24/7 renewable energy to JPMorgan Chase's UK operations, ensuring 100% of electricity consumption is matched in real-time with renewable generation using ClearTrace's blockchain-based tracking technology. This collaboration with EDF, Britain's largest producer of zero-carbon electricity, aims to help JPMorgan Chase achieve its commitment to carbon-neutral operations and serves as a model for other large businesses seeking to decarbonize their electricity supply and improve their carbon footprint. This is the second agreement between ClearTrace and JPMorgan Chase, following a similar initiative for New York operations announced in 2020.

title: Gen Z Set to Adopt Fintech Apps at Record Rates: 155% Growth from 2020 to 18.9 Billion Sessions in 2022
summary: Gen Z is rapidly adopting fintech apps, with usage growing 155% from 2020 to 18.9 billion sessions in 2022. Cryptocurrencies are a significant driver of this increase, with Robinhood, Coinbase, and Wellbull Stocks being top crypto-trading apps among US Gen Z and Millennial users. This presents an unprecedented opportunity for financial institutions to engage mobile-first Gen Z users and cultivate loyalty as they approach financial independence.

title: CMU Invites Students To Explore Artificial Intelligence With Opening of JPMorgan Chase & Co. AI Maker Space
summary: Carnegie Mellon University has opened the JPMorgan Chase & Co. AI Maker Space, an initiative designed to provide students from diverse disciplines with access to advanced AI technology. The 2,000-square-foot facility, supported by JPMorgan Chase & Co., offers robots, drones, smart appliances, and high-end computers, encouraging interdisciplinary collaboration and innovation in artificial intelligence. This space aims to foster creativity and equip students with the tools to develop cutting-edge AI solutions for real-world problems.

title: Hertz Relists on NASDAQ Global Select Market as HTZ
summary: Hertz Global Holdings Inc. has relisted its shares on the Nasdaq Global Select Market under the ticker HTZ, following its emergence from bankruptcy earlier this year. Shareholder sold 44.5 million shares in an upsized public offering, though Hertz itself did not receive proceeds and plans to repurchase $300 million worth of shares. The company is also focusing on electric vehicles, with plans to acquire 100,000 Teslas and rent 50,000 EVs to Uber.

title: CI&T Announces Pricing of Initial Public Offering (IPO)
summary: CI&T Inc. announced the pricing of its initial public offering of 13,043,478 Class A common shares at US$15.00 per share. The offering is expected to begin trading on the NYSE under the ticker "CINT" on November 10, 2021, and close on November 12, 2021. Goldman Sachs & Co. LLC and Citigroup are leading the underwriting group for the offering.

title: Whittier Daily News: Local News, Sports, Things to Do - Expensify Announces Pricing of Initial Public Offering
summary: Expensify, a payments superapp, announced the pricing of its initial public offering, offering 9,730,776 shares of Class A common stock at $27.00 per share. The company expects to raise approximately $70.4 million from its portion of the offering, with shares set to trade on Nasdaq under the ticker "EXFY" starting November 10, 2021. J.P. Morgan Securities LLC, Citigroup Global Markets Inc., and BofA Securities are lead bookrunning managers for the offering.

title: General Electric to split into 3 public companies
summary: General Electric announced its plan to split into three public companies focused on aviation, healthcare, and energy, with the healthcare spinoff planned for early 2023 and the energy segment for early 2024. This move aims to provide each new company with greater focus and strategic flexibility, marking an end to GE's conglomerate era.
