CEO Lawrence Culp Jr. stated the separation will drive long-term growth and value for stakeholders, following years of unwinding the company's vast empire and improving its stock performance.

title: Braze IPO: What to Know About Price Terms and More
summary: Customer engagement platform Braze is preparing for its initial public offering, targeting a multi-billion-dollar valuation with shares priced between $55 and $60. The company aims to raise $402 million by offering 6.7 million Class A common stock shares. Braze seeks a $5.41 billion valuation and plans to list on the Nasdaq Exchange under the ticker symbol "BRZE."

title: Methanex Egypt Announces the Early Settlement of its Joint Venture Financing Facility
summary: Methanex Egypt has announced the full and early settlement of its US$530 million EMethanex Joint Venture project financing facility. This collaboration spanned 15 years with an international and local banking consortium, enabling a US$1 billion investment in Damietta for their methanol production plant. The early settlement marks a significant milestone, highlighting the venture's successful financial management despite economic challenges.

title: Sallie Mae Appoints Samuel Ramsey to Its Board of Directors
summary: Sallie Mae (Nasdaq: SLM) announced the appointment of Samuel Ramsey to its board of directors, effective immediately. Mr. Ramsey brings over 30 years of experience in consumer and commercial banking, with significant expertise in risk management, finance, treasury, and capital markets from roles at Chase, Ally Financial, and Bank of America. His appointment is expected to deepen the company's expertise in critical risk management areas.

title: How a new JPMorgan Chase branch on Beatties Ford Road goes beyond just banking
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. opened a new branch on Beatties Ford Road in Charlotte, attracting neighborhood and civic leaders to the celebration. This article highlights the opening of the latest local branch in the Historic West End.

title: Trii ofrece gratis 1.500 transacciones del fondo bursátil Hcolsel de Global X en la bolsa
summary: Trii is offering 1,500 free transactions for the Hcolsel ETF from Global X on the Colombian Stock Exchange, along with cashbacks and referral codes. This initiative follows the recent authorization for Trii to allow trading of international stocks in Colombia, including major US and Chilean companies. The Hcolsel ETF itself is composed of significant Colombian companies like Ecopetrol and Bancolombia.

title: JPMorgan Will No Longer Allow Prime Brokerage Clients to Purchase Certain Cannabis-Related Securities
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. has informed its prime brokerage clients that, effective Nov. 8, they can no longer purchase certain U.S. cannabis-related securities, particularly those not listed on major stock exchanges and with a direct nexus to marijuana activities. This restriction aims to comply with U.S. money laundering laws, following similar actions by other banks after the Archegos Capital collapse. The U.S. Cannabis Council CEO Steven Hawkins criticized the move, calling it "regressive" and suggesting JPMorgan will regret not participating in the rapidly growing cannabis industry.

title: Schwab CEO Defends PFOF, Claims It Nets Investors Better Pricing
summary: Charles Schwab CEO Walt Bettinger defended his firm's use of payment for order flow (PFOF), asserting that it has resulted in better pricing for investors and lowered commissions, despite concerns about conflicts of interest raised by SEC Chairman Gary Gensler. Bettinger argued that PFOF provides economic value and that outlawing it would merely transfer that value elsewhere. Gensler, however, remains focused on potential conflicts, especially regarding how PFOF might incentivize increased trading or steer investors toward riskier accounts.

title: JPMorgan Chase to restrict purchases of cannabis-related stocks, securities, report says
summary: JPMorgan Chase informed its brokerage clients that they would no longer be allowed to purchase cannabis-related stocks and securities starting November 8, 2021. This restriction applies to any company with a "direct nexus to marijuana-related activities" and follows a similar move by Credit Suisse Group earlier in the year. U.S. Cannabis Council CEO Steve Hawkins criticized the decision, calling it "regressive" and "self-defeating."

title: JP Morgan Chase: Why Your Business Needs to be Certified as a Diverse Supplier – or hire more Diverse Suppliers
summary: This article from JP Morgan Chase emphasizes the importance for businesses to become certified as diverse suppliers or to actively hire more diverse suppliers. It highlights how supplier diversity promotes innovation, networking, and addresses racial equity gaps, with significant financial commitments from large corporations like those in the Billion Dollar Roundtable and government agencies. The piece also details the certification process and the benefits for both diverse-owned businesses and large corporations, including opportunities for growth and access to substantial procurement budgets.

title: JP Morgan Asset Management Launches JPIE
summary: J.P. Morgan Asset Management has launched the JPMorgan Income ETF (JPIE), an actively managed fixed income ETF designed to offer attractive distributions with lower volatility. JPIE leverages the firm's Global Fixed Income Currency and Commodities (GFICC) platform and is managed by a team with extensive experience in fixed income. This new ETF expands J.P. Morgan Asset Management's active fixed income suite to 10 products, further solidifying its presence in the ETF market.

title: Jefferies hires senior bankers for financials investment banking -memo
summary: Jefferies Financial Group has bolstered its investment banking unit by hiring senior bankers from rivals such as JPMorgan Chase & Co and Barclays PLC. Matthias Kristol will lead asset and wealth management investment banking globally, and Aaron Bruker will head sidecars and third-party capital. These hires are part of Jefferies' strategy to capitalize on record-breaking mergers and acquisitions activity.

title: J.P. Morgan Asset Management Launches Active Fixed Income ETF: JPMorgan Income ETF (JPIE)
summary: J.P. Morgan Asset Management has launched the JPMorgan Income ETF (JPIE), an active fixed-income ETF designed to offer attractive distributions with lower volatility by investing across various debt securities. The fund aims to maximize income while minimizing portfolio risk through sector allocation shifts, combining the expertise of the firm's Global Fixed Income Currency and Commodities (GFICC) platform. JPIE is managed by experienced portfolio managers Andrew Norelli, Andrew Headley, and Thomas Hauser, further expanding J.P. Morgan Asset Management's active fixed-income product suite.

title: Fluence Announces Closing of Initial Public Offering and Full Exercise of Underwriters’ Option to Purchase Additional Shares; Raises Gross Proceeds of $998,200,000
summary: Fluence Energy, Inc. announced the closing of its initial public offering, including the full exercise of the underwriters' option to purchase additional shares, raising gross proceeds of $998.2 million. The company's Class A common stock began trading on the Nasdaq Global Select Market under the ticker symbol "FLNC" on September 28, 2021, at an initial public offering price of $28.00 per share.

title: Jeffrey Epstein ties cost Barclays CEO his job
summary: Barclays Plc CEO Jes Staley has resigned following a UK regulatory probe into how he characterized his past relationship with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. C.S. Venkatakrishnan, head of the Barclays markets division, will replace him. The investigation's findings have not been made public, but Staley intends to contest them.

title: Bank of America to seek approval for securities firm in China - Bloomberg News
summary: Bank of America is reportedly planning to file an application to establish a securities firm in China as part of its strategy to expand into the country's growing financial services market. This move follows similar actions by other major Western banks like JPMorgan Chase and Goldman Sachs, leveraging China's loosened rules for foreign banks to operate fully-controlled businesses. The expansion into China's multi-trillion-dollar financial sector is driven by lucrative underwriting fees and the prospect of full ownership of business units.

title: Discredit history: 10 years of Barclays scandals
summary: This article details a decade of scandals at Barclays, leading to the resignation of two chief executives. It covers controversies such as the 2008 financial crisis fundraising, the Libor rigging scandal, and various issues involving former CEO Jes Staley, including a whistleblowing scandal and his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.

title: CI&T Announces Launch of Initial Public Offering (IPO)
summary: CI&T Inc., a global digital transformation partner, has announced the launch of its initial public offering. The offering includes Class A common shares from both CI&T and certain selling shareholders, with an estimated price range of US$17.00 to US$19.00 per share, and the company intends to list on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol "CINT." Proceeds from the offering will be used for strategic acquisitions, working capital, capital expenditures, investments, and general corporate purposes.

title: T. Rowe Price To Acquire Oak Hill Advisors for $4.2 Billion
summary: T. Rowe Price Group Inc. announced its plan to acquire credit manager Oak Hill Advisors for up to $4.2 billion, marking a significant expansion into private markets to diversify beyond its mutual fund business. The deal, which involves cash and stock, is expected to close in Q4 2021, with Oak Hill operating as a standalone business. This move comes amidst a wave of M&A activity in the asset management sector and coincides with T. Rowe's release of third-quarter earnings that missed analyst estimates.

title: PNC shuttering nine branches, one's near Pittsburgh
summary: PNC Financial Services Group Inc. is closing nine branches, including one near Pittsburgh. This brings the total confirmed closures in southwestern Pennsylvania this year to 11. Three of the branches will be consolidated into PNC's new Moon branch.

title: T Rowe Price to expand into alternative investments with $4.2 bln Oak Hill deal
summary: T. Rowe Price agreed to acquire Oak Hill Advisors for $4.2 billion in cash and stock, signaling a move deeper into alternative investments to meet client demand and bolster profitability. This acquisition comes as asset managers are increasingly seeking new avenues for growth amid fierce competition and a shift towards passive investing. The deal includes $3.3 billion payable at closing with an additional $900 million contingent on meeting certain business milestones.

title: Goldman Sachs, Harvard team up with Al Gore’s investment firm
authors: Tasneem Brogger and Alastair Marsh and Bloomberg
summary: Al Gore's investment firm, Generation Investment Management LLP, is partnering with Goldman Sachs Asset Management, Microsoft Climate Innovation Fund, and Harvard Management Co. to launch "Just Climate." This new venture aims to channel capital into companies and projects focused on decarbonizing the economy, with the goal of limiting global warming to 1.5 degrees Celsius. The initiative highlights a shift from traditional ESG investing, which is seen as insufficient to address the urgent climate crisis, towards more direct "climate-led investing."

title: Financial Use Cases for Named Entity Recognition (NER)
summary: This article explores the growing importance of Named Entity Recognition (NER) in the financial sector, a machine learning tool that structures unstructured textual data. It highlights how NER helps financial professionals process vast amounts of data more efficiently, enabling smarter search, augmenting research, powering recommendations, and supporting AI applications. The piece also provides practical examples and outlines five key use cases for NER in finance.

title: It’s BITO vs. GBTC vs. BTC as Bitcoin ETF Wars Heat Up
summary: The article discusses the "Bitcoin ETF Wars" between ProShares Bitcoin Strategy ETF (BITO), Grayscale Bitcoin Trust (GBTC), and direct Bitcoin (BTC). It highlights BITO's rapid asset accumulation but underperformance compared to Bitcoin and GBTC since its launch, fueling the debate over futures-based versus spot Bitcoin ETFs. Grayscale maintains confidence in eventual spot ETF approval despite market signals suggesting otherwise.

title: Head of Project Maven to depart for JPMorgan Chase & Co.
summary: Col. Drew Cukor, the head of Project Maven, is departing the Department of Defense to join JPMorgan Chase & Co. Project Maven is a high-profile military artificial intelligence initiative that processes drone footage and has previously drawn scrutiny regarding AI's role in military operations.

title: Equitable Chairman Departs Over Communications That Didn’t Meet Standards
summary: Ramon de Oliveira resigned as independent chairman of Equitable Holdings and AllianceBernstein Holding LP due to "communications that were inconsistent with" company standards. Equitable stated the departure was unrelated to the company’s operations, financial integrity, or controls. Joan Lamm-Tennant has replaced Mr. de Oliveira as independent chairman for both companies.

title: Ventyx Biosciences Announces Closing of Upsized Initial Public Offering and Full Exercise of Underwriters’ Option to Purchase Additional Shares
summary: Ventyx Biosciences, Inc. announced the closing of its upsized initial public offering, raising approximately $174.3 million. The offering included the full exercise of the underwriters’ option to purchase additional shares, with 10,893,554 shares sold at $16.00 per share. The company, focused on inflammatory diseases and autoimmune disorders, began trading on the Nasdaq Global Select Market on October 21, 2021, under the ticker symbol “VTYX.”

title: MainStreet Bank Unveils Avenu™ Platform to Serve Fintech Partners
summary: MainStreet Bank has launched its new Avenu™ platform, a technology solution designed to provide "Banking as a Service" (BaaS) for fintech partners. Avenu™ aims to streamline banking and payment needs for fintechs, helping them manage risk, meet compliance, and accept deposits. This initiative leverages MainStreet Bank's decade of experience in BaaS to serve the growing fintech market.

title: Venezuela: ConocoPhillips Closer to Enforcing $9.7B Award After Guaidó Opposition Misses Payments
summary: A World Bank international arbitration tribunal has suspended proceedings to annul a US $9.7 billion award to ConocoPhillips due to the Venezuelan opposition's failure to make mandatory payments. This setback for the US-backed Guaidó opposition, which is already facing other financial and legal challenges, brings ConocoPhillips closer to enforcing the award. The situation highlights ongoing disputes over Venezuela's foreign assets, including CITGO, which creditors are targeting.

title: Deutsche Bank v Busto: The latest chapter in the Italian swaps saga
summary: The English High Court ruled that interest rate swaps between Deutsche Bank AG London and the Italian municipality Comune di Busto Arsizio were valid and binding, obliging Busto to continue payments until 2031. This decision is significant as it's the first time an English court has considered the application of the Italian Supreme Court's "Cattolica" decision on the validity of swaps under Italian law to an English law contract. The court addressed key issues including the capacity of Italian public bodies to execute swap contracts and the interpretation of the Cattolica decision.

title: Louisiana Bond Commission delays refinancing of state debt over ‘gun rights’ questions
summary: The Louisiana State Bond Commission delayed the refinancing of $700 million in state debt after Attorney General Jeff Landry raised questions about JPMorgan Chase's policies regarding companies that sell military-style weapons. State Treasurer John Schroder postponed the vote to investigate the bank's stance, despite JPMorgan stating it complies with Louisiana's gun rights requirements. This situation highlights an ongoing political rivalry and potential higher costs for taxpayers if Louisiana rejects JPMorgan, who initially offered the best deal.

title: TaskUs Announces Upsizing and Pricing of Secondary Offering of Class a Common Stock
summary: TaskUs, Inc. announced the upsizing and pricing of a secondary public offering of 12,077,480 shares of its Class A common stock by selling stockholders at $63.50 per share. The selling stockholders have also granted underwriters an option to purchase an additional 1,811,622 shares. TaskUs will not sell any shares or receive proceeds from this offering, which is expected to close on October 25, 2021.

title: P10 Announces Pricing of its IPO
summary: P10, Inc., a private markets solutions provider, announced the pricing of its initial public offering (IPO) of 20,000,000 shares of Class A common stock at $12.00 per share. The company will sell 11,500,000 shares, with selling stockholders offering an additional 8,500,000 shares. P10's Class A common stock is expected to start trading on the NYSE under the ticker symbol "PX" on October 21, 2021.

title: Italy's Falck family sells green business to JPMorgan-advised fund
summary: Italy's Falck family is selling its controlling stake in Falck Renewables for 1.5 billion euros to an infrastructure fund advised by JPMorgan Investment Management. The sale, driven by the significant investments and expertise required for renewable projects, values Falck Renewables at around 3.4 billion euros enterprise value and is expected to lead to the company's delisting from the Milan market.

title: Chase and Southwest Airlines® Expand Benefits for Southwest® Rapid Rewards® Cardmembers
summary: Chase and Southwest Airlines announced enhanced benefits for their Southwest® Rapid Rewards® Credit Cards, celebrating their 25th year of partnership. These enhancements include new rewards categories, increased travel benefits like EarlyBird Check-In® credits and A-List status spend, and boosted points offers for new consumer and business cardmembers. The updates aim to offer more points, benefits, and travel possibilities for cardholders without increasing annual fees.

title: Zanetti Beverage looks for private equity support to pursue new investments
summary: Massimo Zanetti Beverage Group, following its delisting, is seeking private equity investment for a 30% stake to support its international expansion plans. The company's advisor is BNP Paribas, and potential investors include major private equity firms. This move comes as the coffee sector sees significant interest from investment funds, and Zanetti aims to strengthen its competitive position and pursue growth opportunities.

title: Capital One to acquire healthcare investment bank TripleTree
summary: Capital One is set to acquire TripleTree, a Minneapolis-based healthcare investment bank, with the deal expected to close in Q4 2021. This acquisition will see TripleTree operate as a wholly owned subsidiary within Capital One Commercial Bank's Capital Markets group, while its sister company, TTCP Management Services, remains independent. The move highlights a growing trend among banks like KeyBank and Fifth Third to expand into the healthcare sector, attracted by its low risk and consistent growth.

title: PAI Said Set to Hire BofA, Goldman, JPMorgan for Refresco Exit
summary: PAI Partners is reportedly preparing to hire Bank of America Corp., Goldman Sachs Group Inc., and JPMorgan Chase & Co. to advise on exit options for its bottling business, Refresco. The private equity firm may explore a U.S. initial public offering for Rotterdam-based Refresco as early as next year. PAI is also considering bringing in additional banks to assess various exit strategies, including a potential sale of the €6 billion bottler.

title: Watch PennantPark Founder on Global Supply Chain Issues
summary: Art Penn, founder of PennantPark Investment Advisers, discusses global supply chain issues and their impact on businesses with Bloomberg. He highlights that non-bank lenders are thriving despite muted loan demand from large banks, serving small and medium-sized businesses. Penn anticipates supply chain bottlenecks will persist, leading to volatility and challenges for businesses in balancing inflation, wages, and technology investments.

title: Minas Buenaventura emite bonos por 550 millones de dólares con el apoyo de García Sayán, Miranda & Amado y Milbank
summary: Compañía de Minas Buenaventura SAA, la principal minera de metales preciosos en Perú, ha emitido pagarés senior no garantizados por 550 millones de dólares. Los fondos se utilizarán para prepagar la deuda tributaria de la empresa y fortalecer su perfil crediticio, reduciendo costos y liberando líneas de crédito. La operación contó con el asesoramiento legal de Milbank LLP y García Sayán Abogados para Buenaventura, y Cleary, Gottlieb, Steen & Hamilton LLP y Miranda & Amado para los coordinadores globales de la emisión.

title: JPMorgan Chase and Goldman Sachs start earnings season strong. (Published 2021)
summary: JPMorgan Chase and Goldman Sachs both significantly exceeded analysts' earnings expectations in the second quarter, signaling a strong start to earnings season. JPMorgan reported a profit of $11.9 billion, while Goldman Sachs earned nearly $5.5 billion, buoyed by increased consumer spending, robust business conditions, and a hot market for mergers and acquisitions. Both banks released significant funds from loan loss reserves, reflecting confidence in the economic rebound.

title: Goldman Sachs’s profit surges on record merger activity. (Published 2021)
summary: Goldman Sachs reported a significant surge in profit for the third quarter, fueled by record merger and acquisition activity and strong performance in equities trading. The Wall Street giant's earnings of $5.38 billion, or $14.93 a share, surpassed analysts' expectations, similar to other major banks like Bank of America, Morgan Stanley, Citigroup, and JPMorgan. CEO David M. Solomon highlighted strategic acquisitions and expressed optimism for an ongoing economic rebound despite lingering economic uncertainties.

title: Goldman Sachs traders deliver surprise surge
summary: Goldman Sachs reported a surprise jump in its trading business revenue, up 23%, contributing to a stellar quarter for the firm and defying analyst expectations. The company also saw significant growth in its consumer and wealth management business and is on track for its best revenue year ever. Goldman's overall companywide revenue climbed 26% to $13.6 billion, significantly surpassing average estimates.

title: Value stocks are unloved, unsexy, and poised to make a killing over the next decade
summary: This article argues that "value stocks," despite being currently overlooked, are set to significantly outperform "growth stocks" over the next decade. Research Affiliates' study indicates that value stocks are priced at their lowest relative to growth stocks since the dot-com bubble, suggesting potential inflation-adjusted returns of 5% to 10%. The report highlights energy, retailers, and auto parts as key value plays and suggests specific funds like T. Rowe Price Value Fund (TRVLX) and Vanguard Value ETF (VTV) for investors.

title: Planning for Austin growth, JPMorgan Chase leases two floors in downtown tower
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. has leased the top two floors of the 405 Colorado office tower in downtown Austin, signaling its commitment to grow with Central Texas. The company plans to increase its private bank headcount by 70% and move its Austin headquarters to the new building by the fourth quarter of next year, accommodating 141 employees with room for expansion. This move comes as JPMorgan Chase continues to expand its presence in the Austin metro, currently holding an 18.7% market share with nearly $11.6 billion in deposits.

title: Citizens Bank launches feature to reverse overdraft
summary: Citizens Bank has introduced a new feature called "Citizens Peace of Mind" that allows customers to reverse overdraft fees if they make their account balance positive by 10 p.m. Eastern time the next business day. This offering, available on all checking accounts since October 1, comes amidst a trend of financial institutions moving away from overdraft fees. The bank also plans to launch an overdraft fee-free checking account for low-income customers in early 2022.

title: Bitcoin and Crypto off to a Powerful Start In October
summary: Bitcoin and the broader cryptocurrency market are experiencing a strong recovery in October, driven by institutional adoption from major banks like Bank of America and U.S. Bank. The increasing popularity of decentralized finance (DeFi) and non-fungible tokens (NFTs) also contributes to this growth, attracting significant trading volumes and investor interest. The article highlights the Bitwise Crypto Industry Innovators ETF (BITQ) as a way for investors to gain exposure to the crypto ecosystem.

title: Judge sentences former Blue Ash nursing home owner to 42 months in prison for $59M fraud scheme
summary: A federal judge sentenced Harold Sosna, former owner of Premier Health Care Management, to 42 months in prison for a $59 million check-kiting fraud scheme that defrauded S&T Bank and First Financial Bank. Sosna, whose business faltered due to economic conditions and the pandemic, manipulated bank balances to extend the life of his company. He pleaded guilty to bank fraud, and the court is still determining the full restitution amount, as he faces numerous lawsuits from creditors for unpaid debts.

title: General Mills Launches $500 Million Sustainability-Linked Bond, Ties Interest to Emissions Goals
summary: General Mills announced the launch of its inaugural $500 million sustainability-linked bond, with interest payments tied to the company's progress in meeting its climate goals. This marks the first such offering by a U.S. investment grade consumer packaged goods company. The bond’s interest rates will increase if General Mills fails to reduce Scopes 1 and 2 greenhouse gas emissions by at least 21% by 2025.

title: JPMorgan Chase confirms move into new tower, explains growth plans
summary: JPMorgan Chase will move its Austin office to the top two floors of the new 405 Colorado tower in downtown Austin. The banking institution will occupy nearly 35,000 square feet, signifying its significant growth in Central Texas. This move positions the national bank in a prominent 25-story building at Fourth and Colorado streets.

title: Bucks Co-owner Jamie Dinan Forms Iconic Sports SPAC, Seeks $250 Million
summary: Milwaukee Bucks co-owner Jamie Dinan, alongside Alexander Knaster and Gianluca Vialli, has launched Iconic Sports Acquisition, a SPAC aiming to raise $250 million. The SPAC will target acquisitions in the global sports industry, including sports franchises, and adjacent sectors like data, analytics, media, and technology. This initiative follows a slowing SPAC market but highlights the continued interest in sports-focused ventures.

title: Life Time Announces Pricing of Initial Public Offering - Oct 6, 2021
summary: Life Time Group Holdings, Inc. announced the pricing of its initial public offering of 39,000,000 shares of common stock at $18.00 per share. Shares are expected to begin trading on The New York Stock Exchange under the symbol "LTH" on October 7, 2021. The offering is expected to close on October 12, 2021, and includes a 30-day option for underwriters to purchase an additional 5,850,000 shares.
source: Life Time Healthy Way of Life
source_domain: Life Time Healthy Way of Life

title: Citadel, Apex, IBKR, Robinhood oppose conspiracy claims in short squeeze lawsuit
summary: Defendants including Citadel Securities, Apex Clearing Corporation, ETrade, Interactive Brokers, and Robinhood have filed a reply to the amended complaint in the multi-district short squeeze lawsuit, arguing that the plaintiffs have failed to plead a cognizable antitrust claim. They contend that the market volatility in January 2021 led to independent actions by brokers to protect market integrity and manage risk, rather than a conspired agreement. The defendants also claim that there is no plausible common motive or evidence of collaboration among them to restrict trading to protect Citadel Securities' alleged short positions.

title: Robinhood Enters the Realm of Proxy Voting
summary: Robinhood's acquisition of Say Technologies aims to simplify proxy voting and increase shareholder engagement, particularly among individual investors. This move, alongside efforts by companies like JPMorgan and startups YourStake and OpenInvest, is part of a broader trend to make proxy voting and ESG investing more accessible and impactful. The article highlights how technology is breaking down barriers to participation, addressing the complexities of the voting process, meeting investors on familiar platforms, and helping them understand the impact of their choices.

title: General Mills Becomes First U.S. Investment Grade Consumer Packaged Goods Company to Execute a Sustainability-Linked Bond
summary: General Mills has issued a 10-year, $500 million sustainability-linked bond, making it the first U.S. investment-grade consumer packaged goods company to do so. The bond's coupon is tied to the company's progress in reducing absolute greenhouse gas emissions by 30 percent across its value chain by 2030, with interest increasing if interim targets are not met by 2025. This initiative underscores General Mills' commitment to combating climate change and integrating sustainability into its financial strategy.

title: U.S. Bancorp launches cryptocurrency custody service for investment managers
summary: U.S. Bancorp has launched a cryptocurrency custody service tailored for institutional investment managers with private funds in the United States and the Cayman Islands. The service, initially using NYDIG as a sub-custodian for bitcoin, plans to expand its support to other cryptocurrencies soon. This move comes amid growing investor interest and increased offerings in the cryptocurrency space by major financial institutions despite price volatility and regulatory scrutiny.

title: American Express American Airlines Business Extra Corporate Card review
summary: The American Airlines American Express® Business Extra Corporate Card offers benefits for business owners and employees who frequently fly American Airlines. While it lacks a generous welcome bonus, it provides a 6% rebate on eligible American Airlines airfares, Business Extra points, and airfare discounts, particularly appealing to companies without existing corporate contracts. The card's $75 annual fee can be easily offset by American Airlines airfare purchases, making it a valuable option for companies loyal to the airline.

title: Udemy files for U.S. IPO as remote learning shift drives revenue surge
summary: Udemy Inc. has filed for a U.S. IPO, revealing a significant revenue increase in 2020 driven by the surge in remote learning. The online education platform, valued at $3.3 billion last year, expects a higher valuation and has seen strong growth in its corporate learning service. Udemy aims to list on the Nasdaq under the symbol "UDMY".

title: Tyson Foods signs $2.25 billion credit agreement, settles lawsuits
summary: Tyson Foods has secured a new $2.25 billion credit agreement with JP Morgan Chase Bank, extending through September 2026, and repaid outstanding obligations from a previous loan. The company is also continuing to settle antitrust price-fixing lawsuits, agreeing to pay $42.5 million to customers and having previously set aside $221.5 million for litigation costs. Multiple class-action suits are still ongoing for consumers and investors related to the price-fixing allegations.

title: Leak reveals how Swiss wealth consultants shield global cast of suspects
summary: The Pandora Papers leak exposes how Swiss wealth consultants, notably Fidinam Group, exploit regulatory gaps to help the rich and powerful hide money and evade taxes. The documents detail Fidinam's involvement in a $600 million embezzlement scheme and connections to clients under criminal investigation, showcasing the opaque nature of Switzerland's advisory industry. The article highlights the failure of Swiss lawmakers to implement stricter anti-money laundering rules for advisers, despite evidence from previous leaks.
source: International Consortium of Investigative Journalists - ICIJ
source_domain: International Consortium of Investigative Journalists - ICIJ

title: As Interest Rates Rise, Leverage Financial Sector Strength
summary: The article discusses investment opportunities within the financial sector as the Federal Reserve signals rising interest rates in 2022. It highlights how rising rates benefit banks and the financial sector, suggesting the Direxion Daily Financial Bull 3X ETF (FAS) for leveraged plays. Despite potential dampening effects on mortgage demand, a hot housing sector and rising home prices could lead to larger loan amounts, balancing out this impact.

title: You Can Get Your Credit Score, but You May Have to Pay for It (Published 2021)
summary: A new Consumer Reports analysis reveals that many popular credit apps may provide credit scores that differ from those used by lenders and often charge consumers for access to scores and reports. This highlights a significant drawback in the current credit system where individuals often have to pay to know their credit score, despite its importance for major financial decisions. Consumers are legally entitled to annual free credit reports, but not necessarily free credit scores.

title: Rivian details $1 billion loss, Amazon deal in IPO filing
summary: Rivian Automotive Inc., an electric pickup maker backed by Amazon.com Inc., disclosed a net loss of almost $1 billion in the first half of the year in its initial public offering paperwork. The company is seeking to be valued at about $80 billion and has significant backing from investors like Amazon and Ford Motor Co., alongside strong pre-order interest for its vehicles. The filing also detailed its exclusive four-year deal with Amazon for delivery vehicles, although Amazon isn't bound by minimum purchase requirements.

title: Robo Advisors An Evolving Field
summary: Robo advisors are undergoing significant evolution to meet complex customer needs, particularly from younger investors. The industry is exploring hybrid models combining automation with human guidance, alongside fully automated services, to provide a broader range of financial advice and planning options. This shift aims to cater to both those seeking independent tools and those who eventually desire a more personalized, high-touch service.

title: Florida miner's lawsuit accuses JPMorgan of manipulating silver prices
summary: A Florida-based silver miner, Hidalgo Mining Corp, has filed a lawsuit against JPMorgan, alleging the bank manipulated the silver market, causing prices to drop so low that its Mexican mine had to close. The complaint, filed in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of Florida, uses information from a U.S. regulatory investigation into JPMorgan's spoofing activities between 2008 and 2016. JPMorgan has previously paid over $920 million to settle this investigation and $15.7 million to settle a class-action lawsuit related to the manipulation.

title: Citizens Financial Group Appoints Sarah Lindstrom as Head of Business Banking
summary: Citizens Financial Group announced the appointment of Sarah Lindstrom as Head of Business Banking, effective October 4. Lindstrom, who joined Citizens in 2017, will be responsible for growing the business banking portfolio and developing the team. Her leadership is expected to benefit customers and the Business Banking team as the company continues to expand this important segment.

title: A new ETF will let investors buy into risky debt some call 'ground zero' for the next financial crisis
summary: Janus Henderson has filed for a new ETF that will allow investors to buy into collateralized loan obligations (CLOs), specifically those with lower, riskier credit ratings (B-BBB+). While some analysts warn against opening such risky assets to retail investors, citing potential liquidity issues if the market falters, these lower-rated CLOs can offer higher yields compared to other investment options like top-rated CLOs or Treasury bills. The move brings a complex and potentially lucrative, yet highly speculative, asset class to a broader investor base.

title: T. Rowe Price Releases Three New Fixed-Income ETFs
summary: T. Rowe Price announced the launch of three new fixed-income exchange-traded funds (ETFs): the Total Return ETF (TOTR), the Ultra Short-Term Bond ETF (TBUX), and the QM U.S. Bond ETF (TAGG). These ETFs expand T. Rowe Price's total ETF offerings to eight, complementing its existing equity funds. The new funds are actively managed, reflecting the firm's long-standing strategic investing approach, and offer features like continuous daily trading and tax efficiency.

title: AES-Siemens joint venture Fluence joins raft of storage firms moving to go public
summary: Energy storage company Fluence, a joint venture between Siemens and AES, has filed for an initial public offering (IPO) to be listed on Nasdaq under "FLNC". This move follows increased investor interest in battery startups and marks Fluence's significant growth since its 2018 launch, including its AI platform and a recent $125 million investment from Qatar's sovereign wealth fund. The company joins several other storage firms that have recently gone public, capitalizing on the rising demand for energy storage solutions.

title: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon turned up to open D.C.'s newest Chase Bank branch. Here's why.
summary: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon participated in the opening of a new Chase Bank branch at Skyland Town Center in D.C.'s Ward 7, joined by D.C. Mayor Muriel Bowser. The event marked the culmination of a long-awaited project.

title: Motley Fool to convert its mutual funds into ETFs
summary: Motley Fool Asset Management plans to convert two mutual funds, totaling over $1 billion in assets, into ETFs by the end of the year. This move follows a growing trend in the industry, with firms like Dimensional Fund Advisors and JPMorgan Asset Management also making significant conversions. Analysts attribute this shift to the tax advantages, lower costs, and increasing investor preference for ETFs over traditional mutual funds.

title: Why Intuit Paid $500 Million for Naming Rights at Clippers Arena
summary: Intuit paid $500 million for the naming rights to the Los Angeles Clippers' new 18,000-seat arena, the Intuit Dome, for 23 years. This deal is part of a broader partnership focusing on fan experience, technology, and community involvement in Inglewood. The agreement aims to boost Intuit's public profile and contribute to the economic development and job creation in the area.

title: Clearwater Analytics Announces Pricing of Initial Public Offering
summary: Clearwater Analytics announced the pricing of its initial public offering of 30,000,000 shares of Class A common stock at $18.00 per share, with an option for underwriters to purchase an additional 4,500,000 shares. The shares are expected to begin trading on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol "CWAN" on September 24, 2021, and the offering is set to close on September 28, 2021. Goldman Sachs & Co. LLC, J.P. Morgan Securities LLC, and Morgan Stanley & Co. LLC are serving as lead bookrunners for the offering.

title: Fintech and traditional banks: competition or… symbiosis?
summary: This article examines the relationship between fintechs and traditional banks in the UK, questioning if it's competition or symbiosis. It analyzes customer usage of digital-only services versus traditional banking platforms, highlighting that while fintechs are growing, they often complement rather than replace traditional banks, especially among younger demographics. The author suggests that traditional banks still hold a massive audience and can leverage cross-selling strategies, indicating a more complex interaction than simple competition.

title: FreshWorks lists; valued at $13 billion
summary: Freshworks debuted on Nasdaq, with its shares surging 28% above the IPO price to reach a market value of $13 billion. This makes Freshworks the first India-born software-as-a-service firm to trade on a US exchange, setting a new valuation benchmark for Indian startups. The successful listing and strong investor interest highlight a new era for similar Indian companies looking to go public in the US.

title: Brilliant Earth Announces Pricing of Initial Public Offering
summary: Brilliant Earth Group, Inc. has announced the pricing of its initial public offering of 8,333,333 shares of Class A common stock at $12.00 per share. The shares are expected to begin trading on the Nasdaq Global Select Market under the ticker symbol "BRLT" on September 23, 2021, with the offering closing on September 27, 2021. J.P. Morgan, Credit Suisse, Jefferies, and Cowen are acting as lead book-running managers for the offering, which also includes an option for underwriters to purchase an additional 1,249,999 shares.

title: At U.S. Bank under Cecere, doing a giant deal takes 'discipline'
summary: U.S. Bank CEO Andrew Cecere greenlit the company's largest deal in two decades: the $8 billion acquisition of MUFG Union Bank. Cecere emphasized a disciplined approach to mergers and acquisitions, stressing the importance of meaningful opportunities and aligning with U.S. Bank's growth strategy, particularly in the faster-growing West Coast market. The acquisition is expected to increase U.S. Bank's size by 20% and includes plans to integrate MUFG Union Bank's customer activity onto U.S. Bank's systems, despite initial IT risk management concerns.

title: EXCLUSIVE JPMorgan faces oil bribery probe in Brazil
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. is under investigation by Brazilian authorities for its alleged involvement in a bribery and money laundering scheme related to state-run oil company Petrobras dating back to 2011. The probe focuses on purchases of Petrobras fuel oil and seeks to determine if bribe payments were routed to Petrobras employees to secure artificially low prices. This investigation is part of a larger crackdown on corruption within the commodity trading industry in Brazil.

title: JPMorgan Chase adopts Thought Machine's Vault cloud system for core retail banking operations
summary: JPMorgan Chase is moving its core retail banking system to Thought Machine's cloud-based Vault platform to meet changing customer demands, improve scalability, and support embedded banking. This adoption allows JPMorgan to run all retail banking products on a single, cloud-native platform. The move is part of JPMorgan's increased aggression in acquisitions, following recent purchases of college planning platform Frank and restaurant review service The Infatuation.

title: JPMorgan Chase acquires college financial planning platform Frank
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co (JPM.N) announced the acquisition of Frank, a college financial planning platform serving over 5 million students in the United States. This deal marks the latest in a series of acquisitions by the largest U.S. bank aimed at deepening its ties with students. The financial terms of the acquisition were not disclosed, and Frank's founder and CEO, Charlie Javice, will continue to lead the firm within JPMorgan Chase.

title: JPMorgan Chase is buying college financial aid platform Frank to deepen ties with students
summary: JPMorgan Chase has acquired Frank, a college financial aid platform, to strengthen its relationships with students and their parents, as well as to expand its customer base. Frank, which has served over 5 million students, helps with financial aid applications, online courses, and scholarships. This acquisition is part of JPMorgan's broader strategy to aggressively acquire fintech players and generate loyalty with specific demographic cohorts.

title: ON THE MOVE: Northern Trust Names Manioudakis CIO; Goldman Sachs Promotes Coleman to CFO
summary: Northern Trust Asset Management has appointed Angelo Manioudakis as its new Chief Investment Officer, bringing his extensive experience from other global financial firms. Concurrently, Goldman Sachs has promoted Denis P. Coleman III to Chief Financial Officer, succeeding Stephen M. Scherr who is set to retire. The article also details several other significant personnel changes across various financial institutions, including Crédit Agricole CIB, Triad Securities, BNY Mellon, OCC, Broadway Technology, and Canoe Intelligence.

title: Nueva simplificación de Grupo Aval en Centroamérica
summary: Grupo Aval is simplifying its structure in Central America by spinning off 75% of Leasing Bogotá S.A. Panamá (LBP), a subsidiary of Banco de Bogotá. This move will require a capital increase and is aimed at making decision-making more efficient and generating shareholder value. LBP plans to list its shares on the Colombian Stock Exchange, pending regulatory approvals.

title: Confluent Stock, MongoDB, Sprout Social Among 9 New Stocks On IBD Watchlists
authors: INVESTOR'S BUSINESS DAILY and MARK SHARAR
summary: Investor's Business Daily (IBD) has updated its stock watchlists, adding new companies like Confluent, MongoDB, and Sprout Social, while removing others that show weakness. These lists, including the IBD 50, Sector Leaders, and IBD Big Cap 20, are regularly revised to reflect current market conditions and identify potential investment opportunities. The changes help investors stay informed about leading stocks and those nearing buy points.

title: Advent-owned hair-care company Olaplex targets over $10 bln valuation in U.S. IPO
summary: Olaplex Holdings Inc, a hair-care products maker owned by Advent International, is seeking a valuation of up to $10.4 billion in its U.S. initial public offering. The company plans to offer 67 million shares priced between $14 and $16 each, aiming to raise $1.07 billion. Olaplex will list its shares on the Nasdaq under the symbol "OLPX" with Goldman Sachs, J.P. Morgan, Morgan Stanley, and Barclays as lead underwriters.

title: Keeping the faith – Diana van Maasdijk
summary: Diana van Maasdijk, CEO of Equileap, discusses the company's journey from skepticism to a crucial data provider for gender equality in the workplace. Equileap provides granular data and partners with Nasdaq ESG Hub, emphasizing the increasing investor focus on the "social" aspect of ESG. The article details Equileap's data collection methods, the impact of its Gender Equality Scorecard, and the growing evidence linking gender equality to improved financial performance.

title: Los Angeles Daily News - Definitive Healthcare Announces Closing of Public Offering
authors: Definitive Healthcare Corp. via Business Wire
summary: Definitive Healthcare Corp. announced the closing of its initial public offering of 17,888,888 shares of its Class A common stock, including the full exercise of the underwriters' option. The offering was priced at $27.00 per share, generating approximately $483 million in gross proceeds before expenses. The company's Class A common stock began trading on Nasdaq under the ticker symbol "DH" on September 15, 2021.

title: A Daunting Promotion Gave This Finance Executive Confidence to Launch His Own Company - WSJ
summary: This article chronicles how a challenging promotion at J.P. Morgan & Co. significantly shaped Rick McVey's career trajectory. Faced with leading North American fixed-income sales, an area unfamiliar to him, McVey gained the confidence to eventually launch his own successful online marketplace for corporate bonds. The piece is part of a series where top business leaders discuss the advisors who influenced their success.

title: Great Western Bank sells to competitor for $2B
summary: Great Western Bank, which operates two branches in the Kansas City area, has agreed to an all-stock merger with another regional bank, First Interstate Bank, in a deal valued at $2 billion. The combined entity is projected to hold more than $32 billion in assets, positioning it similarly in size to UMB Bank and Commerce Bank. This acquisition highlights ongoing consolidation within the regional banking sector.

title: Goldman Sachs to acquire GreenSky for $2.24 billion
summary: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. has agreed to acquire GreenSky Inc. for approximately $2.24 billion, integrating the fintech company into its Marcus consumer-banking platform. This acquisition will add GreenSky's payment plan services for home-improvement and healthcare needs, along with its network of over 10,000 merchants. The deal aims to expand Goldman's consumer-banking offerings and reach new customers through merchant partnerships.

title: Thoughtworks raises $773M in IPO and its stock jumps 40% on first day of trading
summary: Tech consulting firm Thoughtworks Holding Inc. saw its stock jump 40% on its first day of trading after raising over $773 million in its initial public offering. The company, backed by Siemens AG and Apax Partners, reached a market value of nearly $9 billion, driven by strong enterprise demand for its digitization services. Thoughtworks plans continued expansion, with sales up 40.3% year-over-year in the three months ending June.

title: Dutch Bros Coffee IPO Brews Oregon’s Newest Billionaire
summary: Dutch Bros Coffee's IPO raised nearly $500 million, making cofounder Travis Boersma a billionaire with a net worth of $2.5 billion. The company, which started as a pushcart in 1992, has grown to over 470 shops and plans aggressive expansion to 4,000 locations. This blockbuster IPO is the largest in Oregon's history, surpassing Nike and Columbia Sportswear.

title: Definitive Healthcare Prices IPO At $27/Shr
summary: Definitive Healthcare Corp. is making its Nasdaq Global Market debut under the ticker symbol "DH" after pricing its IPO at $27 per share for 15.56 million shares of Class A common stock. The Framingham, Massachusetts-based company, a provider of healthcare commercial intelligence through a SaaS platform, reported a net loss of $25.5 million and revenue of $76.8 million for the first half of 2021. The offering is expected to close on September 17, 2021, with underwriters having a 30-day option for an additional 2.33 million shares.

title: Freshworks' Rajnikanth-inspired IPO eyes $912 million at $9-bn valuation
summary: Freshworks Inc., a Chennai and Silicon Valley-based SaaS provider, has filed for an IPO in the US, aiming to raise $798 million to $912 million at a valuation of $9 billion. This makes it the first India-centric SaaS company to go public in the US and the most valuable SaaS startup from India. The IPO has been code-named "Project SuperStar" in homage to actor Rajinikanth by Freshworks CEO Girish Mathrubootham.

title: Top facts about Jeffrey Sprecher net worth
summary: This article details the life and career of Jeffrey Sprecher, the founder, chairman, and CEO of Intercontinental Exchange (ICE) and New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) chairman. It covers his personal background, education, career trajectory including the acquisition of NYSE, and his estimated net worth and salary. The piece aims to inspire aspiring entrepreneurs by highlighting his journey from a humble background to a prominent position in the financial world.

title: On Announces Pricing Of Initial Public Offering
summary: Swiss performance sportswear brand On has announced the pricing of its initial public offering (IPO) of 31,100,000 Class A ordinary shares at $24.00 per share. Trading of the shares is expected to begin on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol 'ONON' on September 15, 2021, with the closing of the offering anticipated on September 17, 2021. Goldman Sachs & Co. LLC, Morgan Stanley, and J.P. Morgan are serving as joint lead book-running managers for the offering.

title: David Booth’s Dimensional Flips $8 Billion of Assets Into ETFs
summary: Dimensional Fund Advisors has converted two more equity mutual funds worth $8.1 billion into ETFs, bringing their total ETF offerings to nine with approximately $40 billion in assets. This move follows an earlier record-setting conversion of $29 billion in mutual funds to ETFs in June. The firm is actively targeting the ETF market, leveraging the structure's tax advantages and client demand.

title: Academy Sports’ Largest Shareholder KKR To Sell Off Its 20 Percent Stake
summary: Kohlberg Kravis Roberts & Co. L.P. (KKR) is selling its entire 18.65 million-share stake in Academy Sports + Outdoors, Inc., which represents 20.1 percent of outstanding shares and is valued at $852.85 million. Academy Sports plans to repurchase up to $200 million of these shares as part of its $500 million share repurchase program. KKR, which acquired Academy Sports in 2011, will receive all proceeds from the offering, with no shares being sold by Academy itself.

title: Don't Fret About Small-Caps' Laggard Status, Says Strategist
summary: Despite small-cap stocks, as tracked by the Russell 2000 Index, underperforming large-caps for six months, strategist Steven DeSanctis of Jefferies believes a rebound is imminent. The Invesco S&P SmallCap 600 Pure Value ETF (RZV), with its deep cyclical value tilt and exposure to economic growth sectors, is highlighted as a strong contender for patient investors to capitalize on this anticipated recovery. RZV's current valuation in the 22nd percentile suggests it's attractively priced, making its current laggard status a potential buying opportunity.

title: JPMorgan Chase to acquire company behind Zagat guidebook
summary: JPMorgan Chase is acquiring The Infatuation, the company behind the Zagat guidebook and review brand, to expand culinary perks for its credit-card holders. This move is part of JPMorgan's aggressive acquisition strategy in adjacent businesses, as regulators bar it from acquiring other deposit-taking institutions. The Infatuation will operate as an independent brand under JPMorgan.

title: Bank of America taps new CFO, promotes three women to top roles
summary: Bank of America announced a significant management shake-up, replacing longtime CFO Paul Donofrio with Alastair Borthwick and promoting three women to senior leadership positions. CEO Brian Moynihan also indicated his intention to remain at the helm until the end of the decade. These changes come as Wall Street banks face pressure to diversify their top ranks.

title: Dell launches highly rated, $1.2 billion equipment finance securitization
summary: Dell Inc. has launched a $1.21 billion asset-backed security deal, Dell Equipment Finance Trust 2021-2 (DEFT), backed by commercial leases and loans from Dell Financial Services. This transaction, structured into six tranches with high ratings, aims to mitigate concentration risk and follows a similar securitization earlier in the year. Fitch Ratings highlighted the high credit quality of the underlying collateral, with obligor concentrations notably lower than previous deals.

title: JPMorgan to Buy Restaurant-Discovery Service the Infatuation - WSJ
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. has announced its acquisition of The Infatuation, a restaurant-discovery service that owns websites and apps guiding diners to local eateries globally, as well as the Zagat brand. This deal is part of the bank's strategy to appeal to high-spending customers who frequently travel and dine out. The Infatuation also organizes a biannual food festival called Eeeeeatscon.

title: JPMorgan Chase moves 1,700 employees back into Houston's tallest tower
summary: JPMorgan Chase has moved 1,700 employees, predominantly technologists for its Houston Technology Center, back into Houston's tallest tower. The JPMorgan Chase & Co. Tower is undergoing a renovation set to conclude in October.

title: Citizens Bank to acquire JMP Group in $149M, all-cash deal
summary: Citizens Bank is set to acquire San Francisco-based investment banking and asset management firm JMP Group in an all-cash deal totaling approximately $149 million. This acquisition, expected to close in the fourth quarter, aims to bolster Citizens' capabilities in healthcare, technology, financials, and real estate. This move is part of a larger series of acquisitions made by Citizens this year, including HSBC branches and Investors Bancorp.

title: JPMorgan Chase to buy Zagat owner in bid to boost premium credit cards
summary: JPMorgan Chase announced its acquisition of The Infatuation, parent company of restaurant review brand Zagat, to enhance offerings for its premium credit card holders, particularly those with the Sapphire card. This move aims to expand dining-related opportunities, potentially including access to reviews and events like EEEEEATSCON, building on successful past partnerships related to customer rewards. The financial terms of the deal were not disclosed.

title: Software consultancy Thoughtworks eyes $6.1 billion valuation
summary: Thoughtworks Holding Inc., a software consultancy, has announced its intention for an initial public offering aiming for a $6.1 billion valuation. The firm plans to sell 36.84 million shares at $18-$20, listing on Nasdaq under "TWKS." This follows a pre-IPO deal in January where it raised $720 million at a $4.6 billion valuation.

title: PayPal, Workday Lead New Names On IBD Breakout Stocks Index
summary: PayPal (PYPL) and Workday (WDAY) are identified as leading growth stocks on the IBD Breakout Stocks Index, both charging toward new buy points. Their inclusion also highlights the IBD Breakout Opportunities ETF (BOUT), which is also demonstrating breakout potential. JPMorgan recently downgraded PayPal, citing a slower-than-expected turnaround under its new CEO.

title: 7 Blockchain Stocks to Buy Now For the Bitcoin Bounceback
summary: This article identifies seven blockchain stocks that investors should consider as the blockchain technology market is expected to grow significantly. It highlights the expansion of blockchain beyond cryptocurrencies into various sectors like fintech, retail, logistics, and healthcare, and provides detailed financial performance and strategic initiatives for each recommended stock or ETF.

title: State Street expands with buyout of Brown Brothers’ custody unit for $3.5 billion
summary: State Street has announced an agreement to acquire the investor services division of Brown Brothers Harriman & Co. for $3.5 billion, aiming to expand its custody assets and enhance efficiency. This acquisition is expected to make State Street even larger globally, especially in Japan and Latin America, and integrate BBH's communications platform and 24/7 operating model. The deal is projected to yield $260 million in annual cost savings starting in the third year, despite a 3.7 percent drop in State Street's shares on the day of the announcement.

title: Goldman Hires Citigroup, HSBC Bankers as Mideast Deals Surge
summary: Goldman Sachs is expanding its Middle East operations by hiring bankers from Citigroup and HSBC. Jassim AlSane will join as co-head of investment banking and Omar AlZaim as head of Saudi investment banking, reflecting a surge in deal activity in the region.

title: Investors care more about fair wages for workers than environmental issues, ESG survey shows
summary: A new survey by Cerulli Associates reveals that investors prioritize fair wages for workers over environmental issues in ESG investing. While environmental concerns often dominate headlines, the report indicates a significant preference among affluent retail investors for companies offering positive social or environmental impact. The survey found that 49% of respondents would invest in such companies, a rise from 43% in 2019.

title: Morgan Stanley bumps first-year pay to $110K to match Goldman Sachs
summary: Morgan Stanley is raising the salaries of first-year analysts in its institutional securities division to $110,000, matching Goldman Sachs for the highest entry-level pay among major banks. This marks the second pay increase in a month for first-year investment banking and global capital markets analysts, and second-year analysts will also see their pay rise to $125,000. The move comes as other banks, including JPMorgan Chase, Citi, Barclays, Deutsche Bank, Bank of America, and Wells Fargo, have also increased junior banker salaries following concerns about work-life balance.

title: Barclays Bank Plc infuses Rs 3,000 cr in India ops to bolster business
summary: Barclays Bank Plc has infused Rs 3,000 crore into its Indian operations to boost its corporate, investment banking, and private clients businesses. This capital infusion increases the bank's total invested capital in India to over Rs 8,300 crore, reinforcing its commitment to the country. According to India Ratings, this strengthens Barclays India's Tier-1 capital ratio, providing necessary buffers against potential credit losses.

title: Synovus Bank Provides $45M Construction Loan on Orlando Rental Project
summary: Synovus Bank has provided a $45 million construction loan to The Cornerstone Group for the development of Urbon at Nona, a 360-unit multifamily community in Orlando, Florida. This four-year, fixed-rate loan will finance the construction of the large-scale residential and commercial property, with vertical construction slated to begin in August. The project aims to meet the high demand for quality housing in the growing Lake Nona area, near major employment centers and the Orlando International Airport.

title: Goldman Sachs to mandate COVID vaccine for staff, visitors at U.S. offices -memo
summary: Goldman Sachs will require all staff and visitors entering its U.S. offices to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, effective August 24, 2021. The bank will also mandate masks indoors and implement weekly testing for vaccinated employees starting September 7, 2021. This move aligns Goldman Sachs with rival banks Morgan Stanley and Citigroup, following the FDA's full approval of the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine and a resurgence of COVID-19 cases.

title: Para el CEO de Galicia, en Argentina el sistema financiero es ‘raquítico’ y ‘no hay moneda’
summary: Fabián Kon, CEO of Grupo Financiero Galicia, states that Argentina's financial system is "rickety" due to macroeconomic instability, high inflation, and lack of a stable local currency for savings. He emphasizes the need for a sustained economic plan focused on fiscal balance to revive credit to the private sector, which currently stands at less than 20% of GDP. Kon also discusses the challenges faced by banks through regulated rates, the need for financial inclusion, and the potential for a revaluation of Argentine assets given a credible economic plan.

title: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. stock outperforms market on strong trading day
summary: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. stock rallied 1.41% to $401.45 on Monday, outperforming the broader market indexes like the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average. This marks the stock's second consecutive day of gains, bringing it closer to its 52-week high. The company also outperformed key competitors in the banking sector on the same day.

title: PPP work helped Minnesota's community banks gain ground on bigger ones
summary: Community banks in Minnesota leveraged their work with the Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) to gain new customers and assets, seizing opportunities that larger banks often overlooked. This aggressive pursuit of PPP loans, especially for small businesses and underserved groups, led to significant growth in earnings and assets for several community financial institutions. The article highlights examples like Village Bank and Bremer Bank, demonstrating how their dedication to assisting businesses with government aid translated into a competitive advantage and increased market share.

title: Dutch Bros Inc. Announces Public Filing of Registration Statement for Proposed Initial Public Offering
summary: Dutch Bros Inc. announced the public filing of a registration statement on Form S-1 with the SEC for its proposed initial public offering of Class A common stock. The company intends to list its Class A common stock on The New York Stock Exchange under the symbol "BROS". BofA Securities, J.P. Morgan Securities LLC, Jefferies LLC, Barclays Capital Inc., and Piper Sandler & Co. are acting as lead book-running managers for the offering.

title: Goldman Sachs buys Dutch money manager in $1.9 billion deal
summary: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. is acquiring NN Investment Partners, the asset management arm of Dutch insurer NN Group, for approximately 1.6 billion euros ($1.9 billion). This acquisition aims to boost Goldman's European presence and establish a stronger foothold in the rapidly growing sustainable investing industry, as about three-quarters of NN's investments are backed by ESG criteria. The deal is expected to complete by the first quarter of next year and includes a 10-year partnership between NN Group and Goldman Sachs Asset Management.

title: Charles Schwab to give most employees 5% raise, pushes back return to office
summary: Charles Schwab announced a 5% pay raise for most employees, effective late September 2021, to reward them for their contributions during the pandemic, which saw the company benefit from rising stock markets and increased retail participation. The financial giant also postponed its return-to-office plans until January 2022 due to concerns over the delta variant of the coronavirus. This raise will exclude the company's Executive Council and those on incentive compensation plans.

title: KKR to Sell Industrial Real Estate Portfolio to Oxford Properties for $2.2 Billion
summary: KKR announced its agreement to sell a 14.5 million square foot industrial real estate portfolio to Oxford Properties for approximately $2.2 billion. The portfolio comprises 149 distribution buildings across 12 major U.S. industrial markets. This sale highlights KKR's successful strategy in the logistics sector and marks a significant expansion for Oxford Properties in the U.S. industrial real estate market.

title: Hyatt To Acquire Apple Leisure Group For $2.7 Billion
summary: Hyatt Hotels Corporation announced its definitive agreement to acquire Apple Leisure Group (ALG) for $2.7 billion in cash. This acquisition will significantly expand Hyatt's global resorts footprint, doubling its portfolio and making it the largest operator of luxury all-inclusive resorts worldwide. The deal will also accelerate Hyatt's asset-light strategy, aiming for 80% fee-based earnings by the end of 2024.

title: J.P. Morgan Redefines ‘Wealth’ for Younger Clients
summary: J.P. Morgan is redefining its approach to wealth management for younger clients, focusing on a broader definition of wealth that includes confidence, freedom, and the ability to pursue passions, beyond just monetary value. Dipti Kachru, CMO of U.S. Wealth Management at JPMorgan Chase & Co., discusses the company's strategy to build trust and connect with millennials through a recent ad campaign that avoids traditional tropes and showcases diverse wealth stories. The campaign aims to demonstrate how J.P. Morgan's offerings support various life goals for this new generation of customers.

title: Hyatt Spends $2.7 Billion To Become World’s Largest Operator Of Luxury All-Inclusive Resorts
summary: Hyatt Hotels Corporation announced its acquisition of Apple Leisure Group (ALG) for $2.7 billion in cash, making Hyatt the world's largest operator of luxury all-inclusive resorts. This deal adds 33,000 hotel rooms across 10 countries and expands Hyatt's presence significantly in Mexico, the Caribbean, and Europe. The acquisition supports Hyatt's strategy to shift towards a fee-based earnings model, with an expectation of reaching 80% fee-based earnings by the end of 2024.

title: The future of investing is personal — and it's already here
summary: Major investment firms like Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, BlackRock, and Charles Schwab are expanding their direct-indexing capabilities, signaling a shift towards personalized investing. This trend is driven by falling costs, better technology, and changing investor expectations, particularly among younger generations who want their portfolios to align with their values. Financial advisers must embrace new technologies to offer customized portfolios and remain competitive, while investors should consider whether hyper-personalized options could benefit them.

title: Kosciusko County Court News
summary: This article provides an update on court news from Kosciusko County, Indiana, as of August 12, 2021. It details various court proceedings including small claims, civil collections, evictions, mortgage foreclosures, and infractions from Kosciusko Superior Courts, alongside recent marriage license applications.

title: Triumph Bancorp outgoing CFO Bryce Fowler reflects on a decade of building a bank
summary: Bryce Fowler, the outgoing CFO of Triumph Bancorp, reflects on his decade-long tenure building the bank since its establishment in 2010. Fowler is set to retire effectively September 1st. The article highlights his significant role in the company's development during his time as CFO.

title: Bank of America Closing Gap With JPMorgan in Asia Deals Race
summary: Bank of America Corp. is significantly closing the gap with JPMorgan Chase & Co. in investment banking fees in Asia-Pacific after a three-year strategic rebuild. The bank is now "neck-and-neck" with the third-ranked JPMorgan in the region, focusing on securing major deals. This progress follows the hiring of six managing directors to bolster its investment banking team.

title: J.P. Morgan Asset Management Proposes Conversion of Select Mutual Funds to ETFs
summary: J.P. Morgan Asset Management announced plans to convert select U.S. mutual funds to ETFs in 2022, subject to fund board approval, to expand its active ETF offerings. This move involves approximately $10 billion in assets and aims to provide clients with active investment options in an ETF structure offering benefits like intraday liquidity, transparency, and potential tax advantages. Additionally, the firm is proposing to combine the mutual fund and ETF boards to create a common board to govern the entire J.P. Morgan Fund complex.

title: Wells Fargo names Steven Black chairman as Charles Noski steps down
summary: Wells Fargo announced that Charles Noski has stepped down as chairman and named Steven Black, a board member and former JPMorgan Chase & Co. Vice Chairman, as his successor, effective immediately. Noski, who served as chairman for over a year and a director for more than two years, will remain on the board until his retirement on September 30 to facilitate the transition. Black brings over 45 years of financial-services experience to the role and has prior connections with Wells Fargo CEO Charlie Scharf.

title: Wells Fargo names Steve Black chairman
summary: Wells Fargo & Co. announced that Charles Noski has stepped down as chairman and Steven Black has been appointed as his replacement, effective immediately. Noski, who became chairman in March 2020, will remain on the board until his retirement on September 30 to facilitate the transition. Black brings over 45 years of financial-services experience and previously served as co-chief executive officer of Bregal Investments.

title: One Equity Partners Exits Merfish United
summary: One Equity Partners (OEP) has agreed to sell Merfish United, a master distributor of tubular building products, to Reliance Steel & Aluminum. OEP acquired Merfish Pipe & Supply and Pipe Exchange in 2012, building it into one of the largest master distributors of steel pipe and tube products in the United States through strategic add-on acquisitions and organic growth. Merfish United generated approximately $500 million in net sales for the twelve months through June 30, 2021, and the sale is expected to close within 60 days.

title: Best Funds to invest in the MENA region
summary: This article analyzes three top-performing investment funds in the MENA region from JP Morgan, Fiera Capital, and Franklin Templeton, based on Morningstar's 5-year annualized total returns as of July 2021. It delves into their investment strategies, regional market insights, and performance, highlighting the MENA region's opportunities due to its vast oil/gas reserves, ongoing reforms, and growing consumer base. Each fund manager provides an overview of their approach and market outlook for the region.

title: Wells Fargo Names Steve Black Chairman as Noski Steps Down
summary: Wells Fargo & Co. announced that Charles Noski is stepping down as chairman and will be replaced by board member Steven Black, effective immediately. Noski will remain on the board until his retirement on September 30 to help with the transition. Black brings over 45 years of financial-services experience to the role.

title: JPM AM ups risk bet limits for $5.5bn global corporate bond fund
summary: JP Morgan Asset Management has increased the investment limits for sub-investment-grade debt and contingent convertible debt (CoCos) in its $5.5bn Global Corporate Bond fund. This expansion allows the fund, overseen by Lisa Coleman's team, to hold up to 20% in sub-investment-grade debt and 10% in CoCos, reflecting the growth and maturity of these markets.

title: Petrobras says hires JPMorgan as adviser to sell Braskem stake
summary: Brazilian state-run oil firm Petrobras has hired JPMorgan Chase & Co as an adviser for the sale of its stake in the petrochemical company Braskem SA. This move follows an earlier Reuters report and an announcement by Petrobras executives during an investor conference call. The decision comes amidst Novonor's efforts to sell its controlling stake in Braskem, with Petrobras favoring a sale through a share offering, while Novonor seeks a premium through an acquisition.

title: Fed lifts restrictions on JPMorgan imposed after forex manipulation
summary: The Federal Reserve has lifted a 2015 enforcement action against JPMorgan Chase & Co, which was imposed after the bank admitted to attempting to manipulate the foreign exchange market. The cease and desist order was part of a larger forex rigging probe impacting several global banks, and JPMorgan had to demonstrate improved internal controls. The bank attributed the misconduct to a single fired trader.

title: Bank of America Corp. stock outperforms market on strong trading day
summary: Bank of America Corp. (BAC) stock rose 1.96% on Thursday, outperforming the broader market indexes like the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average. The stock closed below its 52-week high but showed mixed performance compared to competitors like JPMorgan Chase, Citigroup, and Wells Fargo, which also saw gains. Trading volume for Bank of America was below its 50-day average.

title: Opinion | If You Paid Your Debt to Society, You Should Be Allowed to Work (Published 2021)
summary: Jamie Dimon, chairman and CEO of JPMorgan Chase, argues that individuals who have paid their debt to society should be allowed to work, highlighting that nearly half of formerly incarcerated people are unemployed one year after leaving prison. He advocates for removing financial, legal, and logistical barriers that prevent re-entry into the workforce and shares JPMorgan Chase's efforts, including banning the "box" on job applications and establishing a Second Chance hiring program. Dimon also mentions the formation of the Second Chance Business Coalition with other major companies to promote best practices in hiring people with criminal backgrounds.

title: Stock Yards to Acquire Commonwealth Bank & Trust
summary: Stock Yards Bank & Trust has entered into a definitive agreement to acquire Commonwealth Bank & Trust in a combined stock and cash transaction valued at approximately $153 million. Both financial institutions are based in Louisville with locations in Northern Kentucky, and the acquisition aims to expand services and locations for customers. The deal is expected to close in the fourth quarter of 2021, subject to regulatory approval, and will result in combined assets of approximately $7.4 billion.

title: HollyFrontier and Holly Energy Partners Add Sinclair Dinosaur for $1.8B
summary: Dallas-based HollyFrontier Corporation and Holly Energy Partners announced an agreement to acquire and combine with Sinclair Oil from the Sinclair Corporation in a deal valued at $1.8 billion. The newly formed company will be called HF Sinclair Corporation, headquartered in Dallas, and will replace HollyFrontier in public trading on the NYSE. The acquisition includes Sinclair's market branding, commercial activities, renewable diesel business, and two Rocky Mountain area refineries, consistent with the company's growth strategy.

title: Open-banking: Real-time analytics for small and medium-sized enterprises
summary: This article discusses how Open Banking initiatives can provide real-time analytics for Small and Medium-sized Enterprises (SMEs), addressing their challenges in accessing external financing due to information asymmetry. Moody's, in collaboration with Credit Data Research and CRIF, has developed a solution to process Open Banking data, construct real-time financial statements, and generate up-to-date financial metrics for improved credit assessment and financial planning. The solution aims to enhance the efficiency of credit origination and monitoring for lenders and empower business owners with better insights into their finances.

title: JPMorgan Chase CEO to visit Sioux Falls
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. chairman and CEO Jamie Dimon is visiting Sioux Falls to open the first Chase Bank branch in the state. This visit is part of his annual listening tour, and the new branch will be located at Empire Place with additional locations under construction. The branch will offer various banking services and employ 10 people.

title: A breakdown of US value ETFs
summary: This article analyzes five US value ETFs, highlighting that only three of them outperformed Vanguard's S&P 500 ETF despite 2021 being anticipated as a strong year for value factor resurgence. It details the methodologies, holdings, and performance of each ETF (iShares Edge MSCI USA Value Factor UCITS ETF, Ossiam Shiller Barclays Cape US Sector Value UCITS ETF, UBS ETF Factor MSCI USA Value UCITS ETF, UBS ETF Factor MSCI USA Prime Value UCITS ETF, and SPDR MSCI USA Value Weighted UCITS ETF) and discusses the importance of index design and Total Expense Ratios (TERs) in their relative performance.

title: Looking To Play In The Indian Stock Market? Here's How You can Do It From The USA
summary: This article provides a comprehensive guide for US residents interested in investing in the Indian stock market. It outlines various investment avenues including India-focused mutual funds, ETFs, ETNs, and ADRs/GDRs, as well as direct investment through international or SEBI-registered Indian brokerage firms. The article also details the taxation on Indian stock investments and explains schemes like PIS for NRIs and FIIs, along with popular trading platforms.

title: RxSight, Inc. Announces Pricing of Initial Public Offering
