summary: RxSight, Inc. announced the pricing of its initial public offering of 7,350,000 shares of common stock at $16.00 per share, expecting to raise $117.6 million. The company's common stock is anticipated to begin trading on the Nasdaq Global Market under the ticker symbol "RXST" on July 30, 2021. J.P. Morgan Securities LLC and BofA Securities, Inc. are serving as joint book-running managers for the offering.

title: JPMorgan Chase hires new head of business banking from Hiscox
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co (JPM.N) has appointed Ben Walter as the new head of business banking for its consumer & community banking division. Walter, previously the global retail CEO at Hiscox Ltd (HSX.L), will join the bank in New York in October, replacing Jennifer Roberts.

title: Milken-led Private REIT Nabs $642M Loan on KinderCare Portfolio
summary: NRT, a private REIT with ties to Michael Milken, secured a $641.8 million CMBS loan from Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase for a portfolio of 549 KinderCare Learning Centers. The two-year, floating-rate loan is secured by centers across 37 states, operated under a master lease by KinderCare. The portfolio, though impacted by COVID-19, has seen significant recovery in occupancy and revenue, bolstered by government relief programs.

title: Sérgio Rial to take over as chairman of Santander Brazil’s board of directors as of January 2022
summary: Sérgio Rial, CEO of Santander Brazil and regional head of South America for the Santander Group, will become chairman of Santander Brazil’s board of directors starting January 1, 2022. Mario Roberto Opice Leão will succeed Rial as CEO of Santander Brazil, and Carlos Rey de Vicente will become the regional head of South America for Santander Group. These leadership changes aim to continue the bank's successful growth strategy and foster a strong, diverse management team.

title: Goldman Sachs boosts transaction banking biz with Fiserv tie-up
summary: Goldman Sachs is expanding its transaction banking business by partnering with Fiserv to offer services to Fiserv's clients, starting with cross-border supplier payments. This collaboration will allow Fiserv clients to use Goldman Sachs' cloud-based payment suite for domestic and foreign currency payments, managing FX and delivery for suppliers in over 125 currencies. The partnership aims to bring automation, efficiency, and cost savings to accounts payable for businesses with a global presence.

title: Clarios IPO
summary: Clarios, a global leader in automotive battery production and a subsidiary of Brookfield Asset Management, is listing on the NYSE under the ticker BTRY with a predicted market value of $11 billion. The company aims to raise $1.7 billion from its IPO, offering 88.1 million shares at $17 to $21, to pay down its debts. Clarios, which produces roughly one-third of the automotive industry’s battery technologies, makes money through sales of SLI, EFB, AGM, and lithium-ion batteries, primarily via its aftermarket channel, and plans to invest in advanced battery technology and expand its market share in China.

title: Candel Therapeutics Announces Pricing of Initial Public Offering
summary: Candel Therapeutics announced the pricing of its initial public offering of 9,000,000 shares of common stock at $8.00 per share, expecting to raise $72 million. The shares are set to begin trading on Nasdaq under "CADL" on July 27, 2021, with the offering closing on July 29, 2021. The company has also granted underwriters a 30-day option to purchase an additional 1,350,000 shares.

title: Core & Main Announces Launch of Initial Public Offering
summary: Core & Main, Inc. has announced the pricing of its initial public offering of 34,883,721 shares of Class A common stock at $20.00 per share. The shares are expected to begin trading on the New York Stock Exchange under "CNM" on July 23, 2021, with the offering closing on July 27, 2021. Goldman Sachs & Co. LLC, Credit Suisse, and J.P. Morgan are acting as lead book-running managers for the offering.

title: Another group of U.S.-listed China stocks plunge as Beijing regulators crack down
summary: U.S.-listed Chinese education stocks TAL Education and New Oriental Education and Technology plummeted after reports of a new government crackdown on the sector. The new regulations reportedly ban educational training institutions from raising money through stock listings and foreign capital from investing, impacting companies that utilize Variable Interest Entities (VIEs) to list in the U.S. This government action is part of increased scrutiny on the private education industry and Chinese companies listing overseas.

title: Carla Hassan Is JPMorgan Chase's New CMO
summary: Carla Hassan has been appointed as the new Chief Marketing Officer at JPMorgan Chase, succeeding Leslie Gillin. Hassan joins the banking giant from Citi, where she served as global CMO, a position she held since September 2020. Her previous work at Citi focused on promoting pay equity, diversity and inclusion, and other purpose-driven initiatives.

title: Goldman spinoff Simon Markets raises $100 million in latest funding round
summary: Simon Markets, a financial technology platform spun out of Goldman Sachs, has raised $100 million in a funding round led by WestCap, pushing its valuation past $800 million. This capital will allow the New York-based firm to expand into alternative investments like private equity and hedge funds, as well as digital assets, and potentially grow into Europe and Asia. The company's platform provides wealth managers access to structured investments and has seen tripling volumes to $25 billion in 2020.

title: SOPHiA GENETICS Announces Pricing of Initial Public Offering
summary: SOPHiA GENETICS SA announced the pricing of its initial public offering of 13,000,000 ordinary shares at $18 per share, expecting to raise approximately $234 million. The shares are anticipated to begin trading on the Nasdaq Global Select Market under the symbol "SOPH" on July 23, 2021. J.P. Morgan, Morgan Stanley, Cowen, and Credit Suisse are acting as joint book-running managers for the offering.

title: Altice's adtech firm Teads targets $5 bln valuation in U.S. IPO
summary: Advertising technology company Teads BV, owned by French telecom company Altice, aims to raise up to $808.5 million in a U.S. IPO on Nasdaq, targeting a valuation of about $5 billion. Existing shareholders plan to sell 38.5 million shares at $18 to $21 each, with Altice retaining majority voting rights. Teads reported a profit of $111.5 million on revenue of $540.3 million in 2020.

title: 10-Year Yield Collapse Lifts Bond ETFs
summary: The 10-year Treasury bond yield experienced an unexpected collapse to a five-month low, confounding predictions of continued increases and approaching 2%. This drop has significantly benefited bond ETFs, nearly erasing year-to-date losses for funds like IEF and TLT. Analysts attribute the decline to a resurgence of COVID-19 cases and the market's belief in transitory inflation, despite strong economic readings.

title: Steel Dynamics, inc (STLD) Q2 2021 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Steel Dynamics Inc. (STLD) reported record Q2 2021 financial results, with Mark Millett highlighting record sales, operating income, cash flow, and adjusted EBITDA. The company saw strong demand across all sectors, particularly in flat-rolled steel and fabrication, and provided updates on the Sinton, Texas mill construction and future growth strategies. Management expressed a bullish outlook for the market, emphasizing the company's strong financial position and continued investment in sustainable operations.

title: Robinhood targets July 29 debut as a public company
summary: Robinhood is reportedly targeting July 29 for its initial public offering (IPO) on the Nasdaq Stock Market, aiming to raise up to $2.3 billion and achieve a valuation of $35 billion. This comes amidst a booming market and despite the company facing legal and public relations challenges, including a record fine from a Wall Street regulator and renewed scrutiny over its payment for order flow model. The IPO access program lists the July 29th date as expected.

title: BlackRock cross-lists physical gold ETC on Xetra
summary: BlackRock has cross-listed its $13.5 billion iShares Physical Gold ETC on Xetra in Germany, making it available in euros. Previously, it was only listed on the London Stock Exchange in US dollars, pound sterling, and euros. The ETC boasts an expense ratio of 0.15%, making it one of Europe's cheapest options for physically backed gold exposure.

title: HeartFlow Is Going Public via a SPAC Merger, Key Details Revealed
summary: HeartFlow, a company specializing in a non-invasive cardiac test, is set to go public through a SPAC merger with Longview Acquisition Corp. II. The merger is expected to value HeartFlow at $2.4 billion and will result in the company trading on the NYSE under the symbol "HFLO" during the fourth quarter of 2021. This move aims to fund growth and allow existing shareholders to repurchase equity.

title: ETF of the Week: JPMorgan Equity Premium Income ETF (JEPI)
summary: The article discusses the JPMorgan Equity Premium Income ETF (JEPI), an actively managed fund that generates income by selling options on U.S. large-cap stocks. It highlights JEPI's unique ability to provide consistent monthly income in a low-yield environment with less volatility than the broader market. The ETF is presented as a suitable option for income investors seeking diversification and a hedge-fund-like strategy.

title: Dow drops nearly 300 points on Friday, snaps 3-week winning streak
summary: U.S. stocks, including the Dow, S&P 500, and Nasdaq Composite, fell on Friday, snapping three-week winning streaks, as inflation fears overshadowed strong retail sales and earnings. The Dow lost 299.17 points, or 0.86%, closing at 34,687.85 and ending the week down 0.52%. Consumer sentiment declined in early July, with inflation expectations rising to levels not seen since August 2008, contributing to the market sell-off.

title: Morgan Stanley beats estimates as record deal-making cushions trading blow
authors: Sohini Podder and Elizabeth Dilts Marshall
summary: Morgan Stanley exceeded quarterly profit estimates due to a surge in investment banking activity, which offset a slowdown in trading revenue. The bank's profit rose 12% to $3.4 billion, or $1.85 per share, driven by record deal-making totaling over $2.82 trillion globally in the first half of the year. Despite a significant drop in fixed-income trading, investment banking revenue increased by 16%, and executives expressed optimism for continued growth.

title: Core & Main Has Filed to Go Public, IPO Date and Price Explained
summary: Core & Main, a company specializing in fire protection and water infrastructure products, has filed initial documents with the SEC to go public under the symbol CNM. The IPO is expected to offer nearly 34.9 million shares at a price range of $20–$23 apiece, aiming for a valuation of up to $7.5 billion and potentially raising $802.3 million. Investment funds of private equity firm Clayton, Dubilier & Rice (CD&R) currently own Core & Main and will control about 79.6 percent of the company after the IPO is completed.

title: Bank of America reports a big profit, and Citi and Wells Fargo beat expectations. (Published 2021)
summary: Bank of America reported a significant profit increase in the second quarter of 2021, more than doubling its earnings from the previous year, partly due to releasing funds set aside for loan losses. Citigroup and Wells Fargo also surpassed analysts' expectations, benefiting from consumers' increased spending and a recovering economy. Despite these strong earnings, Bank of America's revenue dropped, and its stock price fell as investors questioned the sustainability of loan growth amidst a potentially slowing economic rebound.

title: Rapid Micro Biosystems Announces Pricing of Initial Public Offering
summary: Rapid Micro Biosystems, a life sciences technology company, has announced the pricing of its initial public offering of 7,920,000 shares of Class A common stock at $20.00 per share, aiming to raise $158.4 million. The company's Class A common stock is expected to begin trading on the Nasdaq Global Select Market under the ticker symbol "RPID" on July 15, 2021. J.P. Morgan Securities LLC, Morgan Stanley & Co. LLC, Cowen and Company, LLC, and Stifel, Nicolaus & Company, Incorporated are acting as joint book-running managers for the offering.

title: Japan's SMFG to buy nearly 5% of Jefferies for $386 million
summary: Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group Inc (SMFG) plans to acquire nearly 5% of Jefferies Financial Group Inc shares for $386 million to bolster its U.S. presence. The two companies will also form a partnership for cross-border M&A opportunities involving Japanese firms, and SMFG will provide substantial credit facilities to support Jefferies' lending. This move is part of SMFG's broader international expansion strategy, driven by limited growth opportunities in Japan.

title: Heart Aerospace one step closer to building electric plane, with possible sales to United Airlines, Mesa Air Group
summary: Heart Aerospace, a company developing a 19-seater electric aircraft (ES-19), has secured a $35 million Series A investment round led by Breakthrough Energy Ventures, United Airlines Ventures, and Mesa Air Group Inc. As part of the agreement, United and Mesa have placed purchase orders for 200 ES-19 aircraft, with options for an additional 100, aiming to electrify short-haul air travel and reduce carbon emissions. This partnership aims to revitalize regional air travel options that are currently uneconomical with traditional aircraft.

title: Eduardo Elsztain: el «señor de los ladrillos» que también decidió apostar por la minería
summary: The article details how Eduardo Elsztain, renowned for his real estate ventures in Argentina, has significantly expanded his investments into the mining sector through Austral Gold. It highlights his philosophy of accumulating assets, his strategic acquisitions in gold and silver projects across Latin America and the US, and his long-term vision for mining despite initial challenges. The piece also delves into the history of his real estate empire and his family's business acumen, providing context for his diversification into new markets.

title: Ford drops use of 'chairman' title, adopts other gender-neutral language
summary: Ford Motor Company has officially replaced the title "chairman" with "chair" and adopted other gender-neutral language in its bylaws, effective July 8. General Motors also made a similar change in May, adjusting Mary Barra's title from chairman and CEO to chair and CEO. This move reflects a broader trend among major corporations and institutions to promote inclusivity and adapt to changing societal norms.

title: Wells Fargo Names Bei Ling as Head of Human Resources
summary: Wells Fargo & Company announced the appointment of Bei Ling as its new Head of Human Resources, effective October 1. Ling, formerly of JPMorgan Chase, will report to CEO Charlie Scharf and serve on the company’s Operating Committee, overseeing all aspects of Wells Fargo’s human capital strategy. She brings extensive experience in talent development, compensation, and DEI initiatives from her previous roles.

title: Morgan Stanley discloses data breach of its StockPlan Connect business
summary: Morgan Stanley announced a data breach affecting its StockPlan Connect business after a vendor, Guidehouse, experienced a security incident. The breach, which occurred in January but was discovered in May, compromised clients' personal data including names, addresses, dates of birth, Social Security numbers, and corporate company names. Morgan Stanley is offering 24 months of free credit monitoring to impacted individuals.

title: Known for home lending dominance, Rocket Cos. looks to autos to help fuel growth
summary: Rocket Companies Inc., traditionally dominant in mortgage lending, is expanding into the auto business with its Rocket Auto segment to drive growth. Leveraging its technology platform, Rocket Auto aims to streamline the car shopping experience, connecting consumers with dealers and financing options. This move is part of Rocket's broader strategy to expand its reach into automotive sales and financial services, building on its success in the first quarter with 13,600 vehicle sales and $360 million in gross merchandise value.

title: Authentic Brands Group Files For IPO
summary: Authentic Brands Group (ABG), owner of numerous fashion and sports brands, has filed for an initial public offering (IPO). The company plans to sell $100 million worth of stock, though this is a placeholder amount. ABG generates over $14 billion in annual retail sales and reported net income of $225 million in 2020.

title: MOVES Credit Suisse poaches Morgan Stanley banker for global industrials group -memo
summary: Credit Suisse has hired Kyle Berry from Morgan Stanley as a managing director in its global industrials group, a move aimed at revamping its investment banking team after recent departures and scandals. Berry will focus on business services across Europe, the Middle East, and Africa, reporting to Gregory Dalle and Pierre Lescastereyres in London. This appointment follows a period of talent outflow for Credit Suisse after the Greensill Capital and Archegos Capital Management scandals.

title: Wells Fargo: Out of the Penalty Box and Back Into the Business of Credit Cards
summary: Wells Fargo is re-entering the consumer credit card market after its past scandal, with new offerings like the Wells Fargo Active Cash Card. Under CEO Charles Scharf, who has a strong background in payments, the company aims to leverage its extensive branch network to become a top credit card issuer. This move is expected to intensify competition and lead to new credit card products across the industry.

title: Xometry Announces Closing of Initial Public Offering
summary: Xometry, Inc., a leading AI-enabled marketplace for on-demand manufacturing, announced the closing of its initial public offering. The offering included 7,906,250 shares of Class A common stock at $44.00 per share, with stock listed on the Nasdaq Global Select Market under the symbol "XMTR." Goldman Sachs & Co. LLC, J.P. Morgan, and UBS Investment Bank acted as joint lead book-running managers for the offering.

title: PRWeek Pride in PR: Joe Evangelisti
summary: Joe Evangelisti, Managing Director of Communications at JPMorgan Chase & Co., discusses the importance of LGBTQ+ representation in senior PR roles and offers advice to young LGBTQ+ professionals. He reflects on his career journey, including his experience being closeted early on, and highlights the relatively friendly nature of the PR industry towards the LGBTQ+ community, while also emphasizing the ongoing fight against discrimination. Evangelisti shares his personal experiences and insights on workplace diversity and inclusion.

title: Intapp Announces Pricing of Initial Public Offering
summary: Intapp, Inc. announced the pricing of its initial public offering of 10,500,000 shares of common stock at $26.00 per share. The shares are expected to begin trading on the Nasdaq Global Select Market under the symbol “INTA” on June 30, 2021. The offering is handled by J.P. Morgan, BofA Securities, and Credit Suisse Securities (USA) LLC as lead book-running managers.

title: JPMorgan makes Brazilian retail banking debut with 40% stake in C6 Bank
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co has acquired a 40% stake in Brazilian digital bank C6 Bank, marking its entry into retail banking in Latin America's largest economy. This move follows other global banks' departures from Brazilian retail but capitalizes on the growth of digital banking and recent regulatory reforms. C6 Bank plans to use the investment to launch new credit lines and projects reaching 10 million clients by year-end, despite anticipated losses this year due to its growth focus.

title: CLEAR Secure, Inc. Announces Pricing of Initial Public Offering
summary: CLEAR Secure, Inc. announced the pricing of its initial public offering of 13,200,000 shares of Class A common stock at $31.00 per share. The company expects gross proceeds of approximately $409.2 million and the shares are anticipated to trade on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol "YOU" starting June 30, 2021. The offering is expected to close on July 2, 2021, with Goldman Sachs & Co. LLC and J.P. Morgan Securities LLC among the lead book-runners.

title: JPMorgan is buying an ESG investing platform in bank’s third fintech acquisition of the past year
summary: JPMorgan Chase has announced its acquisition of OpenInvest, a San Francisco-based fintech startup specializing in ESG (environmental, social, and governance) investing platforms. This marks JPMorgan's third fintech acquisition in the past year, aligning with CEO Jamie Dimon's strategy to aggressively pursue takeovers to enhance capabilities amid growing competition. OpenInvest allows clients to create highly personalized, values-based investment portfolios, a capability JPMorgan aims to integrate into its wealth management division.

title: Bank Bucks U.S. Peers, Saying No One Should Return 5 Days a Week
summary: Synchrony Financial (SYF), a major credit card issuer, is embracing a flexible remote work model, opting against a full five-day in-office return for its employees, unlike many of its U.S. banking peers. The company has begun testing its reopening plan with a limited number of employees but is largely committed to remote work and reducing office space. This decision contrasts with banks like Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase, which are pushing for a broader return to the office.

title: Argentina loses emerging market status on FX controls
summary: Argentina has been downgraded from emerging market to "standalone" status by index provider MSCI Inc due to its ongoing capital controls, a decision that will take effect in November 2021. This downgrade is expected to lead to almost US$610 million pulling out of the remaining Argentine companies in the MSCI index, with no mitigating inflows. The country's struggles with capital controls and foreign debt markets, despite recent agricultural commodity price boosts, continue to impact its investment outlook.

title: TD Bank to Launch Low-Cost Deposit Account, Expanding Account Offerings in Support of Unbanked Households
summary: TD Bank announced the upcoming launch of TD Essential Banking, a low-cost, no-overdraft-fee deposit account designed to serve unbanked and underbanked households. This initiative is part of broader efforts to expand product offerings, including changes to overdraft policies and consumer lending, and to enhance financial education tools. The goal is to provide more accessible and affordable financial services to underserved communities.

title: Morgan Stanley’s New York office bans unvaccinated staff and clients
authors: Paul R. La Monica and Rob McLean
summary: Morgan Stanley announced a ban on unvaccinated staff and clients from its New York headquarters, effective July 1 for employees in buildings with a large presence. This decision aligns with CEO James Gorman's push for workers to return to the office, following similar moves by other Wall Street firms like Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase. The company aims to restore normal office conditions by operating in a fully vaccinated environment.

title: CLEAR Secure, Inc. Announces Launch of Initial Public Offering
summary: CLEAR Secure, Inc. announced the launch of its initial public offering of 13,200,000 shares of its Class A common stock, with an expected price range of $27.00 to $30.00 per share. The company also expects to grant underwriters an option to purchase additional shares. The shares are anticipated to trade on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol "YOU," with proceeds intended for Alclear Holdings, LLC for offering expenses and general corporate purposes.

title: Morgan Stanley says no vaccine, no entry. (Published 2021)
summary: Morgan Stanley announced that starting July 12, employees, clients, and visitors must attest to being fully vaccinated against the coronavirus to enter its New York City and Westchester County buildings. Unvaccinated staff will be required to work remotely. This policy aims to allow the bank to relax other pandemic protocols like mask-wearing and social distancing, aligning with moves by other major financial institutions.

title: Blackstone Bets $6 Billion on Buying and Renting Homes - WSJ
summary: Blackstone Group Inc. is acquiring Home Partners of America Inc., a company that buys and rents single-family homes, in a $6 billion deal. This acquisition signals Wall Street's belief that the U.S. housing market will remain robust. Home Partners of America owns over 17,000 houses and offers tenants the option to eventually purchase the homes they rent.

title: Confluent’s IPO: The Details You Need To Know
summary: Confluent, a "data in motion" software developer, is preparing for its highly anticipated IPO, with shares potentially trading as early as June 24. The company has filed S-1 documents detailing its financial performance, ownership, and go-to-market strategies, including offering 23 million shares of Class A Common Stock under the symbol "CFLT" on NASDAQ. The article provides an in-depth look at Confluent's business, financial statistics, market opportunity, customer base, competition, IPO plans, and key stakeholders.

title: Talkspace, a Leading Virtual Behavioral Healthcare Company, Completes Merger with Hudson Executive Investment Corp. and Will Begin Trading on Nasdaq Under the Symbol "TALK"
summary: Talkspace, a virtual behavioral healthcare company, has completed its merger with Hudson Executive Investment Corp. and will begin trading on Nasdaq under the symbol "TALK" on June 23, 2021. The transaction provides Talkspace with $250 million in growth capital, positioning it as the only publicly traded pure-play virtual behavioral health company. Co-founders Roni and Oren Frank will continue to lead the company, with Douglas Braunstein serving as Chairman of the Board.

title: House Dems call on JPMorgan Chase to refund pandemic-era overdraft fees
summary: A group of House Democrats from New York has urged JPMorgan Chase to refund overdraft fees collected during the COVID-19 pandemic and to stop charging them in the future, citing that the bank collected nearly $1.5 billion in such fees in 2020. The lawmakers emphasized the disproportionate harm these fees cause to low-income and minority communities. JPMorgan Chase responded, stating they waived over $650 million in fees, including $430 million in overdraft fees, for affected customers and have made improvements to their overdraft policies.

title: Reducing noise and bias in investing
summary: This article examines how broad-based ETFs can effectively reduce noise and bias in investing, drawing insights from the book "Noise: A Flaw in Human Judgment." It highlights that mechanical predictions are superior to human ones and that aggregating forecasts reduces noise. The author argues that diversified ETFs represent the aggregate forecasts of millions of market participants, offering a simple way to benefit from collective wisdom.

title: BrightSphere Investment Group Inc. Announces Agreement to Sell Campbell Global, LLC
summary: BrightSphere Investment Group Inc. announced an agreement to sell its 75% ownership in Campbell Global, LLC to J.P. Morgan Asset Management, with J.P. Morgan also acquiring the remaining 25% from Campbell management. This transaction will transform BrightSphere into a single, full-scale differentiated business focused solely on Acadian Asset Management, a market leader in the quantitative sector. The sale is expected to close in the third quarter of 2021 and will result in BrightSphere having approximately $1.3 billion in pro forma cash.

title: Bank of America makes Juneteenth a holiday, joining JPMorgan, Wells Fargo
summary: Bank of America, JPMorgan Chase, and Wells Fargo will recognize Juneteenth as a paid holiday, joining other financial institutions in response to President Biden signing it into law. While these banks will offer floating holidays this year and add it to regular schedules next year, financial markets like the NYSE and Nasdaq are still determining whether to close. This move reflects a broader industry response to racial inequality following the murder of George Floyd.

title: Goldman Sachs welcomes bankers back to the office with live music, food trucks
summary: Goldman Sachs welcomed bankers back to its New York offices with live music, food trucks, and free fitness classes to ease their return after CEO David Solomon's strong push against remote work. Other Wall Street firms like Barclays, JPMorgan, and Morgan Stanley are also planning their returns, with varying approaches to office mandates and COVID-19 restrictions. Morgan Stanley's James Gorman notably warned employees to return by Labor Day or face pay cuts, emphasizing the importance of in-office presence.

title: Bank of America Makes Juneteenth a Holiday, Joining JPMorgan, Wells Fargo
summary: Bank of America and JPMorgan Chase are making Juneteenth a company holiday starting next year, following President Joe Biden's signing of the federal holiday into law. Employees will receive a floating paid day off this year as June 19 falls on a Saturday. Wells Fargo is also observing Juneteenth as a federal holiday starting in 2022.

title: Singapore emerges as new financial hub for S.Korean banks
summary: South Korea's major banks are increasingly establishing a presence in Singapore, which is emerging as a new financial hub in Southeast Asia, replacing Hong Kong. Hana Financial Group and KB Kookmin Bank have secured preliminary approvals for operations there, with DGB Financial Group and Woori Bank also expanding their Singapore-based activities. This shift is driven by Singapore's growing financial influence in Asia, its convenient time zones, and the Southeast Asian market's greater growth potential compared to South Korea's saturated banking sector.

title: JPMorgan Chase acquires digital wealth manager Nutmeg
summary: JPMorgan Chase has acquired digital wealth manager Nutmeg for an undisclosed amount, ahead of the launch of its digital bank, Chase, in the UK later this year. Nutmeg, which manages model portfolios primarily invested in ETFs and previously partnered with JP Morgan Asset Management, currently boasts 140,000 investors and £3.5bn in assets under management. This acquisition aligns with JPMorgan Chase's strategy to build its digital bank using the latest technology and a customer-centric approach.

title: JPMorgan Chase to buy Nutmeg to help spearhead UK invasion
summary: JPMorgan Chase has agreed to acquire Nutmeg Saving and Investment Limited, pending regulatory approval, to bolster its planned digital bank launch in the UK. Nutmeg, a leading digital wealth manager, brings over 140,000 investors and £3.5bn in assets, with its products set to complement Chase's offerings. This acquisition is seen as a key move for JPMorgan Chase to expand its retail wealth management internationally and enhance its UK digital banking presence.

title: Exclusive: On heels of massive Oracle deal, River North developer now selling prime neighboring sites
summary: Monroe Investment Partners, after selling 65 acres to Oracle for $253.7 million, is now marketing two additional development sites in Oracle's forthcoming tech campus in River North, Nashville. These prime sites are located near the Topgolf entertainment venue and another mixed-use development. The move signals the company's continued belief in the Nashville market and its intention to pursue further investments.

title: Capital One launches early access to direct deposit
summary: Capital One is now offering early direct deposit to eligible account holders, allowing customers to access their paychecks up to two days sooner. This move mirrors offerings common among neobanks like Chime, Current, and Varo Bank, and makes Capital One one of the first large traditional banks alongside Fifth Third to provide such a feature. The initiative also comes as many traditional institutions are reassessing overdraft fees, with several banks introducing products to help customers avoid them.

title: Fidelity Launches Five ESG Mutual Funds and ETFs Focused on Environment, Climate Change, Gender Diversity & Sustainability
summary: Fidelity Investments is expanding its sustainable investing lineup with five new actively managed Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) funds, bringing its total ESG offerings to 11. These new funds and ETFs, available June 17, 2021, focus on climate action, environmental bonds, U.S. equity sustainability, and women's leadership. Fidelity aims to align investors' values with their financial goals and will continue to expand its sustainable investing solutions and educational resources.

title: Morgan Stanley, Bank of America CEOs break relative silence on office returns
summary: CEOs of Morgan Stanley and Bank of America have signaled a strong desire for employees to return to the office, setting Labor Day as a benchmark for this transition. James Gorman of Morgan Stanley and Brian Moynihan of Bank of America emphasized the importance of in-person work for culture, learning, and client interaction, while also addressing vaccination status and compensation expectations. Their push aligns with other major bank CEOs who have expressed increasing impatience with remote work arrangements.

title: Pandemic Offers Opportunity for Private Investors in Skilled Nursing
summary: Private investors are showing increased interest in skilled nursing (SNF) assets due to less competition from the public sector and opportunistic distressed sales during the pandemic. Public REITs are focusing on internal restructuring, leaving a vacuum that private equity is filling, leading to higher valuations for SNF transactions. This trend presents both opportunities for capital infusion in SNFs and potential challenges related to maximizing profits and staffing.

title: AmEx to allow staff to work from home two days a week
summary: American Express Co. is implementing a hybrid work model allowing most U.S. and U.K. employees to work from home up to two days a week, primarily on Mondays and Fridays, starting October. This approach contrasts with some major Wall Street banks pushing for a full return to office. The company will begin phased returns to the office on September 13, with the final model depending on local conditions, while employees who worked fully remotely before the pandemic can continue to do so.

title: Morgan Stanley chief to bankers: If you want NYC salary, you need to be in NYC
summary: Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman has issued a strict directive for staff to return to the office by Labor Day, warning of potential pay cuts for those who fail to comply. He emphasized that employees who want New York City salaries must work in New York and criticized those seeking to work remotely from other locations while expecting NYC rates. This stance contrasts with some competitors, highlighting varying approaches among major financial institutions regarding post-pandemic work arrangements.

title: Morgan Stanley boss tells US staff to be back in office in September
summary: James Gorman, the CEO of Morgan Stanley, has issued a "very strong" message for US staff to return to the office by Labor Day, September 6th, citing high vaccination rates in New York and the importance of in-office collaboration for careers. He contrasted this approach with other regions like India or the UK due to different Covid restrictions, and also implied that New York-level pay is tied to working in New York. This stance mirrors similar calls from other US banking chiefs, while some European banks are offering more flexible arrangements.

title: Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman On His Return-To-Work Plan: ‘If You Can Go To A Restaurant In New York City, You Can Come Into The Office’
summary: Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman has stated his firm stance on returning to the office, asserting that if employees can go to a restaurant in New York City, they can come into the office. This view aligns with other Wall Street bank CEOs like JPMorgan's Jamie Dimon and Goldman Sachs' David Solomon, who are pushing for a return to in-person work, especially for junior staff and to preserve company culture. In contrast, many tech companies are adopting more flexible hybrid work models.

title: Morgan Stanley CEO to staff: Be back at New York headquarters by September
summary: Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman has stated that he expects most employees to return to the bank's Manhattan headquarters by September, indicating disappointment if they do not. This move follows similar actions by other Wall Street banks, although Morgan Stanley's policy will vary by location, with employees in India not returning to offices this year. Gorman also touched on strong Q2 revenues, potential wealth management acquisitions, and the bank's internal review after the Archegos Capital Management meltdown.

title: South Africa
summary: Barclays Private Bank has established an office in Johannesburg, South Africa, to provide offshore private, investment, and corporate banking expertise to South African clients. They leverage their global strength to help ultra-high net-worth individuals, their families, and family offices achieve financial ambitions, offering personalized service, wealth management strategies, and a wide choice of banking, investment, and advisory services. Potential clients are required to establish an investment portfolio of at least £5 million (or local currency equivalent).

title: California bank is shutting 2 of its 5 branches in SLO County
summary: Bank of the Sierra is closing two of its five branches in San Luis Obispo County (Arroyo Grande and Atascadero) on June 18, which is part of a larger plan by Sierra Bancorp to close five branches outside its primary market area. This decision is attributed to changes in customer behavior due to the COVID-19 pandemic and an efficiency review. The closures reflect a national trend of banks shutting down brick-and-mortar locations, with a record net loss of 2,284 branches in 2020.

title: Aetna, Anthem and Cleveland Clinic back blockchain venture to improve healthcare efficiency
summary: Aetna, Anthem, and Cleveland Clinic, along with other major players, are backing Avaneer Health, a new venture leveraging blockchain technology to enhance efficiency and transparency in healthcare. Led by JPMorgan Chase executive Stuart Hanson, Avaneer Health aims to address industry challenges such as claims processing, information exchange, and provider directories, building on a prior collaboration announced in 2019. The company, launching as a standalone business, will debut at HIMSS21 and seeks to eliminate inefficiencies in the American healthcare system through its member-based utility network.

title: Remote work unwind: Goldman spearheads Wall St return to office
summary: Goldman Sachs is leading a push for Wall Street employees to return to the office, requiring nearly all New York staff back from Monday, June 14, 2021. This contrasts with other firms like Citigroup, which are offering more flexibility and hybrid models. The varying approaches are causing both optimism for the city's economy and anxiety among employees regarding fairness, flexibility, and career impact.

title: American Express puts Kabbage acquisition to work with card company's first checking account
summary: American Express is launching its first checking account for small businesses, called Kabbage Checking, utilizing technology acquired from online lender Kabbage. This no-fee digital account offers 1.1% interest on balances up to $100,000 and includes features like mobile check deposits and a debit card. The move aims to expand AmEx's offerings beyond its traditional card products and compete in the growing small business banking sector.

title: Internal Morgan Stanley Memo Outlines New Roles for E*Trade Execs
summary: Morgan Stanley is reassigning nine former E*Trade executives to new roles across various functions like marketing, client experience, and strategic development following its acquisition. Key appointments include Chad Turner leading the Digital Direct group and Andrea Zaretsky becoming CMO of the wealth management division, while Alice Milligan is promoted to CMO of Morgan Stanley. This strategic move aims to integrate E*Trade's talent and leverage collective skills as Morgan Stanley navigates the evolving financial landscape.

title: JPMorgan Partners With UNCF To Provide 75 HBCU Students With Scholarships
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co has partnered with the United Negro College Fund (UNCF) to establish the J.P. Morgan Chase Wealth Management HBCU Scholarship, providing support for 75 HBCU students. The scholarship aims to help students interested in financial planning, offering a one-time $2,000 scholarship and the opportunity for internships which could lead to an additional $5,000 scholarship. This initiative is part of JPMorgan Chase's $30 billion commitment over five years to promote economic opportunities for Black and Latinx communities.

title: Moody's keeps stable view on banks in China
summary: Moody's Investors Service maintains a stable outlook on China's banking sector, citing the solid asset quality of Chinese lenders and the economy's sustained recovery from the COVID-19 pandemic. The firm upgraded the ratings outlook for several regional commercial lenders from negative to stable, but also highlighted potential long-term risks associated with the uncertain technological implementation of the green transformation. The banking sector has been proactively addressing credit risk, with significant disposal of nonperforming loans.

title: Funds Managed by Affiliates of Apollo Global Management to Acquire Total Operations and Production Services (TOPS) from Black Bay Energy Capital
summary: Funds managed by affiliates of Apollo Global Management, Inc. have acquired a majority interest in Total Operations and Production Services (TOPS) from Black Bay Energy Capital. TOPS is a leading provider of contract gas compression services with a focus on electric-driven systems, and this investment will help accelerate its growth in the Permian Basin. The acquisition highlights a strategic move towards environmentally friendly and low-emission solutions in the oil and gas industry.

title: DAEV S.A.
summary: DAEV S.A. customers using Banco Bradesco's internet banking and app may experience difficulties paying their water and sewage bills due to system intermittencies. This issue, identified on June 7th and 8th, persists, causing messages like "invalid billet" or "unauthorized." Banco Bradesco is working to resolve the problem, and DAEV suggests alternative payment methods such as other partner banks (Itaú, Banco do Brasil, Santander, Caixa) or lottery houses.

title: CVRx is going the IPO route
summary: CVRx plans an Initial Public Offering (IPO) to raise up to $75 million to further commercialize its neuromodulation device for heart treatment. The company, based in Brooklyn Park, Minn., plans to trade on the Nasdaq under the symbol CVRX, with major underwriters including J.P. Morgan and Piper Sandler. CVRx's FDA-approved Barostim Neo, which brought in $6 million in sales for 2019 and 2020, addresses a $2.9 billion opportunity in heart failure treatment.

title: CLEAR Secure, Inc. Files Registration Statement for Proposed Initial Public Offering
summary: CLEAR Secure, Inc. announced the filing of a Form S-1 registration statement with the SEC for a proposed initial public offering of its Class A common stock. The company intends to list its Class A common stock on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol "YOU". Goldman Sachs & Co. LLC, J.P. Morgan Securities LLC, Allen & Company LLC, and Wells Fargo Securities, LLC are acting as lead underwriters for the offering.

title: Xometry Announces Filing of Registration Statement for Proposed Initial Public Offering
summary: Xometry, Inc., a leading AI-enabled marketplace for on-demand manufacturing, announced the filing of a Form S-1 registration statement with the SEC for a proposed initial public offering of its Class A common stock. The company intends to list its Class A common stock on The Nasdaq Global Select Market under the symbol “XMTR.” Goldman Sachs & Co. LLC, J.P. Morgan, and UBS Investment Bank will serve as joint lead book-running managers.

title: What you missed this week in wealth management: May 31-June 4
summary: This article provides a weekly roundup of significant news in wealth management. Key updates include LPL Financial joining the Fortune 500, Bob Doll's new role at Crossmark Global Investments, and various advisor moves and firm expansions. Also covered are state initiatives for 529 college savings scholarships related to COVID vaccines and new wealthtech compliance tools.

title: State Street CEO Puts Personal Politics Ahead Of Investors And Clients
summary: The article criticizes State Street CEO Ronald O'Hanley for asserting that ESG investing is value-based and objective, arguing that State Street's ESG decisions are politically driven and do not align with investors' preferences. Author Scott Shepard contends that State Street Global Advisors' research uncritically accepts left-wing assumptions, potentially creating conflict of interest and legal liability. The piece suggests that State Street's ESG stance reflects the personal politics of its executives rather than a neutral assessment of long-term company value.

title: Lisa Pollina to step down as Non-Exec Director of IG Group
summary: Lisa Pollina has informed the Board of electronic trading major IG Group Holdings plc of her intention to step down as a Non-Executive Director on September 1, 2021. Pollina currently serves as an investment adviser to Ares Management and a Non-Executive Director of Munich RE, bringing extensive experience from her previous roles at RBC Capital Markets and Bank of America Securities. Her career also includes serving on various public and private corporate Boards and contributing to the Federal Reserve Bank's Working Group on Financial Markets.

title: Gum may not stick at Mondelez
summary: Mondelez International, Inc. has placed its gum business, including brands like Bubblicious and Trident, under strategic review. The company aims to restore the business to pre-COVID sales levels before deciding its future, as the category has been hit hard by the pandemic. Mondelez is also actively reshaping its portfolio through acquisitions in snacking and divesting from coffee assets.

title: JAKKS Pacific Announces Successful Completion of Debt Refinancing
summary: JAKKS Pacific, Inc. announced the successful refinancing of its existing term loan facility with a new facility from Benefit Street Partners L.L.C. and a new asset-based revolving credit facility with JP Morgan Chase. This refinancing extends debt maturities, reduces projected annual interest expense by over $5 million, and increases financial flexibility. The move is aimed at enhancing the company's ability to invest in growth and drive shareholder value.

title: STERIS Completes $4.6B Deal for Cantel Medical
summary: STERIS plc has successfully completed its $4.6 billion acquisition of Cantel Medical, a global provider of infection prevention products and services. The acquisition expands STERIS’s product and service offerings, global reach, and customer base by integrating Cantel's expertise in endoscopy, dental, dialysis, and life sciences markets. The deal is expected to create more value for customers, employees, and shareholders of the combined entity.

title: Circa Resort and Casino Standardizes on Aruba to Deliver Transcendent Guest Experiences
summary: Circa Resort and Casino has standardized on an Aruba ESP-based network to provide unique and immersive guest experiences. The new downtown Las Vegas hotel deployed Aruba's wired, wireless, and security solutions to power massive HD displays, a large sportsbook, connected in-room experiences, and the Garage Mahal transportation hub, while also achieving significant cost savings. The partnership highlights Aruba's comprehensive and automated networking solutions for complex hospitality environments.

title: Venn Closes $100M in Total Funding to Grow Real-World
summary: Venn, a neighborhood-focused platform and experience company, has closed a $60M Series B funding round, bringing its total funding to $100M. The new capital will be used to expand teams, partnerships, and US operations following 1,200 percent growth in 2020. Venn aims to foster a sense of belonging in neighborhoods and has demonstrated significant success in increasing resident retention.

title: Meet Pegasystems, a tech company that has teamed up with the Ryder Cup
summary: Pegasystems, a technology company specializing in "software that crushes complexity," has partnered with the Ryder Cup as an official supplier for the 2021 and 2023 events. The partnership aims to increase brand awareness for Pegasystems, which creates software used by large corporations and government agencies, by connecting with clients and enhancing the Ryder Cup experience through technology, similar to IBM's work with the Masters. The company hopes to leverage the global nature of the Ryder Cup to promote its brand in its 27 operating countries.

title: ‘New Black Wall Street’: Closing wealth gap a century after Tulsa
summary: A tech-based financial literacy startup, New Black Wall Street LLC, aims to empower Black Americans economically, a century after the Tulsa race massacre. The company focuses on increasing FICO credit scores, promoting cryptocurrency investment, and educating two million children in financial literacy by 2030, striving to close the significant wealth gap that persists for Black households in the US. They promote initiatives like "100 For 100" for Bitcoin investment and plan to launch their own crypto coin and NFT marketplace.

title: Arch Capital Names Christine Todd CIO
summary: Arch Capital Group has appointed Christine Todd as its new chief investment officer, effective June 7, to oversee the firm's $26 billion investment portfolio. She succeeds W. Preston Hutchings, who is retiring after more than 15 years. Todd brings extensive experience from Amundi US, Neighborly Investments, and Standish Mellon Asset Management Company.

title: What are the banks snapping up 90 of HSBC’s branches in America?
summary: HSBC is selling 90 of its US retail bank branches to Citizens Bank and Cathay Bank as part of its strategy to exit mass-market retail banking in the US and focus on wealthy clients and international corporations, particularly in Asia. Citizens Bank is a long-standing US financial institution, while Cathay Bank is a large bank founded by Chinese Americans, and this acquisition will expand their existing footprints. The move reflects HSBC's pivot to growing markets in Asia, shifting capital from underperforming businesses in the US and Europe.

title: What are Citizens Bank and Cathay Bank, the buyers of more than 90 of HSBC's US branches?
summary: HSBC is exiting its US retail banking business for mass-market customers and small businesses, selling 90 branches to Citizens Bank and Cathay Bank. Citizens Bank will acquire 80 branches on the East Coast, focusing on expanding its presence in major metropolitan areas, while Cathay Bank will take over 10 branches on the West Coast to broaden its California network. This strategic move allows HSBC to concentrate on wealthy clients and international corporations, shifting resources to higher-growth markets in Asia.

title: Hong Kong Bourse Offers Record Base Salary to New CEO
summary: Nicolas Aguzin, the new CEO of Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing Ltd. (HKEX), will receive a record base annual salary of HK$10 million ($1.29 million), the highest paid to its head since the company's listing in 2000. This compensation package, which includes additional performance-related bonuses and share awards, reflects the responsibilities of leading a key part of Asia's financial infrastructure. Aguzin, a former JPMorgan Chase executive, is HKEX's first non-Chinese CEO and emphasized Hong Kong's competitive position as a global financial center.

title: Temasek-backed Flywire valued at $3.4 bln in U.S. market debut
summary: Payments firm Flywire Corp, backed by Temasek Holdings, made its Nasdaq debut with a valuation of $3.39 billion, significantly higher than its previous funding round valuation. The company's shares opened at $34, above the IPO price of $24. Flywire specializes in payments for education, healthcare, and travel sectors and processed $7.5 billion in payments last year.

title: GrafTech International announces secondary offering of 20 million shares by existing stockholder
summary: GrafTech International announced that existing shareholder Brookfield Asset Management plans to offer 20 million GrafTech common shares in a secondary offering. GrafTech itself will not be offering any shares and Brookfield will receive all net proceeds. The announcement comes after GrafTech reported positive first-quarter financial results, including improved net income and revenue, and reduced long-term debt.

title: Goldman Sachs Adds Kimberley Harris as Sixth Woman on Board of Directors
summary: Goldman Sachs announced the appointment of media lawyer Kimberley Harris to its board of directors, increasing the number of women on its board to six out of thirteen. This move aligns with the financial industry's growing push for diversity and Goldman's internal targets to elevate women into senior leadership roles. Harris brings extensive experience from NBCUniversal, Comcast Corporation, and government service to her new position.

title: Fincrime Briefing: Congress scrutinizes Deutsche Bank on AML, fines fuel EU de-risking, malware hijacks crypto blockchain, and more
summary: This Fincrime Briefing covers several key financial crime topics including a U.S. congressional probe into Deutsche Bank's AML controls, a wave of EU bank fines leading to de-risking, and a new malware strain hijacking Bitcoin's blockchain for resilience. The article details instances of alleged money laundering, the impact of regulatory crackdowns on banks' willingness to engage with high-risk regions, and the evolving tactics of cybercriminals using decentralized networks.
source: Association of Certified Financial Crime Specialists
source_domain: Association of Certified Financial Crime Specialists

title: Wealthsimple opens a new door for halal investors in Canada
summary: Wealthsimple has launched Canada's first sharia-compliant ETF, the Wealthsimple Sharia World Equity Index ETF (WSHR), making halal investing more accessible for Canadians. This new offering is seen as an important step by advisors like Jesse Reitberger of Canadian Islamic Wealth, addressing the limited and expensive sharia-compliant investment options previously available. While Reitberger remains cautiously optimistic, he emphasizes the need for WSHR to establish a strong track record before full recommendation to clients, although he acknowledges its potential to fill a significant market need.

title: Investors are slurping up Oatly stock in the oat-milk company’s Nasdaq debut
summary: Oatly Group AB, the oat-milk company, saw its shares jump over 28% in its Nasdaq debut, signaling strong investor interest in dairy alternatives. The Swedish firm raised $1.43 billion in its IPO, pricing shares at $17, and highlighted its products' environmental benefits. Despite reporting losses due to growth-focused investments, Oatly's revenue more than doubled in 2020.

title: Morgan Stanley names co-presidents, sets up Gorman succession race
summary: Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman announced a series of executive promotions, naming Ted Pick and Andy Saperstein as co-presidents, signaling a potential succession race for his position. These changes are part of Gorman's plan for leadership evolution, though he intends to remain CEO for at least three more years. The moves follow a strong year for Morgan Stanley, marked by major acquisitions like E*Trade and Eaton Vance, which significantly increased its assets under management.

title: Morgan Stanley defies bank diversity trend
summary: Morgan Stanley recently announced significant leadership changes, positioning a slate of potential successors to CEO James Gorman that is predominantly white and male, contrasting with JPMorgan Chase & Co.'s recent moves to promote women to senior roles. This decision has sparked criticism regarding diversity in leadership, despite Morgan Stanley's spokesperson stating a commitment to diverse talent and the presence of qualified women and people of color on their operating committee. The article highlights that while some progress has been made across Wall Street, top jobs continue to be primarily held by white men, prompting calls from activists and former employees for more substantial change.

title: JPMorgan Chase Launches In-House Healthcare Company, Morgan Health
summary: JPMorgan Chase has launched its own healthcare company, Morgan Health, after the dissolution of its joint venture with Amazon and Berkshire Hathaway. The new unit will focus on improving medical care for the banking giant's 165,000 employees and their families, with an initial investment of $250 million earmarked for promising healthcare solutions. JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon stated the goal is to address long-standing healthcare issues and achieve significant improvements.

title: JPMorgan launching business arm to address cost, quality of employer healthcare
summary: JPMorgan Chase is launching a new business arm called Morgan Health to address the cost and quality of employer-sponsored healthcare, building on lessons learned from its dissolved Haven venture with Amazon and Berkshire Hathaway. JPMorgan plans to invest $250 million in healthcare solutions, initially focusing on its own employees before aiming to serve as a model for other employers. Morgan Health will partner with healthcare organizations, including CVS Health, to enhance care options and boost health equity.

title: Check out Carlyle Finance LLC's stock price (CGABL) in real time
summary: This article provides real-time stock price information for Carlyle Finance LLC (CGABL), including its latest quote, volume, 52-week range, and key financial stats. It also lists recent news and analyst insights related to Carlyle, along with company profile details.

title: JPMorgan Shakes Up the Race to Succeed Jamie Dimon (Published 2021)
summary: JPMorgan Chase announced a major management shuffle, making Marianne Lake and Jennifer Piepszak joint heads of the consumer and community bank, solidifying their positions as potential successors to CEO Jamie Dimon. This unusual co-leadership sets up a competitive test for the top job, with experts debating its effectiveness but acknowledging it as a challenging proving ground for the CEO role. The changes also mean Gordon Smith's retirement and Daniel Pinto becoming sole president and COO, with Jeremy Barnum as the new CFO.

title: JPMorgan Chase Promotes Potential Dimon Successors To Co-Lead Consumer Business—Marianne Lake
summary: JPMorgan Chase has promoted Marianne Lake and Jennifer Piepszak to co-lead the bank's consumer operations, a significant business segment accounting for nearly 40% of the company's profits. This move positions the two women as potential successors to CEO Jamie Dimon, who has hinted at stepping down in the future. Marianne Lake, a long-time JPMorgan executive and former CFO, has been a prominent figure in the banking industry and is recognized for her leadership and financial acumen.

title: Ana Botin and Andrea Orcel come face to face in Santander court battle
summary: A court battle has begun in Madrid between Santander chairman Ana Botín and former UBS banker Andrea Orcel over Santander's decision to not hire Orcel as CEO. Botín argued that Orcel never received a formal contract because terms were still being discussed, while Orcel is suing for tens of millions of euros in lost pay. The case was paused after UBS witnesses failed to appear.

title: In the race to succeed Dimon, two women emerge at front of pack
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. has announced a leadership overhaul that positions Marianne Lake and Jennifer Piepszak as co-heads of its consumer and community banking business, making them leading contenders to succeed CEO Jamie Dimon. Both women have strong backgrounds within the bank, with Lake having been CFO and Piepszak charting a rapid ascent including her own tenure as CFO, and have proven themselves during the challenges of the coronavirus pandemic. This move is seen as a significant step in the long-anticipated succession plan for Dimon, who has led JPMorgan since 2005.

title: JPMorgan Achieves Carbon Neutrality in Operations, Sets Carbon Reduction Financing Targets for High Emitting Sectors
summary: JPMorgan Chase announced it achieved carbon neutrality in its operations for 2020 and established new 2030 carbon intensity targets for high-emitting sectors like Oil & Gas, Electric Power, and Auto Manufacturing. These targets are part of its commitment to align financing activities with the Paris Agreement and facilitate $2.5 trillion in sustainable finance over the next decade. The company also outlined new sustainability goals for its own operations, including reducing greenhouse gas emissions and water consumption.

title: JPMorgan’s strong wellness foundation made pandemic transitions easier
summary: JPMorgan Chase leveraged its existing robust wellness programs, including mental health and childcare initiatives, to effectively navigate the challenges posed by the pandemic. The company's three-pillar foundation focusing on health, balance (emotional wellbeing and family support), and finance provided a strong framework for expanding benefits and supporting its 260,000 employees during a stressful period. These proactive measures allowed JPMorgan to adapt quickly and maintain employee wellbeing despite the unprecedented circumstances.

title: JPMorgan Chase Names Jeremy Barnum CFO
summary: JPMorgan Chase has appointed Jeremy Barnum as its new finance chief, following Jennifer Piepszak's move to co-head the consumer and community banking business. Barnum previously served as head of global research for the corporate and investment bank and before that as CFO of CIB. This reshuffling also includes other key leadership changes, with Piepszak and Marianne Lake now co-leading the CCB business, which generated over $50 billion in revenues last year.

title: Bank of America to Raise U.S. Minimum Hourly Wage to $25 by 2025 - WSJ
summary: Bank of America announced plans to increase its hourly minimum wage to $25 by 2025, which would position it above its major banking counterparts and help address worker shortages. Furthermore, the bank will require all its U.S. vendors to pay employees dedicated to the bank at least $15 an hour. This move aligns with broader discussions around minimum wage increases and their economic impact.

title: JPMorgan Chase names 2 women to run bank’s biggest division, possible successors to CEO Jamie Dimon
summary: JPMorgan Chase announced the promotion of Marianne Lake and Jennifer Piepszak to co-CEOs of the bank's consumer finance division, its largest business. This move is seen as a strong indication that CEO Jamie Dimon, who plans to retire, is considering a woman to lead the company. Gordon Smith, the current head of the division, will retire at the end of the year.

title: 4 Firms Rep $43B AT&T, Discovery Reverse Morris Trust Deal
summary: Four law firms advised on the $43 billion reverse Morris trust deal between AT&T and Discovery Inc., which will combine AT&T's WarnerMedia assets with Discovery. The transaction involves entertainment, sports, and news assets. The article lists the law firms and companies involved in this significant media merger.

title: Personalities of Pittsburgh: John H. Montgomery on becoming CEO at Community Bank during the pandemic
summary: John H. Montgomery became CEO of Community Bank (CB Financial Services Inc.) during the pandemic, a significant leadership change. The article discusses his Pittsburgh ties and his perspective on the evolving banking landscape. It also includes related articles concerning local bank activities in the Pittsburgh area.

title: Top Ally exec in Charlotte to take new role with Live Oak Bank
summary: Ally Financial Inc.'s former chief digital officer is transitioning into a similar role at Live Oak Bancshares Inc. This move involves a top Ally executive in Charlotte taking on a new position with Live Oak Bank.

title: Howard Hughes Corp. Secures $83M Loan for Maryland Apartments
summary: Howard Hughes Corp. has secured an $82.6 million construction loan for Marlow Apartments, a 472-unit community in Columbia, Md. JLL Capital Markets helped secure the loan for the development, which will also include retail space and is part of the larger 14-million-square-foot Merriweather District master-planned development. Marlow Apartments represents Howard Hughes Corp.'s fifth development in the Merriweather District micro market, with delivery expected in Fall 2022.

title: US Bank and Plaid ink data sharing deal
summary: US Bank has partnered with Plaid to enable its customers to securely connect their accounts to third-party financial apps. This integration provides an API-based, credential-less open finance experience, allowing customers to share data with thousands of fintechs while maintaining control over permissions through both US Bank My Controls and Plaid Portal. The collaboration highlights a move towards more secure and transparent digital financial ecosystems through API adoption.

title: Vera Therapeutics Announces Pricing of Initial Public Offering
summary: Vera Therapeutics announced the pricing of its initial public offering of 4,350,000 shares of Class A common stock at $11.00 per share, expecting gross proceeds of $47.85 million. The shares are set to begin trading on the Nasdaq Global Market under the ticker symbol “VERA” on May 14, 2021. The offering is managed by Jefferies LLC, Cowen and Company, LLC, and Evercore Group L.L.C.

title: JPMorgan Is America’s Largest Company In 2021, But Amazon Is Rising In The Ranks
summary: Despite a pandemic, America's largest companies grew significantly in 2021, with JPMorgan Chase maintaining its position as the largest for the third consecutive year. Meanwhile, Amazon climbed into the top five, reflecting the growing importance of e-commerce, while traditional giants like AT&T and ExxonMobil saw significant drops in rankings. This year's Global 2000 ranking illustrates the resilience and shifts within the U.S. corporate landscape amidst economic volatility.

title: Peter Thiel, Alan Howard, Richard Li invest in new crypto exchange Bullish
summary: Block.one, backed by billionaires Peter Thiel, Alan Howard, and Louis Bacon, is launching a new crypto exchange called Bullish. Bullish aims to combine traditional exchange attributes with decentralized finance benefits, capitalized by Block.one with approximately $10 billion in digital assets and cash. The exchange secured an additional $300 million in a funding round, attracting prominent investors like Richard Li, Christian Angermayer, Michael Novogratz’s Galaxy Digital, and Nomura Holdings.

title: Similarweb completes NYSE IPO, at $1.6b valuation
summary: Israeli web behavior and traffic analytics company Similarweb completed its Initial Public Offering (IPO) on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) at $22 per share, above the pricing range. The company raised $165 million, valuing it at $1.6 billion, with potential to rise to $1.7 billion. Similarweb, founded in 2007, developed a platform for understanding online behavior and reported revenue of $107 million for the 12 months ending March 31, with a net loss of $22 million in 2020.

title: JPMorgan Names Two CIOs
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. has created a new Chief Information Officer position to focus on technology for its internal workforce, promoting James Reid to fill the role. Reid will serve as CIO of the bank's new employee experience and corporate technology organization, making him the company's first Black CIO. The appointment is effective immediately.

title: Clients most satisfied at Ameriprise, Ed Jones, Merrill: Report
summary: A report by consumer research firm Hearts & Wallets surveyed nearly 6,000 U.S. investors and found Ameriprise, Edward Jones, and Merrill Lynch ranked highest in customer satisfaction. The study also revealed that most clients have little understanding of how they pay for financial services, despite pricing being a top concern. State Farm and USAA were noted for strong "unbiased" service, while T. Rowe Price was recognized for making clients money.

title: ADP National Employment Report: Private Sector Employment Increased by 742,000 Jobs in April
summary: The ADP National Employment Report indicates that private sector employment increased by 742,000 jobs in April 2021, showing continued acceleration and growth in the labor market. The service-providing sector led job growth, with significant gains in leisure/hospitality, while overall employment remains over 8 million jobs short of pre-COVID-19 levels. This report is produced by the ADP Research Institute in collaboration with Moody's Analytics, using actual payroll data.

title: Goldman Sachs Tells Employees To Return To The Office By July 14, As Wall Street Pushes Back On The Work-From-Home Trend
summary: Goldman Sachs is requiring employees to return to the office by July 14, with CEO David Solomon calling remote work an "aberration" unsuitable for their collaborative culture. This move follows similar mandates from other major financial institutions like JPMorgan and Citigroup, as Wall Street leadership pushes for a return to in-person work, emphasizing benefits like increased productivity, spontaneous collaboration, and client interaction. The decision comes amidst improving COVID-19 vaccination rates and easing restrictions, though exceptions will be made for regions severely impacted by the virus.

title: ACT IPO News - Mortgage insurance spinoff Enact Holdings sets terms for $497 million IPO
summary: Enact Holdings, a mortgage insurance company being spun out of Genworth Financial, announced terms for its $497 million IPO. The company plans to offer 22.6 million shares at a price range of $20 to $24, valuing the company at $3.6 billion at the midpoint. Enact, which is a leading private mortgage insurance provider in the US, generated $1.1 billion in sales for the 12 months ended December 31, 2020, and is expected to list on Nasdaq under the symbol ACT.

title: Similarweb files to raise $150m on NYSE at $1.5b valuation
summary: Similarweb, an Israeli web behavior and traffic analytics company, has filed for an Initial Public Offering (IPO) on the New York Stock Exchange to raise $150 million at a $1.5 billion valuation. The company plans to issue 7.5 million shares at $19-$21 per share. Founder and CEO Or Offer will sell 500,000 shares worth $10 million, retaining a 7.5% stake post-IPO.

title: Jamie Dimon, fed up with Zoom calls and remote work, says commuting to offices will make a comeback
summary: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon expressed his frustration with remote work and Zoom calls, stating that he expects a full return to office commuting by the fall of 2021. While acknowledging some flexibility, Dimon believes physical presence is crucial for younger employees, client relationships, and spontaneous idea generation. He cited instances where JPMorgan lost business because rivals' bankers visited clients in person while his did not.

title: Berkshire's Annual Meeting: What to Expect From Buffett & Co.
summary: The 2021 Berkshire Hathaway annual meeting, held virtually from Los Angeles, features Warren Buffett and Charlie Munger answering shareholder questions. Key topics expected include Berkshire's pared-back bank stock investments, Buffett's skepticism on Bitcoin, and the company's share buyback strategy. The meeting occurs as Berkshire Hathaway shares are near record highs, though the company's long-term performance has lagged the S&P 500.

title: Ping An in Talks for Partial Stake in Credit Suisse’s Chinese Partner
summary: Ping An Insurance Group Co. is in discussions to acquire a majority stake, ranging from 51.1% to 70%, in the newly-established Founder Group. This deal could be worth between 37.05 billion yuan and 50.75 billion yuan ($7.9 billion). The acquisition would include significant assets such as Founder Securities Co., Founder Technology Group Corp., and China Hi-Tech Group Co.

title: KeyBank recruits JPMorgan Chase veteran to lead its wealth management businesses
summary: KeyBank has hired Joe Skarda, a veteran from JPMorgan Chase & Co., to lead its wealth management businesses as president of KeyBank Wealth Management. Skarda will oversee Key Private Bank, Key Family Wealth, and Key Investment Services, which collectively manage significant assets. His role will focus on driving growth through a relationship-focused model for mass affluent, high net worth, and ultra-high net worth clients.

title: JPMorgan chief signals it’s back to the office for US bankers
authors: Hannah Levitt and Natalie Wong and Bloomberg
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. became the first major U.S. bank to mandate a return to offices for its entire U.S. workforce, with staffers expected back by early July on a consistent rotational schedule. Employee rotations will be subject to a 50 percent occupancy cap, and COVID-19 vaccinations will not be required for staff to return, though they are strongly encouraged. CEO Jamie Dimon anticipates a significant drop in the bank’s real estate needs, moving towards a hybrid work model with 60 seats for every 100 employees.
